are generated. The design is based on the current Danish Road Regulations. 
Workflow and the affected subjects can be described as follows: After evaluation of 
four different proposals to the roads horizontal and vertical location, one particular 
solution is chosen and will be worked on further. Asphalt and cross section elements 
of the roads are chosen. Quantity of soil that is removed/added in the construction 
process is calculated on the whole. Nodes on the route linking it with existing roads 
are determined. Location, type and form of these are to be determined as are the 
design of ramps and connections to existing roads. Intersecting roads are looked 
upon and will be placed either under or over the new bypass road. Bicycle paths 
along the road will be accounted for. General principles about drainage of surface 
water are discussed and preliminary proposals for locations of detention ponds are 
made. Road surface markings are presented as well as a proposal for the location of 
safety barriers along the roads. Eventually, a 3D model is generated and used for 
visualization of the project.
The Northern bypass road is planned as a highly classified 2 + 1 road with the 
possibility of expanding it to a 2 + 2 road in the future. There was a strong emphasis 
on this. Along the new route there are to be constructed two interchanges that ensure 
grade separation of the traffic streams. The first junction, which connects the bypass

fields.title: The ice cap hotel
Anlægning af spildevandsanlæg i Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
This report examines the possibilities of constructing a sewage treatment plant in Sisimiut, 
Greenland. It has been investigated which methods are most suitable for the arctic climate, and 
which methods are most economically suitable. 
The grounds for the project is found in previous environmental studies. Through a matching of 
expectations with the municipality in Sisimiut and a stakeholder analysis, it is attempted to get an 
insight into what the situation is like now, and into the wishes for the future in the wastewater area. 
On the basis of this, a social assessment of what is needed and what solutions are most realistic has 
been designed. The environmental studies have shown that Ulkebugten is the most vulnerable 
recipient.
Since Greenland does not currently have any legislation on the area, the EU's emission standards 
are used as a guideline, since the EU and Denmark are Greenland's closest collaborators this is a 
reasonable comparison. EU's emission standards classify Ulkebugten as a sensitive recipient, and 
the effluent should therefore, as a minimum, be cleaned by mechanical and chemical methods. The 
recipient at “chokoladefabrikken” is classified as less sensitive. 
Several possible solutions has been considered, but the following three have been selected for further 
investigation:
Option 1: A single wastewater treatment plant is established as underground plant located by 
Ulkebugten. The solution includes simple mechanical cleaning at the smaller outlets, and a transport 
and pumping pipeline from “chokoladefrbrikken” to Ulkebugten. 
Option 2: A single wastewater treatment plant is established in a building at “chokoladefabrikken”. 
The solution includes simple mechanical cleaning at the smaller outlets, and a transport and pumping 
pipeline from Ulkebugten the chocolate factory. 
Option 3: Two treatment plants are established; one in a building at “chokoladefabrikken”, and one as 
an underground plant by Ulkebugten. The solution includes simple mechanical cleaning at the 
smaller outlets. 
All solutions are designed so that the EU's emission standards are respected. 
For each of the selected solutions an economic consideration in the form of sketch perspective, 
preliminary estimate, and operating budgets has been done. The results of these estimates have been 
compared in order to find the cheapest solution here and now, and “total economics” has been 
applied in order to assess which of the solutions that will prove to be the most ecconomicly viable 
in the long run. 
With a lifespan of 30 years, it is found that the most economically advantageous solution is option 
2.

fields.title: Modeling of groundwater flows and saline effects in permafrost affected areas
fields.abstract:
A hydrological model of the Itinneq area (west Greenland) is established with the aim of
investigating the origin of the observed salt in the sediments of the river basin. The hy-drological model is a three dimensional MIKE SHE model in which the overland flow, the
unsaturated zone flow (infiltration) and saturated zone flow is modelled. One of the original
hypotheses is that the tides that migrate up the Itinneq river with a interval of one day may
supply salt to the sediments. However, the model shows that the river in all probability has
no significant influence on the salt concentration in the sediments. Instead, the salt is most
likely marine in origin, and has been partly washed out by infiltrating precipitation that flows
down from the surrounding cliffs.
To acquire input data for the model, field work was undertaken with the aim of studying the
presence of permafrost in the area and obtaining soil samples for subsequent laboratory tests.
These laboratory tests included CRS-tests, salinity measurements and laser diffractometry.
The field work showed that permafrost is widespread in the area, as it is found both in the
eastern part and the western part. The laboratory tests showed that the subsurface of the area
consists primarily of a clayey silt with very low hydraulic conductivity and that the sediments
and the groundwater contains a relatively high concentration of salt.
fields.comment: picture of where sample are taken

fields.title: Test-sites roads in Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
Roads in Arctic environment are exposed to more severe atmospheric conditions than the roads 
in the rest of the world. Therefore, it is very important to test new methods of construction in order to 
improve traditional methods that are not useful in this kind of environment. Nowadays, there are many 
methods used that can successfully avoid rutting and cracking. Both construction failures are the most 
common problems in the roads. 
 
During this report, it will be developed two different projects which are taking part in Sisimiut. 
The first one consists on a study over the pavement flexibility and performance against the overheating in 
the summer time. The study is carried out by four sections composed by different materials (Flint, SBS 
compounds and a reference pavement) where a strain gauge device is installed below the asphalt layer to 
obtain results about the deformation of the pavement under a big dynamic load. Also the temperature 
will be analyzed, to understand the behavior of the calcine flint comparing with the other sections. 
 
The second project consists on the analysis of three kinds of embankments which were built to 
isolate the permafrost layer underneath them and avoid the melting of it. With this, it will be able to 
avoid  the  deformation  produced  by  the  settlement  due  to  this  phenomenon.  There  are  three 
embankments  built  with  three  different  methods.  The  first  one  consists  in  a  Light  Expanded  Clay 
Aggregate (LECA), the next one with Air Convection Embankment method (ACE) and finally a control 
embankment to compare the results between them. The temperatures at different depths will be studied 
to observe the performances of the embankments throughout all year.

fields.title: Small Sustainable Energy Systems for Tourist Cabins in Greenland
fields.abstract:
Generating electricity can be done by many methods. Oil and coal are the
most common fuels, used for electricity production. When looking at gen-erators for micro stand-alone systems, diesel is the most used fuel. With
an increased focus on emission of CO
2
and the following implications, alter-native methods of energy production are in constant development. In the
fragile arctic regions, the implication of an increased global temperature is
seen and therefore, sustainable energy solutions are of great interest.
Greenland is characterized by a dispersed population, living in small vil-lage communities, separated by great distances, which makes it unfeasible
to make grid connection between them. The electricity generation therefore
comes primarily from diesel fuel.
Wind and solar energy are two well known sources to electricity genera-tion, where there is no CO
2
emission during the production of energy. These
methods are used in many applications, from large solar plants and wind
farms, to micro systems with an installed capacity of a few hundred watts.
The purpose of this project is to look on the potential in using these known
methods, to act as the primary source of energy, to a tourist cabin designed
for the arctic environment. Since there are no other sources than wind or
solar energy, lead-acid batteries are used as energy storage.
The project is based on a system, that has been prepared and tested at DTU.
After this, the system was installed in the town Uummannaq in Greenland.
Data collection was done, which was later used as a reference for the energy
system to the tourist cabin. This report presents the test results and the
first results from the installation in Greenland. Data provided by DMI is
used to estimate the expected energy production from the solar/wind sys-tem.
The first results from the installation showed a larger energy production
from the solar panels, than estimated. The wind turbine performed much
lower than estimated, which was primarily due to the siting, which gave poor
conditions for optimum wind flow. The installed capacity was estimated to
deliver 267kWh, based on weather data from 2008. The estimations pointed
at an uneven energy production, with the maximum production occurring
during the winter months.

fields.title: Forekomst og udbredelse af antibiotikaresistens hos bakterier fra ulke, blåmuslinger og sediment i relation til udledning af spildvand i Ulkebugten, Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
In the second largest town in Greenland, Sisimiut, untreated wastewater is discharged directly into the 
bay,  Ulkebugten.  Wastewater  is  also  discharged  into  the  bay from the hospital’s sewage outlet. This 
sewage  contains  antibiotics,  antibiotic  resistant  organisms  and  human  pathogens.  The  discharge  of 
antibiotics to the  marine environment would  kill non-resistant bacteria,  which  can lead to the  devel-opment  of  antibiotic  resistance  in  bacteria. Antibiotic  resistance  can  be  transmitted  by  vertical  and 
horizontal gene transfer. Resistant bacteria can spread to sediments and organisms in the water. The 
governing  processes  of  the  fate  of  an  antibiotic in  the aquatic  environment  are  water flows, sorption 
and  degradability.  However,  there  is  limited  knowledge  on  these  processes,  under  the  conditions  in 
Ulkebugten. 
The occurrence and  distribution  of  antibiotic  resistance  in Ulkebugten is in  this  project examined  by 
taking samples from five different sites in Ulkebugten. One  of  the  sites is located by the  hospitals se-wage outlet and another by Frederik VII Island, which is considered as a reference site. The three re-maining sites are positioned between the hospital and Frederik VII Island. Bacteria from blue mussels’ 
hepatopancreas, gut bacteria from sculpins and sediment bacteria are used to test for antibiotic resis-tance. All three sample types are tested for three different antibiotics used at the hospital. Benzylpeni-cillin  is  a  natural  antibiotic,  which  acts  against  Gram-positive  cells.  Amoxicillin  and  Ciprofloxacin  are 
respectively  semi-synthetic  and synthetic  produced  and  are  both  broad-spectrum  antibiotics  that  act 
against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative cells. Besides carrying out a survey of resistance for the 
three antibiotics, a pilot study is made for Roxithromycin resistance.  
The number of bacteria is increasing from the hospital towards Frederik VII Island, which indicates a 
connection between the occurrence of bacteria and the presence of antibiotics in Ulkebugten. In gen-eral there is an insignificant occurrence of resistance towards Ciprofloxacin on all locations and in all 
sample types, and no connection can be made between the resistance and the discharge from the hos-pital. For Benzylpenicillin and Amoxicillin, the occurrence of resistance is in general largest at the hos-pital and decreases towards Frederik VII Island. This indicates that there is a connection between the 
discharge from the hospital and the occurrence of resistance towards Benzylpenicillin and Amoxicillin. 
Most  resistance  towards Benzylpenicillin is  found in  bacteria  from  blue mussels,  while  resistance  to-wards Amoxicillin is of greatest extent in gut bacteria from sculpins. The differences between the oc-currence of resistance in the sculpins and mussels can be caused by different composition of bacteria 
in the two sample types. When comparing the test types, bacteria from living organisms, blue mussels 
and sculpins, show a higher antibiotic resistance than sediment bacteria.  
Upon  identification  of  the  antibiotic  resistant  bacteria,  geographical  differences  in  the  occurrence  of 
bacteria  were  noticed.  The  same  types  of  bacteria  appear  various  times  within  the  locations,  but  not 
between the sites. 
Due  to  the  potential risk of  antibiotic resistance  within fish,  the  fishing industry in Sisimiut is threat-ened.  This  will  have  economic  consequences  for  the  town.  Another  risk  is  connected  to  the  develop-ment of multi-resistant human pathogens, which can be a challenge in the future, because of the lack of 
new antibiotics introduced to the market. 
To get an overview of the environmental and human consequences caused by the contamination from 
the sewage outlets, it is suggested that this study is followed up and extended with for example tests of 
the water flows and also the sorption and degradability of the antibiotics.

fields.title: Belægningsdimensionering i MMOPP
fields.abstract:
Baggrund for opgaven er at vejafdelingen i Rambøll har ønsket et redskab til 
vejledende bestemmelse af belægningsopbygninger til mindre og eller mellemstore 
opgaver uden detaljeret beregning i programmet MMOPP. 
Belægningsdimensioneringen forudsættes at blive præsenteret i et opslagsværk der 
indeholder tabeller/diagramer mv. til bestemmelse af vejopbygning. Opslagsværket 
vedlægges som bilag til denne rapport, samt på digitalt format.

fields.title: The Occurrence and distribution of antibiotic resistance in bacteria isolated from Arctic sculpin and Blue mussel
fields.abstract:
In recent years, the emergence of multidrug resistance in bacteria has become a topic of lively 
debate. The development of  resistant  strains  poses  a  serious  threat  to  humans  since the 
resistance genes can be easily spread between the species and can be eventually transferred to 
pathogenic or opportunistic species, bringing mankind to the post-antibiotic age. The hospital 
in Sisimiut (Greenland) lacks a good wastewater processing plant, and for this reason all the 
hospital residues along with human faeces are released untreated directly into the neighboring 
Ulkebugten  Bay.  The  selective  pressure  exerted  by  these  pharmaceuticals  and  their 
metabolites dramatically influences the local  environment.  In order to investigate the  effects 
of  this pollution,  shorthorn  sculpins (Myoxocephalus  scorpius)  and  blue  mussels  (Mytilus 
edulis) were sampled in Sisimiut at five different locations along the antibiotic contamination 
gradient (Hospital, South shore, Dump, Beach Bay, Swede Bay). These species were chosen 
as  suited  indicators  because  they  are  long-lived  and  stationary,  therefore  reflecting  the  local 
environment  pollution.  Fish  gut  and  mussel  hepatopancreas  were  analysed  for resistance 
towards  four  antibiotics  most  commonly  used  at  Sisimiut’s  hospital  (amoxicillin, 
benzylpenicillin, ciprofloxacin and roxithromycin). The highest frequency of resistant isolates 
was found in the hospital site for amoxicillin, benzylpenicillin and ciprofloxacin, suggesting 
that the resistance towards these drugs has been acquired at the contaminated site. However, 
extremely high resistances have been found for all the treatments at the dump site. This could 
be attributed to the persistence of heavy metals at that site. Heavy metal resistance genes and 
antibiotic resistance genes are often located in the same plasmid, and therefore the conditions 
selecting  for  metal  resistance  might  select  for  the  antibiotic  resistance  as  well. Moreover, 
there is an outlet of a chocolate factory at the dump site, potentially causing contamination of 
water with Salmonella. This should rise a concern as the contact between resistant strains and 
human pathogen can have severe consequences for humans. Finally, the bacteria isolated from 
mussels were identified by API 20E tests. However, only a small fraction of microorganisms 
could have been identified, and all of these occurred to be human pathogenic or opportunistic 
bacteria,  including  ciprofloxacin-resistant Escherichia  Coli isolated  from  the  hospital  site. 
This  is  of  great  importance  as E.coli is  normally  susceptible  to  a  number  of  antimicrobials, 
including  quinolones,  suggesting  that  the  resistance at  the  hospital  site has  been  acquired. 
There were also 35 unidentified bacterial species, being detected repeatedly in different sites. 
Further  DNA  analysis  will  be  done  to  confirm  these results  and  to  identify  the  bacteria  that 
could not be recognized by API 20E tests. Last but not least, the comparison with last year’s 
results revealed significant differences with regard to the number of resistant bacteria isolated 
from all sites. The previous data (2009) seem to be of lower order of magnitude, implying the 
persistence of antibiotics in the aquatic environment and fast antibiotic resistance spread.

fields.title: Feasibility study for the implementation of a biogas production process to treat the wastewater from a fishery industry in Greenland
fields.abstract:
Throughout this project a feasibility study for the treatment of the effluent from the 
shrimp processing plant of Royal Greenland in Sisimiut has been carried out. The 
theoretical biogas potential, determined from the composition of the shrimps waste, 
turned out to be 0.581 STP m3
 CH4/kg VS. The experimental biogas potential, measured
by anaerobic digestion of the shrimps waste at lab scale was found to be 0.479 STP m3
CH4/kg VS. As for the design of the bioreactor, a kinetic model based on the ADM1 has 
been established to model the anaerobic digestion process at mesophilic conditions in a 
CSTR. For a retention time of 20 days, the estimated biogas production is 0.931 STP 
m
3
/kg VS. Concerning the costs associated to the implementation of the biogas plant, 
these are estimated in 52,659,706 DKK as expenditures and fixed capital. Moreover, 
treating one cubic meter of waste would cost 365 DKK. On the other hand, the biogas 
generated could be used as an energy source or be sold to the electric company, 
generating total revenues of 10,920,323 DKK/year. Thus, the result of a global balance 
is some benefits of 4,458,361 DKK per year. The environmental impacts are positive, 
since the process is basically a water treatment system. In addition, the biogas 
production could reduce consumption of fossil fuels or oil, much more polluting fuels 
due to the emission of greenhouse gases generated in its combustion.

fields.title: Indflydelse af ferskvandstilførsel på det marine miljø
fields.abstract:
Et vandkraftværk blev i 2009 sat i drift ved fjorden Kangerluarsuk Ungalleq, nær Sisimiut, Grønland. Vandkraftværket udleder 20 m3 ferskvand per sekund til en saltvandsfjord, hvilket kan have konsekvenser for fjordens flora og fauna. Prøver af fjordens fysiske og biologiske forhold blev udarbejdet inden installation af kraftværket. Gennem feltarbejde er formålet at undersøge, hvilke konsekvenser vandtilførslen har for fjordens fysisk og biologi. Undersøgelsen er baseret på CTD-målinger af vandsøjlen for otte hydrografiske stationer samt en analyse af sedimentprøver for seks biologiske stationer fordelt over fjorden.
Resultaterne fra feltarbejdet fastslår, at densitet, salinitet og sigtbarhed er faldet ved næsten alle stationer. Ferskvandstilførslen resulterer i et mere ferskt overfladelag samt kraftige springlag i midten og den indre del af fjorden. Sedimentprøverne viser en stigning i antallet af individer per m2 i den indre del af fjorden, og et fald i antallet af individer per m2 i fjordens midte og munding. Overordnet set er der over den etårige periode sket en stigning i antallet af Annelida, mens der for størstedelen af de resterende arter er observeret et fald i det samlede antal, herunder Mollusca og Echinodermata. Dette kan skyldes, at arter forgår grundet de ændrede fysiske parametre, hvilket skaber mulighed for forøgelse af andre arter. Dette afspejles ligeledes i den generelt faldende diversitet for hele fjorden. Der er endvidere observeret et generelt fald i algebiomasse, hvilket kan sammenkobles med et fald i sigtbarheden samt kraftigere lagdelinger, som forhindrer fotosyntese og primærproduktion ved bunden. Alger er afhængig af blandt andet ilt og næringssalte, hvilket har svært ved at nå bunden, idet springlaget besværliggør muligheden for vertikal transport i vandmasserne. Der er observeret mange ændringer i fjorden grundet ferskvandstilførslen, og det vil være interessant at følge ændringerne over en længere tidsperiode for få bekræftet en mere overordnet tendens.
Det er muligt at koble fjordens øgede ferskvandstilførsel til klimaændringer. Indlandsisens smeltezone er øget betragteligt de seneste årtier, hvilket skaber en øget ferskvandstilførsel til Grønlands fjorde og andre marine kystmiljøer. En fortsat undersøgelse af fjorden vil derfor give et bedre overblik over den samlede tendens for hele fjorden, som derved kan kobles til klimaændringernes fremtidige indvirkning på de arktiske fjorde og kystsystemer.

fields.title: Undersøgelse af flyveaske fra affaldsforbrænding til anvendelse i mørtel
fields.abstract:
På grund af det høje indhold af tungmetaller og salte karakteriseres flyveaske fra affaldsforbrændingen 
som farligt affald og deponeres derfor i udlandet. Der undersøges muligheder for at genanvende affaldsflyveasken til brug i mørtel/beton. For at fjerne de mobile ioner af metaller og salte benyttes elektrodialyse. Ved elektrodialyse føres ioner fra diluat gennem ionbyttemembraner til koncentrationsvæske grundet spændingsforskel. 
I denne rapport undersøges det, hvorledes affaldsflyveaske påvirker mørtels egenskaber. 
For at kortlægge om blandingsprocessen har indflydelse på bearbejdelighed, styrke og densitet blev 
støbninger med forskellig blandingsrækkefølge og omrøringstid udført. Støbningerne blev udarbejdet 
med karboniseret og ikke-karboniseret affaldsflyveaske. Som referencemørtler blev anvendt mørtler 
med henholdsvis ingen flyveaske eller med kulflyveaske. Der blev med signifikansniveau på 5 % ikke fundet forskel på mørtlernes trykstyrke og densiteterne viste for stor spredning til at synliggøre en sammenhæng. Derfor blev metodevalget udelukkende truffet på baggrund af mørtlens bearbejdelighed. 
Som metode til videre anvendelse blev cement og affaldsflyveaske blandet inden tilsætning i vand, og 
omrøringstiden var fire minutter. Efterfølgende blev mængden af affaldsflyveaskes indvirkning på mørtlen vurderet. Der blev med førnævnte metode udført støbninger med henholdsvis 10 %, 15 %, 20 % og 25 % karboniseret affaldsflyveaske, som erstatning for cement målt i vægtprocent. Der blev påvist ændringer i bearbejdelighed, trykstyrke og densitet, når indholdet øgedes til over 15 %, hvorfor dette blev vurderet til at være det maksimalt anvendelige indhold. Ved tilsætning af superplastificerende til en mørtel med 15 % affaldsflyveaske 
blev bearbejdeligheden forbedret betydeligt, mens trykstyrken og densiteten ikke ændredes. Brugen af 
superplastificerende kan dermed retfærdiggøres og anbefales. 
Der blev fortaget målinger af mørtlernes varmeudvikling for at undersøge styrkeudviklingen i de første
syv døgn. Forsøget blev udført for mørtler med henholdsvis ingen flyveaske, kulflyveaske, 15 % affaldsflyveaske samt 15 % affaldsflyveaske med 0,5 % superplastificerende. Mørtlerne blev opbevaret i flamingokasse, og temperaturen blev målt med loggere. Målingerne viste, at mørtlerne med affaldsflyveaske 
havde en længere inaktiv periode inden reaktionsperioden i forhold til referencemørtlerne. Disse udviste også en lavere varmeudvikling under reaktionsperioden. Dette medførte en langsommere hærdningsproces og dermed også langsommere styrkedannelse. Efter syv døgn var trykstyrken dog på niveau med 
referencemørtlernes. 
Ved anvendelse af elektrodialyse blev metaller og salte fjernet fra affaldsflyveaske. Under processen 
blev udtaget intervalprøver til måling af pH og ledningsevne samt udviklingen i koncentration af udvalgte metaller og salte. pH-værdien for diluatet faldt under forløbet grundet karbonisering af affaldsflyveasken, og ledningsevnen faldt ligeledes. 
Udviklingen i mængderne af udvalgte metaller og salte viste et hurtigt fald i diluatet for arsen, barium og 
zink. Samme stigning sås dog ikke for koncentratet, hvilket kan skyldes udfældning ved neutral pHværdi. For calcium, klorid og natrium var den opløste mængde nogenlunde konstant både i diluat og koncentratet. Bly, chrom og kobber viste en markant stigning i mængden i diluatet ved forsøgets start,
hvorefter mængden faldt ved forskellige hastigheder. Mængden i koncentratet var jævn under hele forsøget, hvilket tyder på, at metallerne var svært opløselige, og at de opløste metaller muligvis ikke har 
været ladede. Mængden af sulfationer steg kraftigt ved forsøgets start, men blev ikke flyttet til koncentratet, da mængden i diluatet efter stigningen var konstant. Koncentrationen af aluminium, cadmium og 
mangan lå under detektionsgrænsen i diluatet. Der ses et fald i mængden i koncentratet ved forsøgets 
start, hvilket kan hænge sammen med den stigende pH. Ved lavere pH stiger mængden af metallerne 
dog, hvorfor der må være en transport af de nævnte metaller.
Udvaskningsresultater viste, at koncentrationen af mobile ioner af metaller og salte i affaldsflyveasken 
var faldet for samtlige stoffer på nær aluminium, chrom og sulfat. 
Ved sammenhold med kategori 3 i Miljøministeriets bekendtgørelse om genanvendelse af restprodukter 
og jord til bygge- og anlægsarbejde fra 2006, blev grænseværdierne for koncentrationerne overholdt for
alle stoffer på nær klorid. 
Sammenligning mellem udvaskningsresultater for affaldsflyveaske og kulflyveaske viste, at koncentrationen af især salte var højere for affaldsflyveaske. Da salte spiller en væsentlig rolle i forbindelse med 
korrosion af armering skal disse koncentrationer holdes på et minimum. Resultater fra trykstyrketest og 
varmeudvikling tydede dog ikke på, at koncentrationer havde haft skadelig virkning på mørtlen. 
Oplukning af start- og slutaske viste en opkoncentration af samtlige metaller med undtagelse af barium. 
Denne opkoncentration skyldes, at stoffer, som er mere vandopløselige end salte, blev fjernet under 
elektrodialysen. Det kunne af resultaterne ses, at nogle metaller var mere vandopløselige end andre. 
Den totale mængde af metaller og salte blev reduceret undtagen for arsen, cadmium og natrium. 
Måling af karbonatindhold viste, at der var sket en stigning i indholdet af karbonat under elektrodialysen. Indholdet af karbonat var allerede inden rensningen højt grundet karbonisering af flyveasken under 
fugtige forhold. Det høje indhold af karbonat medfører et større vandbehov for mørtlen, hvorfor denne 
blev sandet og usammenhængende. Endvidere har karbonatindholdet indflydelse på styrken. Ved større 
erstatninger af cement med affaldsflyveaske end 15 % faldt trykstyrken, hvilket kan skyldes karbonisering af calciumhydroxid under elektrodialysen i stedet for en reaktion med siliciumoxid under hærdningsprocessen. 
Kulflyveaske benyttes blandt andet til at opnå en bedre bearbejdelighed, hvilket for affaldsflyveaske ikke 
var tilfældet. Dog vil anvendelsen af affaldsflyveasken være mulig ved tilsætning af superplastificerende. 
Den langsommere og lavere varmeudvikling for mørtel med affaldsflyveaske medfører en langsommere 
styrkeudvikling, dog opnås efter syv døgn den samme styrke med kulflyveaske som med mørtel. Der skal 
tages højde for den forsinkede hærdningsproces ved anvendelse af affaldsflyveaske i byggeriet, da den 
medfører senere afformning. 
Med henblik på miljøet vil en genanvendelse af affaldsflyveasken være et fremskridt. Grundet affaldsflyveaskens dårlige indvirkning på mørtels egenskaber vil det formentlig være i forbindelse med meget miljøbevidste byggerier, at affaldsflyveaskens anvendelse kan overvejes.

fields.title: Fast data acquisition from wind turbine in Greenland
fields.abstract:
In order to investigate the availability to use wind turbine energy, in the small settlement in Greenland as an alternative to fossil fuel, a solution must be designed.
This report describes how a 6kW wind turbine installed in Sarfannguaq (Greenland) can be equipped with a system, which can measure the energy production in high resolution (1Hz).
The system uses a standard utility meter to sample the voltage, current, power and frequency at 1Hz, and is remotely accessible from the internet.
It was the plan that both the turbine and the power plant production were to be measured, however due to technicall imitations only the meter for the wind turbine data was installed
in August 2010.
The goal for this project was to design a solution during the spring of 2010 and then install it as a  eld trip to Greenland in August 2010 and use the fall to verify the solution.
Due to the amount of work in designing a solution, this report also contains a section (3)
which describes the manufacturing of the custom solution. This section is therefore used to
evaluate an extra 5 point ECTS course, which was carried out as an 3-week course in June
2010.
The solution was installed in Greenlan d in August 2010 and beside some instability, which
are to b e corrected, it's now possible to get data from the turbine in Sarfannguaq via the this
website: http://87.194.37.31.

fields.title: Wind power supply for lightweight huts
fields.abstract:
Adventure tourismis becomingmore andmore popularinGreenland. The need forlightweighttransportable
hutsis a greatsolution between very light but delicate tents and permanent wooden huts. Their weightshould
not exceed 500 kg so thatthey can be transported by dog sledge. The huts’ building and testing isthe project
ofGroup 10 (Anders Lyhne Sønderriis and AndreasHasselhoffJørgensen).
Thisreportinvestigatesthe wind resources where the huts will be tested, at a camping site near Sisimiut.
Using data fromonemetmastin Sisimiut,the data were analyzed and compared with prospecting data froma
company called 3Tier. The validation givesreliability to the 3Tier data used atthe camp site.
The analysis does not consider passing cyclones orthe katabatic wind systemofthe ice caps which are very
strong winds(Johen Cappelen, 2001). Itislimited to local and themost common wind conditions which are
usually calmwinds.
The outcome ofthe analysisisto find a suitable size wind turbine to generate enough energy and store itin a
battery in orderto be used by the inhabitants ofthe huts. Itis assumed that one hut will house 3 people and
provides powerforthe essential electronicssuch aslaptop computers,GPS receivers,rechargeable batteries
etc.
The first half ofthe report briefly presentsthe work done by the wind energy students during the trip to
Greenland in August, 2010

fields.title: Wind energy in Greenland: current and future applications
fields.abstract:
This project is thus relevant since it contributes to the development of wind energy in Greenland
through ﬁeld work that was performed in three diﬀerent locations. The installation of a new met.mast
in Sarfannguaq or the maintenance work and connection of its Proven [8] wind Turbine to the local
December 2010 11 INTRODUCTION
grid are among some of the contributions provided during our stay. Besides this, useful new data
analysis in these locations was carried out and suggestions of improvement for future applications or
for further investigations are also discussed and examined in detail through the report. Furthermore,
an interesting new idea is suggested in what concerns the applicability of vertical axis wind turbine
in Greenland. As it will be discussed in the following subsection, exploring and testing a vertical axis
turbine for a particular applications was the ﬁrst goal of our project.
When starting the project, the initial idea was to take part in the design and manufacturing of a
vertical axis wind turbine mounted with a special generator. Our goal was for the turbine to work
in tandem with the diesel generator to reduce the fuel consumption, thus reducing the amount of
refueling trips. The design focus was extreme winds and icing, with icing being the most critical. This
required us to explore many diﬀerent concepts, which include aerodynamics, structures and material
science. In addition to these mentioned topics, there are many others that need to be addressed as
listed below.
• Interaction of wind turbines and radio communication systems
• Design choices for wind turbine and power system
• Battery capacities
• Control Strategy
• Prototype design and testing under Greenland’s extreme environment
However given the limited time and rather large scope of this project, it was diﬃcult to match up
our ﬁeldwork to these topics (no vertical axis wind turbine could be tested). So ultimately, due
to the lack of related work to VAWT’s in the arctic, we had to rely on a literature study of its
feasibility combined with a more extensive overview of the current applications which some of them
were implemented during ﬁeld work.

fields.title: Screening for Greenlandic bacteria capable of inhibiting pathogenic bacteria
fields.abstract:
A new promising environments for bacteria producing compounds seems to be the marine 
and aquatic world. Indeed part of the drug research is biased by recents ﬁndings of marine 
species active in the synthesis of relevant growth-antagonistic secondary metabolites. At 
this regards, given the huge sea variability of micro-ecosystems, it is most likely that many 
species have not been characterized yet and for this reason this habitat has a great potential as a source of new antimicrobial compounds. 
The present study, in collaboration with Arktisk teknologi, carried out a sampling in the 
greenlandic environment looking for new bacterial species capable of inhibiting pathogenic 
bacteria. The sampling retrieved 14 strains producing antimicrobial secondary metabolites, 
presumed to belong to the genera Pseudomonas, Flavobacteriaceae, Acinetobacter Enterobacteriaceae and Aeromonas. The extension of the inhibitions variates of several degrees, but is largely lost after sub-culturing and re-testing of the strains in Denmark for 
reasons not yet completely understood. One possible explanation is by a niche-dependent 
secondary metabolites production, which involves different parameters not reproducible in 
laboratory condition. Even if the antagonistic strains are presumably collocated in already 
known phylogenetic groups, the majority has been found in freshwater, enlightening how 
even the bacterioplankton of arctic lakes contain bacteria with an antimicrobial proﬁle

fields.title: Solar collectors in the Arctic
fields.abstract:
Since it was constructed in 2004/05 the low energy house in Sisimiut, Greenland has not met 
the energy performance it was designed for. An investigation into all of its system components
is required in order to understand why the building is not meeting its designed operation. The 
solar heating system is one of the energy saving technologies that have been installed in order 
to minimize the energy consumption of the building.
A number of issues have been discovered and addressed with the solar hot water system during 
these years of operation. There has however not been any system analysis since the last changes 
where implemented in May 2010. With the use of temperature reading sensors and solar radiation detectors a full system analysis of the collector loop is possible. 
The analysis verified that some of the previous alterations to the system such as the replacement of the R.S.C 3-way valve is now operating as it should. However other areas for modification have been discovered. For instance, the set point temperature to send away the solar excess heat to the radiator is too low. 
The full system analysis of the solar collector system in the Low Energy house can be found in 
the follow pages.

fields.title: Renovation of type houses in Greenland for future demand
fields.comment: Not sure how to write the Abstract - jlgr

fields.title: Solar heating systems in Greenland
fields.abstract:
The present report focuses on the solar heating system installed at the Knud Rasmussen Folk High
School of Sisimiut. The system was installed in 2008 as an add-on to the already existing conventional heating system using oil boilers. The ﬁeld work at the school highlighted several problems,
mainly due to a lack of maintenance on the system. A clear example of this is the fact that the circulation pump allowing the tank to preheat cold water for consumption was not working at our arrival at
the school. The cause of this problem was found to be a failure of the relay used to control the pump,
which had not been working for several months and no one identiﬁed the problem before. Because
of this and other problems, and because of the limited available time to directly study the system,
the description of the system functioning provided in this report could not describe completely the
real situation. This difﬁculty was already known since several information and manuals about the
system components and control were lost after the installation. The ﬁeld work in Sisimiut allowed
to improve the knowledge on the system but more time is still needed to add details. An important
information, still missing to better analyse the system, is the estimation of correction factors to obtain
the right ﬂow and energy measurements from the installed sensors, which were probably contained
in the lost manuals.
This report is meant to provide a good knowledge on the system for people who are going to study
it, in order to not repeat the same errors and reaching better understandings. This is relevant also
because the previous descriptions and information about the system were mostly provided in Danish.

fields.title: Projektering og udførelse af mobil turisthytte i arktiske egne
fields.abstract:
Forfatterne til denne rapport har med udgangspunkt i det arbejde Kristoffer har udført,
gennemgået de fremkomne resultater og konklusionermed kritiske øjne, og kommet med forslag 
til hvorledes hytten kunne forbedres i forhold til de visioner, der var opstillet. Desuden var målet 
at få produceret en prototype af hytten i glasfiber, og udfører diverse målinger og 
indretningseksempler, således, at vi kom nærmere det endelige mål, om en fuld funktionsdygtig 
turisthytte, til de arktiske egne.

fields.title: The impact of increased freshwater discharge into the fjord Kangerluarsuk Ungalleq
fields.abstract:
Increased freshwater discharge into marine water bodies will lead to changes of the physical 
properties of the ecosystems such as salinity, temperature and density. Changes in these abiotic 
factors can be expected to gradually impact the diversity and distribution of flora and fauna 
(Nielsen & Nielsen, 1992). This study is part of an analysis of the changes of physical properties 
and flora and fauna in the fjord Kangerluarsuk Ungalleq in West Greenland due to increased 
freshwater discharge. In November 2009 testing of a recently installed hydropower plant began 
and in May 2010 it started operating. The hydropower plant exploits runoff from a higher elevated 
lake and discharges significant amounts of freshwater into the innermost part of Kangerluarsuk
Ungalleq. In August 2009, a pre-study was carried out to determine the state of the benthic 
communities and water mass characteristics of the fjord before the initialisation of the hydropower 
plant. The physical and biological conditions of the fjord determined this year, 2010 and in the 
subsequent years will be compared to those of 2009, in order to monitor the implications of the 
increase in freshwater discharge. The characteristics of the water masses present in the fjord were 
studied by measuring salinity, temperature and pressure using a CTD (Conductivity, Temperature 
and Depth) probe and the biological assessments were undertaken using random sampling on the 
fjord bed, whereby the benthic fauna and flora were identified and quantified. The nutrient content 
and visibility within the water columns along the fjord were also determined. 
Changes in salinity, temperature and density have been observed. Stratification has increased at 
the innermost stations closest to the hydropower plant due to the discharge of freshwater. This 
causes less mixing of the water and can thereby lead to more phytoplankton in the euphotic zone 
which affects the whole ecosystem. The salinity has decreased at all depths throughout the fjord. 
At the stations closest to the mouth it is most likely that this decrease is due to the freshwater 
discharge from the hydropower plant but at the outermost stations the power plant can‟t explain 
the salinity decrease in the lower water layers of basin 1. Those water masses are influenced by the 
tidal currents and a closer look into the distribution of the haloclines at ebb and flow indicates a 
decrease in salinity of the coastal water from 2009 to 2010. It is speculated that this decrease 
could be due to the Greenland ice mass loss (Mortensen et. al., 2010). 
Changes in the distribution and diversity of flora and fauna have also been observed but it is up for 
discussion whether this is actually caused by the changes of physical oceanography or just due to 
annual fluctuation and uncertainties in the measurements obtained. The Shannon index has 
decreased almost at all stations suggesting a decrease in diversity throughout the fjord possibly due 3
to the decline in salinity, while the population density has increased at the innermost stations and 
decreased at the stations closer to the mouth. The depth of the euphotic zone has been reduced 
since 2009 indicating more plankton in the water in 2010. This could be the reason for the 
decrease in benthic algae, since less light has penetrated to the bottom and the decrease in sea 
urchins because they graze on benthic flora. The increase in phytoplankton in the pelagic zones 
could also be part of the reason why there have been observed a general increase in Annelida, 
which are filter and detritus feeders, since more food has been available for them. (Icelandic 
Ministry of Fisheries and Agriculture)

fields.title: Concrete analysis in Greenland
Sisimiut, Undersøgelse af 5 betonkonstruktioner
fields.abstract:
Som en del af to afgangsprojekter, var turen til Grønland et forarbejde inden selve projekternes undersøgelser skulle påbegyndes. De to afgangsprojekter skal handle om, at vurdere betons sammensætning, kvalitet og tilstand i nye og gamle betonbyggerier. For at vurdere dette, behøver grupperne nogle betonkerner fra hver af de udvalgte bygværker, således at de korrekte undersøgelser kan foretages.
Derfor tog grupperne i samarbejde med ARTEK på DTU, til Sisimiut i Grønland, for at lave en visuel inspektion af bygværkerne, som opfyldte gruppernes krav om byggeriets alder og betonens umiddelbare tilstand. Der blev udvalgt 5 byggerier, hvor 2 af dem gik ind under nye byggerier og 3 under gamle byggerier. Nye bygværker: Ingeniørkollegium (Apisseq) - Opført indenfor det sidste år, Bropille, Broen over ulkebugten - opført for 12 år siden. Gamle bygværker: Altangange, boligbyggeri - opført for ca. 40 år siden, Bølgebryder, Havnen - Opført 37 år siden, Containerkaj, Havnen - Ukendt opførelses år.
Alle de undersøgelser, inspektioner og borekerner, som er taget i Sisimiut under det 3 uger lange forløb, bliver til efteråret 2010 gennem analyseret hos henholdsvis BYG-DTU og Rambøll. Dette vil til årsskiftet munde ud i rapporter for hvert bygværk. Disse vil omfatte en tilstandsvurdering og anbefalinger til mulige udbedringer på konstruktionerne. Rapporterne har som mål at være på højde med erfarne ingeniørvirksomheders tilstandsrapport.
Makro- og mikro-analyserne som skal danne grundlag for alle vores resultater, skal hovedsageligt udføres hos Rambøll. Analyserne vil blive udført af de studerende under vejledning af Bent Grelk.

fields.title: Renovation of Greenlandic House for Future Demands - Ventilation
fields.abstract:
The indoor consumption of energy is estimated to be 30
both the awareness of global warming and the depletion of fossil fuel increase, more concern is drawn to 
reduce the indoor energy consumption without compromi
exception to this; the latest Greenlandic building code from 2006 is moving towards reduction of the total 
indoor heating consumption by 75%.
The main objective of this report is to advocate the ambition of Green
this project is to increase the energy efficiency of Greenlandic type houses by making necessary renovation. 
This includes three main parts: an improvement of building envelope by means of adding new layers of 
insulation, a design of domestic mechanical ventilation with proper heat recovery unit and a design of a 
package that consists of all parts and accessories necessary for renovation and which will be shipped to 
Greenland as a one-box solution.

fields.title: Efterisolering af Grønlandsk fangsthytte med papir
fields.abstract:
Formålet  med  nærværende  specialprojekt  er,  at  udarbejde  en  vurdering  af  papirs  fremtidige  anvendelse 
som  isoleringsmateriale  i  Grønland. Brugen  af  papir  som  isoleringsmateriale  i  Grønland  har  været  meget 
omdiskuteret den senere tid pga. de klare miljømæssige fordele det har. Papirisolering produceres nemlig 
af genbrugspapir, som allerede befinder sig i nærområdet. Dette er en fordel blandt mange, som kan spare 
den pladsforbrugende miljøbelastende transport af isoleringsmateriale til Grønland. I nærværende rapport 
undersøges fordele og ulemper ved papirisolering nærmere.

fields.title: Energy Efficient Renovation of Standard Houses in Greenland
fields.abstract:
The condition of the Greenlandic standard houses from the 1957-1963 series has been investigated. This 
was done through: 
•  Visual examinations  
•  Interviews with house owners or tenants 
•  Blower door tests to investigate infiltration and leakages  
•  Thermo graphic photography to identify thermal bridges and air leakages in the 
constructions 
•  HOBO data logger readings, to see the variation of temperature and relative humidity of 
the houses compared with corresponding outdoor information 
•  Examination of mould and fungal growth 
The  investigations  were  made  for  the  four  most  common types  of  standard  houses  in  Sisimiut, 
Greenland.  The  detailed  investigation  of  standard  house  type  18D  is  presented  in  this  thesis.  It  was 
found that the standard houses were generally in a poor condition, even though they had all to some 
extent been renovated. The blower door tests showed that the air change rate of the houses were much 
larger  than  the  limit  for  new  buildings.  The  thermo  graphic  pictures  showed  large  air  leakages  and 
thermal bridges, due to poor craftsmanship and lack of knowledge of building in the arctic climate. All 
house owners and tenants complained about difficulties of heating their houses and air leakages. It was 
obvious that there was a need for improving the construction and indoor climate, which will benefit the 
occupants and environment due to a decrease in the use of fossil fuels for heating. 
With the knowledge obtained from the investigations a renovation solution for the standard house type 
18D was prepared. The principles of this renovation solution should be applicable to the other standard 
houses  as  well.  The  renovation  solution  focuses  on  sustainability,  lowering  the  energy  consumption, 
improving the building envelope, and utilisation of simple tools for the renovation. The renovation must 
be  done  from  the  outside  of  the  house,  with  as  little  interruption  in  the  life  of  the  occupant’s  as 
possible.  
Through  thorough  investigations  of  the  material  functions,  calculations  of  the  thermal  transmission 
losses, condensation and surface temperatures of the building component were analyzed, and wooden 
I-profiles and rock wool insulation were chosen as the main components. The house is wrapped into a 
vapour  barrier  to  remove  all  leakages,  and  an  additional  300-360  mm  of  insulation  is  added  on  the 
outside. Detailed proposals for the renovation have been prepared along with a renovation plan, which 
must be followed during the renovation. Focus of the details has been on sealing the house, minimizing 
the thermal bridges, avoiding water from penetrating into the construction, while retaining the original 
architectural appearance.    
The  aim  of  the  renovation  package  is  to  get  the  standard  house  type  18D  into  a  low  energy  class  I 
sustainable  for  the  next  decades.  Low  energy  classes is  planned  soon  to  be  added  to  the  existing 
Greenlandic Building Regulations.  
By carrying out the improvements heating oil will be saved, which will be beneficial for the occupants, 
who will save money, as well as for the environment, where CO
2
 emissions will be reduced drastically. A 
mutual agreement between Denmark and Greenland was made during the COP15 meeting, 2009, where 
Greenland promised to increase their CO2
 emission from 2007 to 2020 with 5 %. By renovating the 2029 
standard houses from the 1957-1963 series the fulfilment of the agreement will be on its way.

fields.title: Wind Energy for Itilleq Greenland
fields.abstract:
Itilleq represents a perfect example of isolated system from an energy point of view. As in many
other small settlements in Greenland, the power plant is mainly composed by three diesel generators.
The diesel has to be transported by cargo ship or helicopter from the the main cities, namely Sisimiut or Nuuk. In addition to this, the operator presence is constantly needed to ensure the correct functioning of
the plant. These factors lead to a very high electricity price, one of the highest in the whole Greenland:
7:62 DKK=kWh.
The purpose of this report is to investigate the possibility of a reduction in the energy price by the
installation of one or more wind turbines in order to supply the electricity needs of the settlement. The
feasibility study will be conducted analysing the hourly consumption data from the electricity meters
installed at the consumers. The total value will be compared with the estimated energy produced by the
wind turbines, calculated from the measured wind speeds. Different types and brand of wind turbines
will be considered.
Since the wind energy is variable, an auxiliary source will be needed when the production is too low.
The diesel generators used nowadays to satisfy the electricity demand can be used. Moreover, a damp
load has to absorb the superabundant power: two possibilities will be discussed. The water production
plant, equipped with a larger tank, can work as a damp load storing an additional quantity of water that
will be used afterwards. In addition to this, electric heaters can be installed in the private house in order
to provide space heating.
An economic analysis will be conducted in order to estimate the effective savings and the new energy
price.

fields.title: Wind power in arctic conditions
fields.abstract:
Introduction: In this report, the ﬁeld work realized in Greenland will be described in a ﬁrst part. In a
second part, the description of the climate and topography of Greenland will follow, in order to
get a better understanding of the conditions that wind turbines should withstand in this area.
Following this description, the analysis of what these conditions imply as challenges for wind
energy will be described. In a third part, solutions and recommendations to these challenges
are presented in a general way. Eventually, in a fourth part, applications of wind energy in
cold climate and most particularly Greenland are brieﬂy presented. One of them being the need
for TELE Greenland, the main telecommunication and postal provider in Greenland, to reduce
their cost in providing energy to remote telecommunication towers. This report does no intend
to provide a solution for this problem, but rather give the required background needed before
investigating this question. Indeed, absolutely no knowledge about the ﬁeld of icing, extreme
climates, and vertical axis wind turbine was provided by the wind energy master at DTU. This
project was such a great opportunity to feel this gap of knowledge for it to be hopefully applied
for more practical purposes, like providing electricity to telecommunication towers.

fields.title: A lime stabilization of fine-grained Greenlandic sediments
fields.abstract:
This study presents laboratory testing results on lime stabilization of fine-grained 
Greenlandic soil from Fossil Plain in Kangerlussuaq. The optimal lime amount was found in the 
first stage of laboratory testing. The new proposed method determining the optimal lime amount 
for compaction optima was used. Other conventional methods such as pH test, degree of 
plasticity, and required mechanical properties according to EN 14227-11 were also used for the 
optimal lime amount determination. The long term strength development, California bearing 
ratio (CBR), measurements were performed in the second stage of laboratory testing. It was 
found that the lime stabilization greatly enhances the strength of fine-graided soil, and the 
stabilization effect depends on the length of curing time and temperature

fields.title: Kortlægning af permafrost i arktiske egne med geoelektrik og EM metoder
fields.abstract:
Byggeri i arktiske egne er ofte en udfordring. Dette skyldes, at jorden ofte indeholder permafrost. Disse områder giver en særlig problemstilling, da optøningen af permafrost kan give sætningsskader på bygninger. Dette skyldes, at jorden mister sin bæreevne, hvis permafrosten tør og derved ikke længere kan opretholde den samme vægt som tidligere. Omfanget af permafrosten i et område er derfor en vigtig information for alle bygningsrelaterede aktiviteter. Det er i øjeblikket mere undtagelsen end reglen, at denne parameter indgår i overvejelserne ved projekter i disse områder. Ofte skyldes det, at der ikke findes metoder der kan bestemme omfanget af permafrosten endnu.
Formålet med projektet er, at undersøge muligheden for kortlægning af permafrosten med geofysiske metoder, hvor GCM, TEM, VES, DC/IP og MEP er de anvendte geofysiske målemetoder. Metoderne er alle blevet anvendt i området omkring byen Ilulissat på Grønlands vestkyst. I området optræder en særlig geologi og der forventes en lagdelt struktur bestående af 4 lag. Øverst findes et aktiv lag, der tør i sommerperioden. Under aktivlaget findes permafrost, der er underlagt af et ikke frossen salinlag. Nederst forventes grundfjeldet at optræde. Ud fra denne geologi er de geofysiske metoder valgt, da de forventes at kunne bestemme tykkelsen af permafrosten. Grundet den særlige lagdeling vil det forventes, at en fælles inversion af de valgte metoder vil kunne bestemme laggrænserne bedre end en enkeltstående inversion. Det tilstræbes at metoderne til bestemmelse af lag grænserne er både mobile og nemt anvendelige.
Undersøgelserne har udvist god anvendelighed og bestemt realistiske permafrosttykkelser. De bedste resultater vurderes at stamme fra fællesinversionen mellem TEM og VES. Den fælles inversion mellem TEM og MEP har potentiale for sammentolkning, men elektrodeafstanden har vist sig afgørende for opløsningen af de øvre lag. I området er der også observeret induceret polarisationseffekter, der har forstyrret TEM sonderingen i sådan en grad at de ikke kan anvendes til inversion. Sådanne effekter er tidligere blevet observeret i arktiske egne, og kan derfor i visse område gøre metoden ubruglig.

fields.title: Geofysisk forundersøgelse for anlæggelse af mine i Grønland
fields.abstract:
Vest for den Grønlandske by Sisimiut planlægges anlagt et øvelsesområde. Området skal fungere som 
øvelsesplads for studerende ved Mine og Entreprenørskolen i Sisimiut, og skal indeholde en manøvreplads 
plus en fjeldmine. For at optimere de enkelte anlægsopgaver i øvelsesområdet udarbejdes der 
forundersøgelser. Forundersøgelserne varetages af studerende ved Center for Arktisk Teknologi, og inddeles 
derfor i mindre forundersøgelsesopgaver. 
 
I denne rapport beskrives en forundersøgelsesopgave vedrørende geofysiske forundersøgelser i området hvor 
minen planlægges anlagt. Rapporten fokuserer på ingeniørgeologiske parametre som sprække omfang og 
bestemmelse af disse. Til kortlægning af disse parametre er der udført feltstudier i området hvor minen 
planlægges anlagt, feltstudierne omfatter MEP profilering, Stangslingram og point load index. 
 
Af den opnåede data fra feltstudie er det lykkedes at genfinde punktvise overensstemmelser mellem data og 
ortofoto. Dataene var dog ikke af en kvalitet der muliggør en fuldt ud præcis kortlægning af dominerende 
sprækker i området ved minen. 
 
I rapporten redegøres der for teorien bag de anvendte geofysiske målemetoder MEP, Stangslingram og point 
load index. 
Ligeledes redegør rapporten for visse fejlkilder ved anvendelse af disse målemetoder.

fields.title: Bølgebryder i Sisimiut havn
fields.abstract: Dette afgangsprojekt omhandler særeftersyn af ældre betonkonstruktioner. De tre betonkonstruktioner som undersøges er placeret i Sisimiut på Grønlands vestkyst, hvor to af betonkonstruktionerne findes ved havnen i form af en kajkonstruktion og en bølgebryder. Den sidste betonkonstruktion indebærer gavle og altangange i et boligbyggeri midt i Sisimiut by. Det arktiske klima kan betyde svære vilkår for flydende og hærdnet beton. Under støbning skal der tages visse forholdsregler, da de lave temperaturer og den tørre luft påvirker betonen under hærdning. Derudover påvirker kulden flere skadesmekanismer både positivt og negativt, da lave temperaturer forøger moligheden for frostskader, hvorimod de lave temperaturer giver langsommere reaktionshastigheder for f.eks. kemiske forbindelser. Den, i forhold til Danmark, lave luftfugtighed på ca. 70%, giver gode vilkår for andre skadesmekanismer, f.eks. foregår karbonatiseringsprocessen hurtigere ved en luftfugtighed mellem 40 % og 70 %. Der blev for alle tre konstruktioner udtaget borekerner i området, som enten var stærkt udsatte for en eller flere skadesmekanismer, eller som så forholdsvis intakte ud. Denne vurdering blev foretaget på baggrund af en visuel inspektion, hvor der blev registreret de visuelle skader i betonen. På kajen boredes tre betonkerner, hvor den første varv i et område som var i god stand, hvorimod de to sidste kerner, blev boret i et område som så udsat ud. For altanbrystningen, blev der boret på samme måde, én borekerne i en ødelagt brystning, og én borekerne i en brystning med et bedre udseende. Samme procedure for de to kerner i altandækket. Til sidst blev der kun boret en enkelt kerne på bølgebryderen, da det blev vurderet, på baggrund af den visuelle inspektion, at denne ene kerne var repræsentativ for hele betonkonstruktionen. For at udføre særeftersynsrapporterne kræves en grundig viden omkring skadesmekanismer, der kan nedbryde beton. Der fokuseres på seks nedbrydningsmekanismer, hvor de undersøgte betonkonstruktioner i Sisimiut, især er repræsenteret af tre skadesmekanismer: Kloridindtrængning, karbonatisering og hvad disse typisk fører til, nemlig armeringskorrosion. Den skadesmekanisme, som havde virkning af betydnin på altangangene, var karbonatisering. Betonens sammensætning og konstruktions opbygning, gjorde den yderst udsat for en dyb karbonatiseringsfront. Betonen bestod af gode som sunde materialer, men et højt v/c-forhold og lavt dæklag, viste sig katastrofal for konstruktionen, og som den visuelle inspektion bekræftede, var fandtes i stort omfang, blottet armering og flere tydelige revnedannelser. For de to resterende betonkonstruktioner, placeret ved Sisimiut havn, viste undersøgelserne, at betonen i begge konstruktioner, var udført med gode og sunde materialer. Dog var begge konstruktioner hårdt påvirkede af kloridtrængning med et kritisk indhold af klorid ved armeringsjernet. Dette betød at armeringen flere steder var begyndt at ruste, med afskalninger og blottet armering til følge. For kajkonstruktionen viste de udførte kloridundersøgelser, et kloridprofil med en bemærkelsesværdig bølgestruktur. Denne struktur forklaredes ved den manglende kontrol af forholdet imellem cementpaste og tilslag. For bølgebryderen var havde kloridprofilet en dårligt tilpasset kurve. Det viste sig svært at finde kloridprofil som passede godt gennem alle kloridmålinger, og ved at fjerne enkelte kloridgmålinger, var tilpasningen stadig utilstrækkelig. Derfor kan det ikke afvises, at betonen allerede var kloridholdig umiddelbart efter støbning.

fields.title: Vurdering af betonsammensætning, kvalitet og tilstand af ældre betonbyggerier i Grønland
fields.abstract:

For at udføre særeftersynsrapporterne kræves en grundig viden omkring skadesmekanismer, der kan nedbryde beton. Der fokuseres på seks nedbrydningsmekanismer, hvor de undersøgte betonkonstruktioner i Sisimiut, især er repræsenteret af tre skadesmekanismer: Kloridindtrængning, karbonatisering og hvad disse typisk fører til, nemlig armeringskorrosion.
Den skadesmekanisme, som havde virkning af betydnin på altangangene, var karbonatisering. Betonens sammensætning og konstruktions opbygning, gjorde  den yderst udsat for en dyb karbonatiseringsfront. Betonen bestod af gode som sunde materialer, men et højt v/c-forhold og lavt dæklag, viste sig katastrofal for konstruktionen, og som den visuelle inspektion bekræftede, var fandtes i stort omfang, blottet armering og flere tydelige revnedannelser.
For de to resterende betonkonstruktioner, placeret ved Sisimiut havn, viste undersøgelserne, at betonen i begge konstruktioner, var udført med gode og sunde materialer. Dog var begge konstruktioner hårdt påvirkede af kloridtrængning med et kritisk indhold af klorid ved armeringsjernet. Dette betød at armeringen flere steder var begyndt at ruste, med afskalninger og blottet armering til følge. For kajkonstruktionen viste de udførte kloridundersøgelser, et kloridprofil med en bemærkelsesværdig bølgestruktur. Denne struktur forklaredes ved den manglende kontrol af forholdet imellem cementpaste og tilslag.
For bølgebryderen var havde kloridprofilet en dårligt tilpasset kurve. Det viste sig svært at finde kloridprofil som passede godt gennem alle kloridmålinger, og ved at fjerne enkelte kloridgmålinger, var tilpasningen stadig utilstrækkelig. Derfor kan det ikke afvises, at betonen allerede var kloridholdig umiddelbart efter støbning.

fields.title: Altangangshus i Sisimiut
fields.abstract: Dette afgangsprojekt omhandler særeftersyn af ældre betonkonstruktioner. De tre betonkonstruktioner som undersøges er placeret i Sisimiut på Grønlands vestkyst, hvor to af betonkonstruktionerne findes ved havnen i form af en kajkonstruktion og en bølgebryder. Den sidste betonkonstruktion indebærer gavle og altangange i et boligbyggeri midt i Sisimiut by. Det arktiske klima kan betyde svære vilkår for flydende og hærdnet beton. Under støbning skal der tages visse forholdsregler, da de lave temperaturer og den tørre luft påvirker betonen under hærdning. Derudover påvirker kulden flere skadesmekanismer både positivt og negativt, da lave temperaturer forøger moligheden for frostskader, hvorimod de lave temperaturer giver langsommere reaktionshastigheder for f.eks. kemiske forbindelser. Den, i forhold til Danmark, lave luftfugtighed på ca. 70%, giver gode vilkår for andre skadesmekanismer, f.eks. foregår karbonatiseringsprocessen hurtigere ved en luftfugtighed mellem 40 % og 70 %. Der blev for alle tre konstruktioner udtaget borekerner i området, som enten var stærkt udsatte for en eller flere skadesmekanismer, eller som så forholdsvis intakte ud. Denne vurdering blev foretaget på baggrund af en visuel inspektion, hvor der blev registreret de visuelle skader i betonen. På kajen boredes tre betonkerner, hvor den første varv i et område som var i god stand, hvorimod de to sidste kerner, blev boret i et område som så udsat ud. For altanbrystningen, blev der boret på samme måde, én borekerne i en ødelagt brystning, og én borekerne i en brystning med et bedre udseende. Samme procedure for de to kerner i altandækket. Til sidst blev der kun boret en enkelt kerne på bølgebryderen, da det blev vurderet, på baggrund af den visuelle inspektion, at denne ene kerne var repræsentativ for hele betonkonstruktionen. For at udføre særeftersynsrapporterne kræves en grundig viden omkring skadesmekanismer, der kan nedbryde beton. Der fokuseres på seks nedbrydningsmekanismer, hvor de undersøgte betonkonstruktioner i Sisimiut, især er repræsenteret af tre skadesmekanismer: Kloridindtrængning, karbonatisering og hvad disse typisk fører til, nemlig armeringskorrosion. Den skadesmekanisme, som havde virkning af betydnin på altangangene, var karbonatisering. Betonens sammensætning og konstruktions opbygning, gjorde den yderst udsat for en dyb karbonatiseringsfront. Betonen bestod af gode som sunde materialer, men et højt v/c-forhold og lavt dæklag, viste sig katastrofal for konstruktionen, og som den visuelle inspektion bekræftede, var fandtes i stort omfang, blottet armering og flere tydelige revnedannelser. For de to resterende betonkonstruktioner, placeret ved Sisimiut havn, viste undersøgelserne, at betonen i begge konstruktioner, var udført med gode og sunde materialer. Dog var begge konstruktioner hårdt påvirkede af kloridtrængning med et kritisk indhold af klorid ved armeringsjernet. Dette betød at armeringen flere steder var begyndt at ruste, med afskalninger og blottet armering til følge. For kajkonstruktionen viste de udførte kloridundersøgelser, et kloridprofil med en bemærkelsesværdig bølgestruktur. Denne struktur forklaredes ved den manglende kontrol af forholdet imellem cementpaste og tilslag. For bølgebryderen var havde kloridprofilet en dårligt tilpasset kurve. Det viste sig svært at finde kloridprofil som passede godt gennem alle kloridmålinger, og ved at fjerne enkelte kloridgmålinger, var tilpasningen stadig utilstrækkelig. Derfor kan det ikke afvises, at betonen allerede var kloridholdig umiddelbart efter støbning.

fields.title: Efterisolering af Grønlandsk turisthytte
Vurdering af betonsammensætning,kvalitet og tilstand af nyere betonbyggeri i Grønland
fields.abstract:
I dette projekt er der foretaget to særeftersyn af nyere betonkonstruktioner udsat for det arktiske klima i
Sisimiut på Grønlands vestkyst. Det drejer sig om Ulkebugt Broen opført i 1998 og Apisseq Ingeniørkollegiet opført 2009 - 2010. Sammen med disse to særeftersyn er der gennemgået forskellige nedbrydningsmekanismer, som kan have stbetydning for betons levetid og styrke.
I de to separate særeftersynsrapporter vurderes betonsammensætningen, kvaliteten og tilstanden af betonen i konstruktionerne. Vurderingen er udført på grundlag af undersøgelser og analyser af selve konstruktionerne og af borekerner udtaget fra betonen. Særeftersynet udmunder i en leveltidsbestemmelse og en anbefaling til reparationer og yderligere undersøgelser.
Den tredje rapport er en baggrundsrapport, hvor teorien bag nedbrydningsmekanismerne i beton er gennemgået. Samtidig diskuteres de vigtigste resultater fra særeftersynsrapporterne.
På Apisseq, Ingeniør kollegiet er der udført et særeftersyn af betonfundamentet.

fields.title: Ulkebugt Broen
Apisseq, ingeniørkollegiet
fields.comment: Der er hverken indledning eller abstract i denne rapport.

fields.title: Solvarme og varmepumpe på Grønland
fields.abstract:
Inledning: 
På Grønland er der nogle helt andre vilkår på mange punkter end der er
i Danmark. Landets befolkning er fordelt i små byer med stor afstand i
mellem. Hver enkelt by har deres egen lukkede infrastruktur, ø-struktur.
Denne ø-struktur medfører, at energipriser bliver høje, som følge af ekstra
udgifter til backup-kapacitet, lange transportveje af olie og diesel, samt
øgede personaleudgifter. Specielt i de meget små afsidesliggende bygder
kan de reelle energipriser komme op på13kr/kWh[1].
På baggrund af disse høje energipriser er der ekstra fokus på at anvende
vedvarende energiresurser. Center for Arktisk Teknologi på DTU har med
støtte fra grønlandske partnere lavet en del projekter med vedvarende energi (sol, vind, vand). Et af de seneste projekter omhandlede solvarmeanlæg,
hvor det er blevet testet hvordan solvarmeanlæg-teknologien klare sig i det
arktiske klima. I den forbindelse er der bl.a. blevet installerede solvarmean-
læg på Knud Rasmussens højskole.
I denne rapport undersøges i samarbejde med DTU Mekanik, om det er
smart energimæssigt,CO2-mæssigt og økonomisk, at kombinere solvarmean
læg og varmepumpe. Denne undersøgelse udspringer i, at på nuværende tidspunkt udnyttes de lave temperaturer i solfangerne ikke. Denne lavenergi
vil derimod muligvis kunne udnyttes ved indsættelse af en varmepumpe.
Der er udarbejdet en generel model (SVP-modellen), som beskriver, hvordan et SVP-system vil yde. Denne SVP-model er anvendt på fem repræsentative cases.

fields.title: Vejbyggeri i Grønland
fields.abstract:
Roads in Greenland are very bad, they break easily, and you can notice it in the cities. Every country has instructions on how to construct roads, and road instruction for Greenland is made by Grønlands Tekniske Organisation — GTO (Technical Organization of Greenland), suitable for city situation made in 1987 and for village in 1984. Road construction is made suitable for all Greenland's soil and clime. GTO is closed down today however; all of Greenland still use the instruction. Nuup Kommunea (municipality) have made a new instruction for roads, by using some instruction from GTO and made them suitable for Nuuk's situation. 
Roads in Nuuk are repaired every year, mostly asphalt, and it cost a lot. The roads in Sisimiut were repair from 2004 to 2008. The worst badly roads are repaired on their wearing surface, and some of them roads just get renewed surfaces i.e. new asphalt. Even though, they are repaired, they have the same problems like holes, cracks and roughness. One of the good roads is the road to the airport called Asummiunut, which is built on a mountain. The biggest problem for building in Sisimiut is permafrost, when it's get melting, it can damage a road construction. 
We made four different asphalt mix in Sisimiut in an attempt to improve the roads in Greenland. Two of them contained Polymer (8% and 12%), one Flintstone and one regular asphalt. While we were in Sisimiut we made two test and measured stiffness, deflection and strain with Light Weight Deflectometer and Strain gauge. The results after 9 days of hardening showed that asphalt with polymer is the best asphalt for road construction and it can be a part of improving the Greenlandic roads. Polymer gets hard in warm weather and soft in cold weather, and it can be the solution for the road problem in Greenland, by avoiding cracks and roughness. We hope that we can see the final results of the best surface of asphalt in the summer 2009 on our test-areas.

fields.title: Forundersøgelser for anlæggelse af svømmehal i fjeld
fields.abstract:
In corporation with Center of Arctic Technology, Heidi Skytte Larsen, master student at DTU, has
performed engineer geological studies for a swim bath project in Sisimiut located at Greenland’s
west coast. The county of Sisimiut wishes to construct the swimming bath inside the mountain.
Both Norway and Sweden have great experiences with this type of construction but it is
previously unknown in the mountains of Greenland. The building will be designed both as a
swimming bath and an indoor swimming complex for the citizens and schools of the county of
Sisimiut.
The focus of this paper is on at localization of the swimming bath in “Palasip qaqqaa” north of
Sisimiut city which the Center of Arctic Technology and the county of Sisimiut have found useful.
All the studies in this paper are made with this location in mind. Other possible locations in
Sisimiut will be discussed in this paper; however these are only briefly mentioned.
The mountains of Sisimiut mainly consist of granitic gneiss with veins of alkaline rock materials.
No geological maps of the area of Sisimiut exist and therefore it has been necessary to take out
rock samples for further investigations and analysis. These samples have been tested with a Point
Load Test and a Drillability Test to determine the strength of the material and to evaluate which
tunnel driving method is most useful.
In the field, geophysical measurements with Georadar, Stang-Slingram, and Geoelectric have
been performed and the results have been used for locating potential fractures and weakzones in
the area.
So far, the Center of Arctic Technology have not performed any geoelectric measurements
directly on the rock, therefore a part of this paper has been to develop a method to create
contact between electrodes and the exposed rock. In the paper, the developed method is
compared to the normally used method with steel spear, and turned out to be very useful on
hard material.
The geophysical measurements have shown that the area is relatively fragmented and therefore
the paper describes several different types of rock support. These can be used to secure the
construction from crash of blocks and other rock mechanical phenomenon that affect the
stability of the construction.
This paper can be used as basic information for the final design of the construction and to
evaluate the necessary types and amounts of security. The developed method makes it possible
to improve geoelectrical measurements on rocks further and thereby locate invisible
stratifications and zones of fractures. Furthermore, the paper can also be used as information in
the construction part of the project.

fields.title: Vejbygning
fields.abstract:
Projektet omhandler den nye bydel i Støvring, Ådale, lokaliseret øst for jernbanen. Støvring ligger ca. 20 km syd for Aalborg, Nordjylland, jf. figur 2.1, med sine 6.482 indbyggere. På baggrund af byudviklingen har det været nødvendigt at udvide byen. Derfor tog byrådet en beslutning om investering af nye boliger og veje øst for jernbanen.
Området øst for jernbanen har hovedsageligt været benyttet til landsbrugsformål, med græsnings-og engarealer. Med denne investering ønskes det at skabe en sammenhæng mellem den eksisterende bydel og de naturskønne landskaber ved Lindenborg Åda, jf. figur 2.2.

fields.title: Videregående studier af grønlandsk ler
fields.abstract:
I dette projekt ønskes det belyst, om suspensioner af
ler fra de grønlandske lerforekomster er stabile
ved tilsætning til frisk beton. Desuden ønskes det
belyst, om hvorvidt natriumpyrofosfat har en
dispergerende virkning på sådanne
suspensioner. Partikelstørrelsesmålinger bliver gennemført i en
Mastersizer 2000, der gør brug af en måleteknik kaldet Dynamic Light Scattering. Ved
sammenligning af målinger af partikelstørrelsen på forskellige
suspensioner søges de nævnte
forhold afklaret. Det kan på baggrund af de
gennemførte undersøgelser
ikke konkluderes, om
hvorvidt suspensionerne stabile eller om natriumpyrofosfat har en
virkning, idet målinger ved DLS
kræver kendskab til partiklernes diffusionskoefficient. Målinger af denne størrelse har ikke indgået i
laboratoriearbejdet for dette projekt. Hertil kommer at DSL forudsætter sfæriske partikler. Om det
er tilfældet med det grønlandske
ler er ikke belyst, hvorfor projektets konklusioner
således er af
indikativ karakter.

fields.title: Solvarmepotentiale i Grønland
fields.abstract:
I dette projekt gennemgås en række simuleringer i simuleringsprogrammet MantlSim på baggrund 
af referenceårene for Uummannaq, Sisimiut og Nuuk. 
Årlig globalstråling er hhv. 926 kWh/m2
år, 858 kWh/m2
år og 900 kWh/m2
år for Uummannaq, 
Sisimiut og Nuuk. 
Der benyttes to type af solfangere, den ene med Arcon A/S´s HT-N solfangere med et areal på 
50,12 m2
 og den anden med BA30 solfangere fra Batec med et areal på 54m2
. Begge anlæg opstilles 
med kappebeholder på 2000 liter. 
Projektet er inddelt i fem overordnede afsnit og omhandler: trykstabsberegning, 
simuleringsresultater af Uummannaq, simuleringsresultater af Sisimiut, simuleringsresultater af 
Nuuk og sammenligning af resultaterne for de tre byer. 
På baggrund af undersøgelserne i dette projekt kan der konkluderes, at tryktabet i solfangerkreds for 
HT-N anlægget er 106.107 Pa og BA30 anlægget på 112.889 Pa. I solfangerkredsen monteres en 
cirkulationspumpe på 220 W for HT-N anlæg og 500W for BA30 anlæg. Begge cirkulationspumper 
er fra Grundfos. 
Den optimale hældning på solfangerne i Uummannaq er 63o
 og solfangerorientering på 0o
. I 
Sisimiut er den optimale solfangerhældning på 55o
 og solfangerorientering på 10o
. I Nuuk er den 
optimale solfangerhældning på 55o
 og solfangerorientering på 8o
. 
Den optimal solvarmeanlæg i Uummannaq for HT-N fås nettoydelsen på 23.625 kWh/år og for 
BA30 anlæg fås nettoydelsen på 22.187 kWh/år. Den optimal solvarmeanlæg i Sisimiut for HT-N 
fås nettoydelsen på 22.044 kWh/år og for BA30 fås nettoydelsen på 20.346 kWh/år. Den optimal 
solvarmeanlæg i Nuuk for HT-N fås nettoydelsen på 21.802 kWh/år og for BA30 fås nettoydelsen 
på 20.150 kWh/år.
