fields.title: Design Proposal of Tourist Huts in Greenland
Field measurement – Low-energy house in Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
To obtain the data in this experiment, we 
evaluate  field  measurements  of  thermal 
environment and ventilations rate in different 
rooms, measured on-site at the Energy House 
in  Sisimiut,  enabling  us  to  evaluate  the  air 
quality. 
On the basis of the results a comparison of the 
thermal environment and indoor air quality of 
the  different  rooms  are  discussed  and 
evaluated. 
In general the measurements show coincident 
patterns in  each case of the rooms.  It can be 
seen  that  the  ventilation  and  the  air  change 
rate  appears  to  be  essential  regarding  the 
indoor environment. 
Further,  the  measurements  emphasise  the 
impact  of  mechanical  ventilation  on  indoor 
environment.

fields.abstract:
The

a

Understanding

Greenland.

fields.title: Problem Space
fields.abstract:
Based on the design manual and information collected throughout the trip to Greenland the problem 
space is defined. The purpose of defining a problem space is to outline the specific requirements and 
given  prerequisites.  The  problem  space  features  the  following  items;  ”customer  requirements”, 
”functional  requests”,  ”building  performance  criteria”,  “indoor  environmental  criteria”,  ”additional 
building regulations”, “selected criteria” and “project focus”. In the following part the problem space is 
defined.

fields.title: Simulering af energiforsyningen i Sarfannguaq
fields.abstract:
This study investigates the potential of implementing renewable energy in
small isolated systems in Greenland. The project dealing with the energy system in a small village called Sarfannguaq, in the western Greenland. The work
is based on remote measurements of electricity consumption for all consumers
in the village and measurements from different climate stations in the area.
Based on information’s about the system and investigations in the village a
simulation program is build.
The program is used to investigate the impact on the system and the
economical effects.
The results of low (0-20 %) and medium (20-50 %) penetration of wind
power is presented in this report. For the low penetration case, very small
turbines are used (6-15kW) and it makes it uneconomical compared to the
existing system. For the medium penetration bigger turbines are used and it
gives a more cost-effective solution. For all the calculations the generators are
operating constantly and it puts a limitation on the amount of oil that can be
saved. Another limitation is that all the electricity consumption is considered
to be autonomous and it cause big waste of energy when the penetration is
increased.
The simulations show that the optimal amount of wind power in the system, with out energy storage and regulation of the consumption, is around
50 kW. It gives a penetration at 28 %.
Suggestions for further work, on this project is:
•
Implement variable consumption, based on the potential in the village.
•
Implement energy storages and find the optimal storage size
•
Further measurements and verification of the wind resources
•
Include hydro power in the model

fields.title: Ingeniørkollegium i Grønland
Fåreholderveje i Sydgrønland - udformning og vedligeholdelse
fields.abstract:
This report is about how the Low-volume roads in South Greenland should be designed and
maintained.
The area under investigation is called Vatnahverfi and its located south of Narsarsuaq and east of
Qaqortoq. In this area there are a number of sheep
farms sites which are linked by a road of
approx. 23 km; however there are some sheep farms sites which are not connected by roads, and
thus are "isolated".
Context of this report is a field survey carried out in Vatnahverfi region of august 2008. Among
other things, there were studied a concrete road of
approx. 20 km which will be an extension of
the existing road network, and link 4 sheep farms to this. The study also addressed the location
of available material resources to use as road construction materials. Furthermore, the existing
network was studied and there has come up with some
suggestions to improve this.
There has been a Geometric Road Design for a one-lane gravel road with daily traffic <100, with
a design speed of 50 km/h. There has been found following minimum radius for horizontal and
vertical curves, sized meeting sight distance. Horizontal curves, Rapprox 115 m (provided free
sight distance in the side of the road), for the vertical curves, convex R 1730 m and concave R
390 m. The maximum slope gradient is set at 10%, 12% is acceptable for short distances. The
road shall be 4.5 m wide, and the side slope on the road must be 45 ‰ for the sake of drainage.
The pavement structure is constructed of three layers, a surfacing layer, an underlying base and a
subbase layer. The surfacing layer should be 10 cm,
and the base layer should be 15 cm. Subbase layer thickness depends on which natural soil is present, varies from 10 cm thickness if “natural
soil” of mountain rocks, and must be 50 cm thick at
the subbase of relatively solid clay and silt.
The dust binding agents is recommended in use, as it will hold together the materials in the surface layer and give a firmer surface.
Gravel materials were examined; they consist primarily of granite material and are relatively
edged. These has been made Micro-Deval abrasion test on them and says the results generally
good values of 3 to 5% lost material. However, one
of the investigated materials was having 28%
lost material, which is high. The sample consisted
also of a special rock which contained weather
beaten amphibolites which has been the cause of the
high losses.
There are materials in large quantities and there are identified three gravel pits in total contain
more than one than 500,000 m³. Compared, the 20 km
road "only" spend approx. 65,000 m³.
It is recommended that the existing road will have
a new trim and surface layer, and it is recommended to be purchased, for one thing a grader to straighten up the road, so it can properly drain.
fields.comment: For the detailed maps, I'll refere to the maps in the report. Due to the amount of information related to the maps.

fields.title: Placering af aluminiumssmelter i Maniitsoq, Grønland
fields.abstract:
In this project “Placering af aluminiumsmelteværk i
Maniitsoq” an description of the melter plant and
the
surounding area have been made, with construction side of matter.
In according to the company ALCOA would like to build an alumina melter in Maniitsoq, Greenland, some
studies pointing towards a decision for placement have been accomplished. These studies have shown to
link
other major projects, among these hydroelectric and
transmission lines. Maniitsoq is the city where the cost of
these plants is least and where the melter are expected to be located, also because of fullfilling the
demands
best.
This Report describe which investigations that have
been done and which that can be expected to be
completed the next couple of years. Location of melter in Area C on Maniitsoq island have resulted in
further
studies for the construction of the port, new town
building and roads. In according to this the available data
which has been made are described an evalutated. An
aluminum production which will take place on site
demands import/export in sizes which cannot be expected in todays Greenland. Which processes and the use
of materials which has been included in aluminum produktion has been described further, an example is
that
big amounts of Alumina and carbon anodes is expected to be imported an big amounts of aluminium is
expected to be exported.small amounts of cryolite is expected to be imported under the work.
The area surrounding the melter is in the matter of
size and the logistically surcumstances which can be
expected in import/export is described. Further on
port facilities and work camps during the construction
period are constructed. The melter is going to have
an area equally the size of 300 football fields. Because of
the melter construction other installations are have to be constructed, here a new town and a new road
which
link the new town with the melter plant.
Planning for the new district is currently advanced
enough, that it is imagineable of which arrangement and
size there is talking about. The city is expected to have place for 600 houses. Which types of houses,
roads and
installations are expected in the city have been examined further. Further studies for the installation and site
preparation is expected investigated further on. Localization of the road can have important meaning for the
the localization of the city's port construction and it has also been planned to use the melter port under the
construction of the city.
The road between the new town and the melter are likely to have a total length of 11 km. There has been
developed 3 possible line which among 1 of the options include’s a bridge. What need to be investigated about
the construction and possible deposits investigations for building materials has been described. In the context
of the instructions which are expected to be used,
there have been some calculations of layer thickness for the
carrier layer and the asphalt layer.

fields.title: Minedrift i Grønland
fields.abstract:
Denne rapport handler om 2 kommende miner i Grønland, hhv. Molybdæn forekomsten i Scoresbysund 
beliggende i Østgrønland og Zink/bly forekomsten i Maamorilik beliggende i Nordvestgrønland. 
Baggrunden der ligger til grunde for denne rapport er den øgede interesse omkring aktuelle minedrift 
potentialer, beliggende i Grønland. 
Rapporten belyser geologien bag malmforekomsterne og derved dannelsen af disse herunder miljø, forløb 
og tid. Derudover afklares omfanget af forekomsterne samt koncentrationerne af de interessante råstoffer, 
ligesom det afklares hvor omfattende etablering af mineværk indebære af diverse anlægsfaciliteter samt 
fysiske og kemiske problemstillinger. 
Hertil er det afklaret at Molybdæen forekomsten er dannet sam fø1ge af en væske indsprøjtning omkring 65 
mio. år siden i forbindelse med vulkansk aktivitet i nærliggende områder. lndsprøjtningen er sket i 
revnedannelserne dannet ved en granitisk intrution af et øvre beliggende sandstenslag. Molybdæn malmen 
forekommer som en kæmpemæssig paddehat, hvor koncentrationen af molybdænglansen gradvist bliver 
mindre i takt med at afstanden til indsprøjtningskilden øges. Malmforekomsten i Malmbjerget er anslået til 
at indeholde 217 millioner ton malm med en 1ødighed pa 0,12% molybdænglans. Hertil er det anslået at et 
mineværk i området kan være driftdygtigt i 15 til 20 år med en produktion af råmateriale på omkring 
30.000 tons om dagen. 
I Maamorilik er zink/bly forekomsten dannet i et ca. 2,5 mia. år gammelt værtbjerg. Forekomsten er 
sandsynligt dannet som fø1ge af en sedimentær proces på havbunden hvor en mineralholdig væske er 
trængt op i det pagældende lag. Laget har efterfølgende været udsat for foldninger og sammenpresninger, 
og som fø1ge af ændring i tryk og temperatur har dannet en hard masse af marmor, som i dag kendetegner 
"den sorte engel". Zink/bly malmen forekommer i minen som flere kæmpemæssige linser i op til 30m 
tykkelser som snor sig som årer, disse er fordelt således at de tilsammen danner en stor Z form set fra oven. 
Ressourcen i Maamorilik er sammenlagt målt til 4,4 millioner ton med en 1ødighed på 8,6% zink 3% bly og 
18 g/t sølv. Hertil er det planlagt at udvinding af råstofferne skal ske i 2 etaper med hver deres produktion. 
Første etape er anslået til at være driftdygtig i ca. 4 ar. 
Begge forekomster er beliggende i besværligt fremkommelige fjeld områder, hvorfor de infrastrukturelle 
udfordringer er enorme i forbindelse med anlæggelse af mineværk. I Scoresbyland kræves anlæggelse af 
enorme anlæg i form af 75 km transportveje, grusbelagt landingsbane, taillings dæmning, havne facilitet, 
tank anlæg samt knusnings og bearbejdningsanlæg m.m. I Maamorilik benyttes eksisterende anlæg i form 
af havne samt camp faciliteter, hvorimod tovbane må etableres på ny udover anlæggelse af bl.a. 15-20 km 
nyt transportvej, transport tunnel samt taillings-depot m.m. 
Taillings problematikken 10ses vha. opdæmning af restproduktet således denne afskærmes for 
naturomgivelserne, heraf undgås nemlig miljømæssige konsekvenser taillings medfører.

fields.title: Potentialet for mikrovandkraft ved Qorlortoq i Sydgrønland
fields.abstract:
The project examines the hydropower potential of the river at Qorlortoq in Southern
Greenland through an assessment of the geology of the area, the water chemistry and the flow
of the river, the climatic conditions and these elements’ influence on hydropower, together
with hydraulic and economic conditions for a micro-hydropower plant. The hydropower po-
tentials are evaluated in proportion to the power output of the plants and the construction cost.
The flow of the river is assessed to be between 100-300 litres pr. second through most of the
year. A relation between water depth, measured at a specific spot in the river, and the water
flow is made and the relation is found to be accurate. All risks for sedimentation and weather-
ing and corrosion of the plant are found to be very
small.
Two hydropower plants seem possible; a small plant
with a head of 30 m and a dimensioned
water flow of 200 litres pr. second and a big plant
with a head of 182 m and a dimensioned
water flow of 150 litres pr. second. As far as possible, the small hydropower plant is designed
so the beneficiaries can construct it themselves. It is assessed that the big plant should be built
by suitable labour because of its large dimensions.
The dams of the hydropower plants should be built on bedrock and the water level in the res-
ervoir at the dam must be kept as high as possible
all the time. The big dam should be constructed as an arc dam. The heat losses through the
penstocks are high enough to prevent
freezing of the water in the penstocks in the winter. The penstocks should be led with air
around because the difference of impact of the surroundings on the heat losses is small. A
Francis turbine with an efficiency of 86 % fits the
best to the small hydropower plant. For the
big plant, a Pelton turbine with an efficiency of 90 % is suitable.
The power of the small hydropower plant is 30.1 kW
and the plant expenses excluding expenses for financing are 850,000 kr., which means about 21,100 kr./kW. The best use is for
both electricity and heat for the farm at Qorlortoq
. If the plant expenses include expenses for
financing, the payback period is 9 years with an annual payment of 122,000 kr.
The power of the big hydropower plant is 192 kW and
the plant expenses excluding expenses
for financing are 8,200,000 kr., which means about
42,500 kr./kW. The power is best used for
electricity for the farm at Qorlortoq, three neighbour farms and the whole village of Qassiarsuk, where it will replace the present electricity
production from oil-driven generators. If the
plant expenses include expenses for financing, an annual payment of 32,000 kr. gives a payback period of 15 years. From an economic point of view, the small plant pays the best.
The choice between hydropower plants should take in
to account that also political factors are
essential today and especially in future. Because of the larger amount of beneficiaries, there is
an incentive to invest in the big hydropower plant,
so one of the plants is not unequivocally
better than the other one.

fields.title: Vejprojektering i Grønland
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
Dette projekt omhandler en vejstrækning i Grønland
fra bunden af 1. Fjorden, til 2. Fjords
Gletsjeren, hvor der planlægges at anlægge et turistområde. Vejens primære formål er
derfor at sikre at turister kan fragtes hele vejen
fra lufthavnen i Kangerlussuaq til
turistområdet i bunden af 2. Fjorden. 
Baggrunden for projektet er Sisimiut kommunes ønske
om at undersøge muligheden for at
igangsætte byggeriet af turistområdet, som i høj grad afhænger af muligheden for at
anlægge en vej til området.
Projektet er udarbejdet på baggrund af det udleverede data, og tegningsmaterialet er udført
i InRoads/MicroStation.

fields.title: Spildevandsrensning på Grønland
fields.abstract:
In Greenland there is a widespread wastewater
problem, as there is no tradition for treatment
of wastewater before it is discharged to the
terrain, or to the ocean. This causes a number of
odour, health and environmental problems.
In the town of Sisimiut there are currently
two small-scale wastewater treatment facilities
implemented, as well as a mini flush toilet. On
e of the treatment faci
lities consists of a
bioblock system, while the other is a mini
-treatment-facility of
the type Kongsted.
The three installations have not
been functioning optimally due
to a series of technical
problems. An evaluation of the three installa
tions is performed, and the current status is
investigated.
Too many houses were connected to
the bioblock facility, which
resulted in an overload. The
overload caused odour problems for the surr
ounding houses, because the wastewater had
seeped up to the surface of the terrain. The houses
using the bioblock facility have chosen to
abandon the system, and use the muni
cipal pipeline system instead.
The Kongsted facility has had a series of techni
cal problems such as in
correct installation of
the pipes, circulating the sludge, as well as
malfunctioning equipment. These problems have
been remedied, and the facility is fully operati
onal. However, analysis of the wastewater
indicates that the sedimentation tank needs to be
emptied, in that the nitrogen content in the
effluent is too high. In addition, removal of phosphorous should be considered.
The mini flush toilet has not f
unctioned optimally at any time, and is currently not in use. The
problem with the toilet has been that the wate
r lock has not functioned. A new water lock is
currently being shipped to Sisimiut. At the term
ination of this project the new water lock had
not yet been installed.
Of all the installations, the Kongs
ted facility is the only one that
has proven capable of water
treatment in Sisimiut. However, the facility is
expensive, in that the cheapest facility costs
30.000 kr. not including shipment to Greenland.
Upon evaluation of the three faci
lities it is recommendet that an investment be made in
bioblock technology. With a corre
ct dimensioning of the faci
lity, the technology will most
likely be capable of treating the wastewater to
a sufficient degree that discharge directly to
the terrain or ocean is possible without h
ealth and odour problems.

fields.title: Biogas Production from the waste of the shrimp manufacture in Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
This report describes the study of the viability of implementing a biogas plant in Royal Greenland
Sisimiut plant, using its shrimp waste as the substrate of the digestion. The study is divided in two
parts, the first one is focus on the shrimp waste experimental analysis and the second part is
about the future biogas plant characterization.
From the experimental work was concluded a potential biogas around 200 Nm3 CH4/Tn VS; due to
some incoherence in the experimental results, its value of biogas potential was no used to
characterize the biogas plat. Moreover, it was observed big difference between the laboratory and
the real scale plant, regarding the optimal volatile solid concentrations. Anyway, it was observed
that this kind of waste has a big potential for the biogas production.
Regarding to the biogas plant implementation, the required dimensions and the design of each
unit has been done, adapting them to the Royal Greenland Sisimiut requirements and limitations.
Due to the lack of some of the information needed to make a deep analysis of the biogas plant,
the present report is only a draft of a future biogas plant assessment. At this moment, it could not
be realized because of the short project duration as well as the long waiting time for the supplier
companies’ replies.

fields.title: Building Renovation in Assaqutaq
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
The renovation concerns two houses that have been built in 1930’s.The houses are located in
Assaqutaq, a small village on an island, 15 kms far
from Sisimiut, the second biggest city in
Greenland with 6000 inhabitants.
In the 60ties and 70ties small settlements around Greenland were abandoned because people
choose to move to the bigger towns to work and enjoy the modern facilities. The village is
today used as a summer camp for the local public schools. In June it is a busy place when the
inhabitants from Sisimiut go to fish for the capelin –a small fish which is important for dog
food. During the leisurely stroll around the settlement we see the old fishing factory, the
summer camp and the small church that is still here
, beautifully situated on a small hill top.
We can find 26 houses in Assaqutaq, each defined by
a number. The houses we have to work
on, B80 and B86, are currently used as dormitories.
The municipality expects from us to
renovate the houses to improve the comfort they can
provide.

fields.title: Clay Stabilization in Greenland
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
The long-term operation of any construction project
depends on the quality of the underlying soil.
This means that the stability of the soil where a structure or a pavement is placed should be stable
in long term to assure the good operation of the project.
In this project it is studied the viability of the
lime treatment in the Greenlandic clays. The idea of
this method is based in the chemical transformation
of an unstable soil in a soil that can be used
for determined aims.
The lime treatment in clays is a method that has been usually used in Europe during the last years
due to is a cheap and effective way to stabilize. However, the method has not been used regularly
in Greenland.
The European clay has a different composition from
the Greenlandic one and this is something
that can affect to application of the treatment. The idea here will be the study if these differences
are definitely fundamental for the application of the method.
In order to study the different ways that the soil
is affected, the idea along this project is to
compare some properties with samples from Denmark,
where the treatment has been made
before, and samples from Greenland. The laboratory
tests made were basically: Atterberg limits,
compaction, consolidation.
Another important influence in the application of the treatment is the very special conditions that
affect to the region to treat. The very low temperatures will affect in the reaction time and
permafrost seems to affect in a very special way to
the treatment. Due to time reasons, in this
project was not made test contemplating these conditions. The reproduction of this conditions can
be made with the same tests made in temperatures around zero degrees, due to the laboratory
temperatures oscillate around twenty degrees.

fields.title: Energy supply for an Arctic cottage
fields.abstract:
International interest in the Arctic area is recently increasing, since this region plays a crucial role in the
thermal flux regulation of the Earth. As such, it is considered one of the understanding keys to global
warming mechanisms. Greenland in particular is a very fragile country where greenhouse effects are easily
recognizable.
The wide and isolated distribution of Greenlandic population represents a technical and environmental
challenge. The most common method of supplying energy to remote areas in Greenland is by diesel
generators, as grid extension can be extremely expensive or technically unfeasible. Evidently, this is a
logistic difficulty, especially during the winter time, and also an environmental problem due to CO2
emissions.
Accordingly, this project deals with the use of the
Greenlandic natural resources potential. More precisely,
it consists on the electricity supply of an isolated site by a small hybrid stand-alone system which includes
photovoltaic panels, wind turbines and a diesel generator. It is reported to be the first system of these
characteristics in Greenland and it should be regarded as a test facility.
The hybrid system itself involves two different production technologies (solar and wind), a batteries storage
system, some electronic controllers and a power inverter. All these are temperature sensitive elements
which performance must be tracked under hazardous Arctic conditions. The scope of the study should
therefore be in the long term in order to have a realistic approach of its behavior. Consequently, a monitoring system able to track the hybrid system f
or a long period was also needed.
This thesis aims to cover all issues related to the
installation of such a hybrid system. The highlighted
contents of the report are: a deep explanation of all the hybrid system elements including its installation
features, a simulation of the expected solar electricity production of the site, an economic approach, an
energy and environmental savings assessment and the
social interest in Greenland.

fields.title: The Enlargement of Sisimiut’s Harbour
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
The municipal harbour is one of the mos
t important features of Sisimiut. Since the city is the second
largest one in Greenland, its port has become one precious spot due to the prawn industry, commercial
activities and tourism. This is the reason why the city has grown up around it.
The problem
which is taking place nowadays is
the
difficulty
that the port’s facilities are having
at the
time of
handling the growing number of passengers and quantities of goods seen in recent years. 
This has happened at the same time as the freight quantities have also increase
d. The increased
numbers of trawlers catching prawns outside Sisimiut gives more landings with the frozen catch.
Therefore, there is also a need to secure more space for reefers on the harbour.
Thus, our task would be related on improving the harbour facil
ities in Sisimiut in August. More
specifically, our work will be focused on the extension of this port in order to make it capable to cope
with these latest needs.

fields.title: Heating of Tourist Cottage in the Arctic
fields.abstract:
Along the years it has been seen an increase of the poor indoor climate in the houses of
Arctic countries which is traduced in a health’s problems. Furthermore there is a necessity
of heating during all year according to the extremes conditions of these countries. Thus it
is obviously find a solution, and in order of the new developing energy sources the overall
scope of this Master Thesis "Heating of tourist cottages in the Arctic" has been the heating
supply and ventilation of cottage with solar air collector, bases in preheating the fresh air
with solar air collector to check the performance of these systems under extreme environ-
mental conditions.
In order to confirm the viability of this system a SV30 model was installed on the roof
of a house in Assaqutaq, Greenland. The benefits expected to reach by this technology
are the renovation of the indoor air and heating supply. With the renovation of the indoor
climate moisture and moulds have been reduced, which is translated in a healthy place for
people, furniture and the house.
The system starts working when the sun shines, then the fresh air is injected and
heated. The solar cells inside the collector generate electricity to the fan, which blows hot
air into the house. The fan works with a performance of 100-150 m3/h, and 230 m3/h
of capacity. An advantage of the solar air collector is its operation without electricity, it
means, without operating costs.
In order to achieve this, Sun radiation has been calculated for different tilts and orien-
tation, to decide the optimal position of the solar panel in Greenland. To get it, a special
program called Mantlsim was used.
After the installation the performance of the solar air collector has been analyzed. To
do that some measurements of temperature and humidity have been taken during one week
in June, in order to analyze the efficiency of the system. The result of the study has been
that the solar air collector works with a performance of 58,6%.

fields.title: Micro Hydropower
fields.abstract:
This report give at the beginning a short description of a hydropower system, analyzing the different
characteristics which influence the design of the hydropower. The basic physics needed to understand the
flow into a pipe are explained together with the equations that govern this flow.
The second part of the report is focused in the design and installation of a movable micro hydropower in the
Second Fiord up to Sisimiut, Greenland. The previous design made in DTU is presented step by step
including all the components of the system . . The turbine was produced by PowerPal and the design fitted
with it in Greenland as we had not it before. It has a power of 200W. The calculations done with the data
obtained from the fieldwork are presented with some new ideas to improve it.
Finally, a study about the installation feasibility of a hydropower in a cottage close to the ice cap, between
the lakes 136 and 127, is done, proposing the first characteristics of the system and the most appropriate
material to build it, guarantying a constant supply of electricity for cooking, lighting, entertainment and
food storage.

fields.title: Grundvandsundersøgelser i Grønland
fields.abstract:
A well has been built during the construction of a
water power plant at the second estuarine north of
Sisimiut on the west coast of Greenland. The well,
which is placed in a spring, is at the moment (June
2009)
providing water for the building site. After finish
ing the construction, several interested parties ha
ve gotten
the idea that the water in the well, since it taste
s so good, should be sold as bottled mineral water.
Therefore they are requesting, by an analysis of th
e water quality and the capacity of the well, an
evaluation of the potential of using the well water
as drinking water. Water samples are taken and
analyzed, and pumping tests are worked out on the w
ell. Also, a georadar investigation of the sediment
ary
layers in the area around the well is made. With th
e data from the georadar as well as maps from the l
ocal
area, it is possible to make conclusions how the wa
ter flows and from where. To strengthen this, water
tests from a nearby lake and a tunnel in the neares
t bedrock hill are made.
From the georadar investigations no groundwater tab
le, permafrost or bedrock could be seen. The bedroc
k
is by a simple mathematical model calculated to be
at a depth of 74 m. The boundary between the
sedimentary layers was observed, and upstream from
the well these formed a depression where water can
be gathered. This fits well with the placement of t
he source of the spring. The pump test shows the
reservoir of the well has a transmisivity of 0,117
m
2
/s. In the light of this transmisivity and a hope o
f a
maximum lowering of the water table of one meter, i
t is calculated that it is possible to pump with fl
ow as
high as 95 L/s over a ten year period.
The analysis of the water test shows that the sprin
g water in general contains a low amount of mineral
s.
Only iron exceeds the Danish drinking water thresho
ld a bit.
Oral sources confirm that the spring flows the whol
e year round, but maps from the local area do not s
how
any lakes that supply the spring with water. The an
alysis of the water shows that the content of miner
als in
the spring water and the water from the tunnel are
so different that it can be concluded that the wate
r
from the tunnel does not supply the spring with wat
er. The content of minerals in the lake, which cons
ists
of precipitation and meltwater, is minimal. A model
from the program PHREEQC reveals that the minerals
in the sediment, which forms the reservoir for the
well, are the same as the minerals in the bedrock.
All this
indicates that the water comes from a higher-altitu
de underground reservoir, which receives precipitat
ion
and meltwater from glaciers.
This reservoir is most likely located in the brick
field. A low porosity of the brick field coarse sed
iment
matches a high transmisivity calculated from the te
st pumping. The georadar data shows that under the
brick field is a boundary layer, which probably is
an impermeable marine terrace. This layer makes it
possible to form the underground flow in the depres
sion, upstream of the well.

fields.title: Solenergi I Grønland
fields.abstract:
Dette projekt er udført på baggrund af øget interesse omkring potentialet for solcellegenereret energi i
Grønland. Projektet sætter fokus på 3 lokaliteter i Grønland hhv. Saqqaq i Nordvestgrønland, Sisimiut og Nuuk
i Vestgrønland.
Under indtryk af verdens uhensigtsmæssigt høje C02-udledning- og dermed klodens antagelige
menneskeskabte klimaforværring - og de deraf følgende forandrede livsbetingelser specielt for de artiske og
subarktiske folk. Det er heraf ønskeligt, at disse folk også selv bidrager med en mindre fossilt betinget C02-
udledning ved at flytte det nødvendige energiforbrug fra den aktuelle oliefyrede energiproduktion til en mindre
miljøbelastende sol-genereret energiproduktion.
Da det arktiske - og til dels det subarktiske- område er begunstiget af høj solindstråling i en stor del af året -
hvilket samlet set kan bringe den effektive solindstrålingsperiode en pæn del over f.eks. i soltimer i
mellemeuropæiske lande- vil det være oplagt at placere solgenerende energianlæg i dette område.
Dette uagtet, at der i det højarktiske område faktisk er en kortere eller længere såkaldt mørketid afhængig af
hvilken højere breddegrad man søger. Jo højere breddegrad, jo længere periode hvor solen ikke kommer over
horisonten om vinteren og dermed ringe - eller ingen - solindstråling.
Desuden bidrager også sne-og havdække til at øge solindstrålingen - såkaldt refleksion.
De fleste arktiske bebyggelser er lokaliseret i områder der i op til adskillige måneder om året er dækket af sne
ligesom alle grønlandske bebyggelser er lokaliseret ved havet.
For det grønlandske område gælder tillige det forhold, at nærheden af lndlandsisen yderligere forstærker
solindstrålingen med optimering af solgenereret energiproduktion til følge.
Endvidere er ensprissystemet ophævet i Grønland, hvorfor der i ydredistrikterne er højere energipriser i
forhold til de mere centrale byer. Omtale ydredistrikter er typisk forsynet med fossilgenereret energi, hvilket
kan have langsigtede økonomiske konsekvenser som følge af de stigende olie priser.
Det synes derfor interessant, at forsyne disse bebyggelser med solcelleanlæg for at undersøge den praktiske
anvendelighed for hel eller delvis dækning af energiforbruget ved sådanne solcelleanlæg i arktis.
fields.comment: Lokationen af restende bygninger kendes ikke.

fields.title: Road Construction in the Arctic - Applying geophysics and two mitigation techniques to preserve the permafrost table
fields.abstract:
Hovedparten af de asfalterede veje i Sisimiut i Grønland, har en
konstruktion der ikke beskytter den
underliggende permafrost for nedbrydende mekanismer. Vejenes opbygning og form
betyder at der opstår sætninger i skulderen og revner på langs
ad vejen. Nogle er bygget direkte i naturlige system
er af vandløb uden ordentlige
modforanstaltninger, hvilket medfører tab af understøttelse i
vejkassen fra alluvial fjernelse. Her til kommer at alle vejene oplever en
akkumulering af sne på
siderne af vejkasserne, hvilket isolerer og derved resulterer i en
accelereret optøning af permafrostlaget under vejens skuldre, hvis konsekvens er tab af understøttelse.
Desuden mangler alle tilstrækkelig
dræning, som er nøglen til stabile veje selv i arktiske områder.
Dette kandidatspeciale beskriver anvendelsen af to forebygge
nde teknikker, Air Convection Embankment (ACE) og Light Expanded Clay Aggregate (Leca) installeret i en vejkasse tilsigtet at følge Fairbanks, Alaska designet, bestående af sprængsten med et lavt indhold af fint materiale.
Underbunden blev undersøgt gennem
jordprøver og med to geofysiske undersøgelses metoder, Multi Electrode Profiling (MEP) og Ground Penetrating
Radar (GPR). ACE teknikken er i stor
udstrækning blevet undersøgt i Canada og Alaska med gode resultater og
Leca er undersøgt i Tibet
og i Norge, det sidste som forebygning imod udefrakommende frost. De
to teknikker griber
udfordringen an fra to sider, da ACE fjerner varme fra planum ved en opadgående luftstrøm, hvor
Leca i stedet isolerer mod den udefra kommende opvarmning. ACE betragtes som
den bedste løsning ud fra nærværende resultater, som dog er utilstrækkelige som en hel sæsoncyklus på grund
af en akkumuleret varmelomme opstået fra indelukket vand. Desværre reagerer vand som en accelerator for optøning,
ved at trække kulden udfra de underliggende lag hvilket fører til
acceleration af optøningen. Heraf ses at
dræning er den vigtigste faktor når vejkasser konstrueres iarktiske områder.

fields.title: Drainage system of the road to the glacier
fields.abstract:
The aim of this report is to introduce effective and efficient drainage
system for planned road
from end of the first fjord north of Sisimiut to glacier between fjords.
The proposal for the road is being done by DTU student Peter Baj Lund so this report is supplement to the Peterś
project and is based on proposals already done by Peter.
Weather conditions in the area have been investigated in order to roughly estimate the amount of water falling to the area in the form of precipitation. Using the MapInfo software the area
where from the water flows to the road structure was determined and on the base of the water amount per square meter the total amount of water coming to the different parts of the road, either in the form of streams or areal flow,
was calculated. The solution for the drainage system in different parts of the road based on the difference in the terrain and amount of water is presented.

fields.title: Energy supply  for an Arctic cottage
Klimatilegnet byplanlægning I Akia, Grønland
fields.abstract:
Grønlændere har en gammel tradition for at bygge klimatilegnet byggeri, som desværre er blevet spoleret af de nyere træhuse, som er blevet importeret af danske tilflyttere.
Der var engang, hvor de lokale byggede deres huse af de materialer, som var til rådighed. Det tidligste eksempel er igloer, som foruden at være bygget af is, havde velovervejede indgange og placeringer i forhold til hinanden og vejrforhold. F.eks. var indgangene placeret således, at de blev holdt fri for sne.
Et andet eksempel på et traditionsbundet grønlandsk hus, er tørvehytten. Den bestod af tørv og klippestykker, som der er stor forekomst af i den grønlandske natur. I disse var indgange og indretning også nøje overvejede mht. vind og sol.
Vi vil i dette projekt forsøge at finde tilbage i disse klimatiske tankegange og overføre det til mere moderne og funktionelle huse, som den typiske Grønlænder vil føle sig vel tilpas i.
Vi baserer dette projekt og forslag på 3 ugers ophold i Sisimiut, hvor vi  havde kontakt til både lokale og kommunen for at finde inspiration. Derudover søgte vi inspiration i allerede eksisterende byggerier i både større byer og små lokale bygder.

fields.title: Tekniske undersøgelser for anlægsarbejde i fjeld i Grønland
fields.abstract:
I denne rapport er der gennemført bjergartsmekaniske samt bjergartsfysiske studier på bjergartsforekomster
omkring Sisimiut. 5 forskellige kerneprøver fra området har givet vis dannet grundlag for laboratoriestudier
beskrevet i denne rapport. Endvidere har laboratoriestudierne, givet vis, realiseret forståelse for
bjergartsmekaniske-, bjergartsdynamiske samt bjergartsstatiske egenskaber for disse prøver. Som et led i
feltstudier nord for Sisimiut er der hjemtaget prøver til laboratoriet hvor ovenstående laboratoriestudier for
disse prøver ligeledes blev gennemført. Resultater fra laboratoriestudierne kunne dermed give en nærmere
forklaring på hvilken type sten vi har at gøre med i feltet, i forhold til stentyper omkring Sisimiut. Denne
opnået viden blev derfor anvendt som værktøj i fortolkning af feltstudierne.
Feltstudier har været præget af nye samt gamle undersøgelser. Tidligere forundersøgelser, udarbejdet i
forbindelse med opførelse af et vandkraftværk har givet et større indblik i de geologiske forholde før de
endelige feltmålinger blev udført. Hermed har det været muligt at gøre de nye feltundersøgelserne mere
specificeret omkring et givent område.
Resultater fra udførte feltstudier samt resultater fra laboratoriestudier kan koreleres således, at Q-værdier og
lydhastigheder i bjergarter som værktøj kan give en indikation for hvad man under fortolkning af feltmålinger
kan forvente. Resultater fra laboratoriet er dermed anvendt som værktøj i fortolkning af seismiske samt
schmidt hammer resultater i form af hhv. lydhastigheder og rebound værdier. Sprækker og revner kan givet vis
hermed kortlægges eller fortolkes yderligere ud fra alternative målemetoder.
Q-værdien, kan vurderes efter den kendte Q-metode hvor de udførte felt- samt laboratoriestudier kan gøres
sammenlignelige. Hertil er det derimod vigtigt at kunne argumentere for hvordan man stiller resultaterne op
ud fra anerkendte metoder og teorier da der i dag findes mange metoder til at korrelere Q-værdier. Anvendte
bjergartsmekaniske eller bjergartsfysiske undersøgelsesmetoder og anvendte korrelationsteorier er herunder
blevet undersøgt nærmere for anvendelse.
Reboundmålinger er tidligere anset som en målemetode avnedt i betonindustrien, men i felten har disse
målinger vist gode resultater der kan sammenlignes med de seismiske undersøgelser. Reboundværdien der
fortæller noget om bjergartens egenskaber på overfladen har vist sig at give et klarere indblik i hvad der ligger
under overfladen, forskellen med seismikmetoden er at reboundværdien ikke med sikkerhed kan give
indikationer for zoner med sprækker- eller revner.
Q værdien der anvendes meget i udførelsen af tunnelanlæg verden rundt, blandt andet til projektering vil
kunne gøres mere effektiv ved at man under feltstudier kunne forbedre fortolkning af geofysiske målinger,
eksempelvis seisimiske målinger. Dette vil gavne udførelsen da man idag, i form af kvalitetssikring, laver
løbende beskrivelser af den pågældende bjergart hvortil en tunnel eller fjeldanlæg bliver udsprængt.
Seismikken kan give et klart billede af hvad der ligger under overfladen, men hvordan man kombinere det med
en Q-værdi kræver en større videnindsamling og en lang række større laboratorier og feltunderstudier på
udførte fjeldanlæg. Dette er blandt andet hvad Nick Barton er kendt for, blandt andet skaberen af Q-metoden.

fields.title: MODULEHUT - Koncept for hytter i Grønland
fields.abstract:
Fra opgaveformulering:
Projektet tager udgangspunkt i en stadig stigende lokal 
interesse for private fritidshuse og et ønske om udvikling og 
udbedring af de eksisterende turistmæssige boligforhold i 
Grønland. Projektet gennemføres i tre faser.
 Registrering:
Afkode og registrere lokale relevante forhold for projektet; 
metodik, teknologi, materialer, arbejdskraft, tradition, 
innovation, kultur og klima. 
 Konceptudvikling:
Registreringen skal danne grundlag for etablering af 
koncept for hytter baseret på 
- Lokal produktion
- Få specialiserede elementer
- Simpel samleteknik
- Fleksibel kombination
 Produkt:
Sidst præsenteres to eller flere løsninger for hytterne i 
plan og visualiseringer.
Konceptet skal kvalitativt underbygges af relevant 
statiske og energimæssige beregninger samt relevant 
tegningsmateriale.

fields.title: Wind turbine (PROVEN6-300) testing & installation
fields.abstract:
In order to forecast the technological development of the wind turbine from Proven, which has 
been installed in Sarfannguaq village in Greenland, and to understand the effect of changing in 
net voltage and frequency, a number of tests have been done in the Lab of the DTU. 
Furthermore, a number of tests have also been done to find out the recommended parameters that 
should be used in order to get the best gain from this wind turbine.

fields.title: Kortlægning af råstoffer på havbunden med den seismiske metode
fields.abstract:
To increase growth in the greenlandic society it is planned to build a road between the next biggest
city, Sisimiut, and the biggest airport in Greenland at Kangerlussuaq. The aim for this report is to
investigate the usability of sea bottom sediment deposits, close to the planned road in the Sisimiut
area, for road construction. Based on seismic surveys on three locations carried out in 2004 we have
planned new surveys to confirm the seismic results. The new surveys consists of bottom sampling
and sediment analysis. From our results we found different usability of the sediments in the areas,
and from the seismic surveys we estimated quantities of reachable sediments. The sediments at
Førstefjorden and Utoqqaat are to some extent possible to use as material for road construction. We
found that the sediments at Førstefjorden with some mixing will be suitable to construct the
baselayer of the road, while the sediments at Utoqqaat will be suitable to construct the intermediate
layer of the road. The sediments at Maligiaq are at the other hand of no interest for road
construction. A sand sucker with a range of 20 meter will be able to suck up at least 2 mio m3
sediments at Utoqqaat and no sediments at Førstefjorden. A sand sucker with a range of 50 meter
will be able to suck up at least 11 mio m3
 and 7 mio m3
 sediments at Utoqqaat and Førstefjorden
respectively.

fields.title: Vej mellem Kangerlussuaq og Indlandsisen
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
Denne rapport omhandler primært vejen fra Kangerlussuaq til Indlandsisen. Vejens tilstand er særdeles dårlig og forværres fra år til år under tøperioden. Det er i særdeleshed turismens interesse at der fokuseres på dette. For at komme problemerne til livs må alt fra praktiske analyser til planlægning af handlingsplaner ske.
Foruden vejens stand har forskere interesse i områderne omkring vejen. Dette gælder fx jordbundsundersøgelser med både radar og boringer. Dette vil lige ledes blive behandlet i denne 
rapport.
Formålet med denne rapport er at beskrive vejens nuværende tilstand. Ud fra billeder taget fra tøperioden, og analyser af vejens stand skal årsagerne til problemerne besluttes og løsninger 
forslås.
Forslag til en stikvejs linieføring ind til turristattraktive hytter nær Israndsøen skal kortlægges, med GPS.
GPS fixpunkter, iskerneboringer og georadarmålinger skal beskrives men ikke diskuteres.
Der er udført 10 dages feltarbejde som baggrund for denne rapport, 5. til 15. august 2009. 
Vejen er blevet analyseret og fotodokumenteret. Ydermere er der indhentet fotodokumentation hos kommunen i Kangerslussuaq fra tøperioden sidste år. 
Vha. GPS er mulighederne for en stikvej ind til Israndsøen blevet kortlagt.
Under opholdet hjalp projektgruppen også adjunkt Thomas Ingeman-Nielsen og Ph.d. 
Studerende Inooraq Brandt med deres undersøgelser. Disse bestod i opretning og indmåling af GPS fixpunkter, optagning af iskerneboringer samt georadar opmålinger.

fields.title: Occurrence and Distribution of Antibiotic Resistance in Arctic Bacteria related to Environmental Antibiotic Exposure and Human Fecal Contamination
fields.abstract:
Sewage  treatment  plants  are  lacking  in  Sisimiut  (Greenland),  and  municipal  wastewater  is 
discharged directly into the sea. Thus, untreated wastewater from Sisimiut´s hospital is discharged into 
the  bay Ulkebugten.  Mussels  and  sculpins  were  collected  from  a  contaminated  site  (bay  Ulkebugten,  by 
the  hospital)  and  a  reference  site  (uninhabited  island  Frederik  VII´s  Ø).  Bacteria  from  mussel´s 
hepatopancreas  and  sculpin´s  gut  were  extracted  and  tested  for  antibiotic  resistance  (AR)  by  plate 
culturing on antibiotic substrates. Colonies appearing on plates with antibiotics were identified using the 
API  20  E  test.  Bacteria  resistant  to  ciprofloxacin were  only  found  in  the  contaminated  site,  suggesting 
that AR  towards this  antibiotic has been acquired  there. Resistance towards  ampicillin and  amoxicillin 
may also have been acquired at the contaminated site. E. coli was found in the contaminated site, which 
suggests  the  existence  of  fecal  contamination.  Aeromonas  hydrophila  or Vibrio  fluvialis, both  potential 
human pathogens, resistant to ampicillin was also found in the contaminated site. Different composition 
between  the  bacterial  communities  from  the  contaminated  and  reference  sites  was  also  observed, and 
this  may  be  due  to  the  selective  pressure  exerted  by  antibiotics  in  the  contaminated  site.  Further 
identification  by  gene  sequencing  will  be  done  in  the  next  months.  More  than  90%  of  all  Greenlandic 
exports  are  derived  from  the  fish  industry  and  the possibility  that  potential  human  pathogens  acquire 
further AR due to antibiotic exposure or fecal contamination could be a threat for both the consumers of 
Greenlandic fish and seafood and the Greenlandic economy.

fields.title: Waste management in Sisimiut - Evaluation of the incineration potential
fields.abstract:
Waste  is  a  major  issue  for  every  society  for  the  potential  emissions  it  can  release  to  the  different 
environmental  media  and  the  nuisance  it can  cause  to  the  local  population.  A  more  positive  perspective 
shows  that  waste  can  be  a  source  of energy  and  raw  material  assuming  the waste  hierarchy, which  puts 
highest  priority  in  reducing  the  waste  production,  then  encourages  reuse  and  recycling  of  waste  and 
finally  tries  to  minimize  the  dispose  of waste  in  landfills. 
In  an  arctic  environment  like  Sisimiut,  the  situation  is  different  considering  the  climate,  the  little 
population,  the  remote  location  and  the  induced  limited  trade.  Thus  focus  is  rather  put  on  waste 
minimisation, incineration with  energy recovery, some  alternative  treatments  and  the  utmost  reduction 
possible  of  landfills. 
This  project mainly  dealt  with  the  first step  of  the  establishment  of  a  waste management  plan  that  is  the 
waste  characterization.  A  waste  sorting  campaign  carried  out  in  August  2009  indicated  that 
0.36kg/inhab./d  was  produced  in  the municipality.  A lone  biowaste  and burnable  residuals  accounted  for
73%  of  the  waste.  Recyclables  such  as paper, glass, cardboard, plastic  and  metals represent 8.4%,  7.1% 
3.0%,  2.4%  and  2.0%  ww  respectively.  Hazardous  waste  fortunately  represents  only  1.2%  ww,  which 
indicates  that  the  users  do  a satisfactory  separation.
Then,  based  on  the  data  provided  by  the  incinerator manager  and  the  analysis  of  statistical  data,  the 
energy  potential  from  incineration  was  evaluated.  It  came  out  that  the  burning  of  waste  could  cover 
approximately  23%  of  the  domestical heating  needs.  Nevertheless,  high variance  in  efficiency  over time 
was  recorded  indicating  that  some  improvements  are  possible.  Some  leads  could  be  to  better  control 
parameters  like  air  supply,  water content  or  waste  composition, maintain each  unit  of  the  incinerator, 
and  recover  the  cooled  energy  in summertime  by  producing  electricity  for instance. 
Finally  the feasibility  of  some alternative  treatments  was  discussed considering  the  available  amount  of 
each fraction  and  some  technological requirements.  The  alternative  solution with the  greatest  potential 
seems  to  be  the  reuse  of  paper  and  cardboard  as  insulation  material.  Glass,  plastic  and  metals  could 
eventually  be  added  in  road  construction  materials.  To  enable  these alternative  treatments,  it  is  essential 
to  implement  source-segregation.  This  recalls  the  importance  of  public  participation,  which  should  be 
encouraged  in  several  ways  like information  and  possibly  financial incentives.

fields.title: Oil Products Used in Greenland
fields.abstract:
Greenland is the largest island on Earth, located in the northern hemisphere. From
Cape Farewell in the south to the world's northernmost landmass, Odak Island, there is
a distance of 2,670 kilometers. Measured across, the island stretches 1,050 kilometers at
its widest point. Out of Greenland's 2,175,600 square kilometers area, only about  fifteen
percent is free of ice; the rest is covered by the world's second-largest ice sheet: the inland ice
(approximately 2 millions square kilometers). The coastline of Greenland is almost 40.000
km long, so it is comparable to the length of the Equator.
Greenland has an arctic climate. That means that the average temperature in the summer
never exceeds 10°C and there is permafrost, so
only the top layers of soil thaw in the summer. That also means that the country has little rainfall and no forests - only a little brush
and bushes as tall as a man can grow in south
Greenland. The size of the country causes the
weather in Greenland to vary widely. In Greenland sudden changes in weather are common.
Precipitation is mostly snow. The north part of
the island and most of the interior characterizes
true an arctic climate, with the temperature
only rising above freezing for brief periods in
the summer. During the winter, temperatures
range from - 5°C to - 30°C and in the summer
from 4°C to 15°C. In the southern part and the
innermost parts of the long fjords, the temperature can, however, rise up to more than 20° C
in June, July or August. The air is generally
very dry in Greenland and that is why temperatures do not feel as cold as in Europe .The
summer period runs from June all the way into
September.
Several systems of sea currents meet in Greenlandic waters. They in
uence the temperature
and salt content of the sea, and thus the occurrence of marine organisms. The sea currents also determine the spread of the sea ice. Because of the sea ice, the areas from Qeqertarsuup Tunua (Disko Bay) north, as well as the east coast can only be navigated for a few
months in the summer. Excluding West Greenland from Paamiut (Frederikshlb) to Sisimiut
(Holsteinsborg), there is what is known as the open water area, where the fjords and waters
near the coast freeze only occasionally in the winter.
3
On 1st of January 2009 Greenland's population was 56,194, of whom 47,000 live in towns
with the remainder living in small settlements up and down the east and, in particular, the
west coast. Greenland's capital, Nuuk, has approximately 15,000 inhabitants. The second
largest town is Sisimiut with 5,458, followed by Ilulissat (4,528) and Qaqortoq (3,304).
Usually, in Greenlandic settlements live between 50-500 inhabitants.
Fishing and hunting continues to be a dominating sectors in Greenlandic economy.
Currently,  sh and seafood production is the primary export industry - more than 90%
of all exports are derived from  sh products, including prawns and Greenland halibut.
Greenland is home to one of the most modern 
eets of  shing vessels in the world today
and has a large industry exporting high quality seafood products to markets all over the
world.
The  shing industry is the largest consumers of petroleum products. That is why
consumption of the energy and fuels is strictly connected to the  shing industry. In these
days it is quite common that the  shing activity is moving to dierent areas, which means
that the fuels supply needs to move as well.
The quite hard climate condition, population as well as location and distances between
towns and settlements causes that supply energy for Greenlandic society becoming huge
challenge. As it is shown in the Figure 2 energy sources in Greenland are based on the oil
products. The dependence on petroleum products import is so extremely high, that any
disturbances in supply chain could be dangerous not only for single household, but for the
whole society. In the worst-case scenario this strong correlation may entail that the society
will stop functioning; without fuels supply there is lack of heat , lack of electricity and the
transport is unrealizable.
In the next sections, the report is focusing on overview of the main oil products used
in Greenland, determining their properties and the amounts used. The process distribution
and storage will be presented as well.

fields.title: Trafik i Grønlandske byer
fields.abstract:
This report is the result of the course Arctic Technology at the centre for Arctic 
Technology at DTU, and is mainly based on the experiences drawn from a summer 
excursion to Sisimiut in Greenland in the summer 2009. 
The purpose of the assignment is to identify the need of better pedestrian and 
cycling conditions in the town of Sisimiut, and then to establish a plan of action on 
the vulnerable road user area. 
This is done through interviews with the citizens, the relevant people at the 
municipality and registrations in the city. 
It is found, that the vulnerable road users in Sisimiut are very much in need of 
better physical conditions, especially along the main roads. 
Solutions for the vulnerable road users are suggested on the basis of conversations 
with the local entrepreneur, and with reference to the Greenlandic town of 
Ilulissat. Furthermore GIS software is used to prioritize the streets, which have to 
be subject of improved infrastructure for vulnerable road users.

fields.title: Water distribution system in Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
The following report analyzesthe hydraulic behavior ofthe water distribution systemof Sisimiutin
themorning hours 6:00-9:00. Thisis, when supply pressures can not bemetin various parts oftown,
due to 80% withdrawal of water by the fish factory RGonly. The existing utilitymodel wassupplied
by Rambøll and customized by usto observe the respond ofthe network according to realflow data
time series of RGcollected during field work. The calibration was verified by pressuremeasurements
taken during ourstay in Sisimiut. To solve low pressure problems,the alternative of constructing an
elevation tank is analyzed. The storage tank is designed in such a way thatit balances RGdemand in
peak hours and guarantees aminimumwatertable variation,resulting in a storage of 100m3
.
Simulationsrevealed thatthe elevation tank can solve pressure problemsin the northern part of
town butthatthey stay persistentin the area around Kaaliikassaap Aqq. To solve this problem, itis
necessary tomerge pressure zone Tz5 and Tz6 with Kaaliikassaap Aqq into one pressure zone with a
circulating pump.

fields.title: IlluHOME
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
IlluHOME er et forslag til udvikling og strukturering   af turismen i arktiske egne, gennem en enkelt,  fleksibel og 
bæredygtig hytte .  Fokus er lagt på Grønlands fremtidige rolle under indarbejdning af bæredygtig turisme. 
Grønlandske behov og  traditioner  er   to af de  grundlæggende elementer  for IlluHOME.  E nergiforbrug ved en 
minimal anvendel se af fossile brændstoffer er forudsætning  for bæredygtighed som helhed.  Designet af 
IlluHOME er direkte korreleret med det barske arktiske klima, f orm en udspringer fra behov og forbrug ,  som 
søger at flytte bæredygtighedsbegrebet ind til kernen.   
Projektet IlluHOME er i høj grad en afhandling om PROCES. Processerne omkring realisering af et byggeprojekt 
fra design til produktion. Desuden er IlluHOME en øvelse i at omsætte BEHOV til en fysisk form, herunder 
beskrives behovet for bæredygtig og fleksibel turis me. KLIMA er en helt afgørende faktor,  der skal tages højde 
for ved projektet omkring IlluHOME. Dette gør hytten IlluHOME særligt skræddersyet til de arktiske egne. 
B etydningen af det arktiske klima beskrives  punktvist , hvilket er en metode til at opfylde  d e  klimatiske krav. 
IlluHOME er  ikke kun en afhandling om  simuleret data og teoretiske forslag, IlluHOME er langt mere. Denne 
rapport tager afsats i processen omkring IlluHOME i dens nuværende form, rapporten beskriver alle de behov og 
klimatiske forhold ,   som IlluHOME har måtte opfylde undervejs.

fields.title: Energirenovering af et grønlandsk hus
fields.abstract:
Fra problemformulering:
Langt de fleste renoveringsopgaver løses som totalrenovering på baggrund af traditionelle 
løsninger som bygger på gamle regler og normer. De traditionelle løsninger hæfter sig ved 
bygningsreglement fra 1982 og 2006. Det nye bygningsreglement fra 2006 svarer til den 
danske fra 1995 modificeret med grønlandske forhold.  
Indenfor byggeri på Grønland løses opgaverne uden hensyn til miljørigtig projektering og 
bæredygtighed indenfor valg af materialer.  
Det vil være langt at foretrække at udarbejde en omfattende bygningsgennemgang, hvor 
energiforbrugende kilder kortlægges før renovering foretages. Dette kan gøres ved bl.a. at 
anvende nyere udstyr som eksempelvis termografi. Det er nemmere at tage stilling til hvor 
meget der skal renoveres, når man ved hvor bygningen har sine svagheder.  
 
Energirenovering af et grønlandsk hus   Reza Rad S959473 - Nick Nielsen S053058 
 
DTU●BYG  Dato 15/12-2009  Side 8 
 
I projektet arbejdes der på at energirenovering et grønlandsk hus. Dette hus ligger i Narsaq 
i Sydgrønland. Huset anvendes som servicehus af kommune i Sydgrønland, Kommuneqarfik 
Kujalleq, se bilag N. 
I den første del af projektet arbejdes der med de eksisterende forhold og i den sidste del af 
projektet forslås hvordan huset kan renoveres. Der er taget højde for at man kan arbejde 
med 2 forskellige isoleringsmaterialer, den ”økologiske” og den traditionelle løsning. 
Der er konstateret et meget højt olieforbrug i huset A-21 og udfordringen har været at halvere 
olieforbruget.

fields.title: Mikrovandkraftværk
fields.abstract:
Elforsyning i Grønland 
 
Elforsyningen er i de fleste byer og bygder baseret på dieseldrevne el- og kraftværker. Den energi 
der findes i olien omdannes til mekanisk energi i en dieselmotor, i form af en rotation. 
Dieselmotoren er koblet sammen med en generator, der producerer el, når den roterer. 
Elværker udnytter ikke energien i olien ret godt. Kun omkring 35-42 % af energien i olien 
omdannes til elektrisk energi. Hvis man, i form af kraftvarmeværker, også udnytter overskydende 
varme fra dieselmotoren til opvarmning af bygninger og varmt brugsvand – fjernvarme – kan 
udnyttelsen af oliens energi under grønlandske forhold stige til omkring 60-90 %. 
 
Vedvarende energi 
 
Der har de senere år været stigende fokus på, hvordan vedvarende energikilder kan anvendes i 
energiforsyningen. Vandkraft er en oplagt mulighed, idet landet har et vandkraftpotentiale, der 
ligger mange gange over det nuværende samlede energiforbrug. Der er udpeget mere end 15 steder, 
hvor det er muligt at placere vandkraftstationer til både forbruger og industrielle formål; i alt et 
potentiale på 13.000 GWh pr. år. 
I de byer hvor der produceres el fra vandkraftværker, udnytter man kraften som er i faldende vand. 
Jo længere vandet falder, jo mere el kan værket producere. Det styrtende vand driver turbinerne 
rundt, så de kan trække generatorerne, som producerer el. Omkring 90 % af vandets energi 
omdannes til el i de større anlæg. Virkningsgraden i mindre anlæg kan falde til 50 %. 
Det er oplagt at øge udnyttelsen af de betydelige potentialer for vedvarende energi, som Grønland 
rummer i form af vandkraft. At øge andelen af vedvarende energi betydelig kræver dog nye 
teknologier og muligheder for at lagre energien. Dette for at balancere sæsonudsving på forbrug og 
for at kunne forflytte energien til steder uden lokalt potentiale for vedvarende energi. 
 
Fremtidsmuligheder 
Et projekt i forbindelse med Grønlands vand- og energiforsyningsselskab Nukissiorfits hovedkontor 
i Nuuk skal netop undersøge muligheden for at bruge brint og brændselsceller som energilager i 
Grønland. Ideen er at anvende elektricitet i perioder med overskud af vandkraft til at spalte vand til 
brint og lagre denne. I perioder med større energiforbrug, typisk om vinteren, omdannes brint igen 
til strøm og varme i en brændselscelle. Alternativt vil brinten i fremtiden kunne transporteres 
direkte til byer og bygder hvor der ikke er mulighed for at producere miljøvenlig, vedvarende 
energi. 
Med brint og brændselsceller kan det blive muligt på sigt for Nukissiorfiit helt at undgå anvendelse 
af diesel til el- og varmeproduktion. Ligeledes vil brint kunne anvendes som brændstof i 
transportsektoren, og med de betydelige vandkraft potentialer kan eksport af brint også være en 
mulighed i fremtiden.
