fields.title: Malenes Lavenergihus  - Et en-families lavenergihus i Sisimiut, Grønland
fields.abstract:
The project ‘Malene’s low-energy house’ is a project about low-
energy. The project is set in Greenland, so the initial conditions are
somewhat different, partly because of the climate.
The developer, Malene C. N. Mørch, had some requests, which had
to be taken into consideration during the planning of this low-
energy house. In addition to this, the house should meet the
demands of the Building Regulations of Greenland and the district
plan for the area.
In the program Bv98 it was examined how the shape of the house
and the position of the windows influenced on the heatloss. As a
result, it was found, that the house should have the shape of a
hexagon, with a broad, open façade facing south and a closed
façade facing north. The roof design was based upon the terrain
and weather-conditions, the result being a slope of 25 degrees,
facing east-west. Taking the requests of the developer into mind as
much as possible, a plan was made for the house.
Four initiatives were made towards low-energy in this house.
Evacuated tube solar collectors were dimensioned to cover 50 % of
the hot water use in the house. By using the solar collectors SLU-
1500, from Beijing Tsinghua solar ltd. it would be necessary to
place 5 panels, with 16 tubes each, on the roof. These would
produce 2116 kWh, and thereby cover 52.9 %.
Another initiative was ventilation with heat recovery. The chosen
device was VEX330H–engine type 1 from Exhausto. If a device
without heat recovery was used, the head consumption would be
twice the size.
A heat pump was a third initiative, as an addition to the evacuated
tube solar collectors. A pump of the brand DHP-A from Danfoss
was chosen.
The last initiative towards low-energy was the building envelope
and the type of windows. 3 different materials were evaluated and
a suggestion to the composition of ground deck (0,09 m
2
K/W),
external wall (0,15 m
2
K/W) and roof (0,13 m
2
K/W) was made. All
U-values met the Building Regulations. Windows of the brand
ENERGY from Velfac was chosen. 
The goal of this project, was for the house to have a maximum heat
consumption of 288 MJ/m
2
. This amount was chosen with
inspiration from the existing low-energy house in Sisimiut. It was
calculated as 25 % of the maximum head consumption, given in
the Building Regulations of the time. Since then, a new set of
Building Regulations have been made, with a tighter set of rules. In
order to call this house a low-energy house, the maximum heat
consumption must be less than 50 % of the present rules, which in
this case means it must be less than 362 MJ/m
2
. The house has
an expected heat consumption of 269.4 MJ/m
2
, and therefore
meets both demands.

fields.title: Grønlandske turisthytter – analyse og konceptstudie
Grønlands ler i beton – et litteraturstudie
Road constructions in the Arctic Geophysics and permafrost conditions
Road Construction in the Arctic
fields.abstract:
For as long as there has been cold and hard winters
above the Polar Circle no one has given any
thoughts to where or how to construct buildings and
infrastructure, as long as it was working it
would have met the requirements.
In the past, road constructions on Greenland have b
een conducted with the use of either gravel or
blasted rock. But with the effects of global warmin
g, Greenland is becoming more and more aware
of the future challenges due to the inland ice thaw
ing along with the lowering of the permafrost
mirror. The challenges related to this quest will r
equire increasing scientific and technological
development either to avoid that the roads begin to
settle or to address new construction methods.
The latter will be addressed during the master-thes
is while this pre-thesis begins from a more
theoretical direction.
East of the city Sisimiut, on the West coast of Gre
enland, the municipality are interested in
constructing a new road reaching a ski lift a few k
ilometers out of city. The path should corner a
lake that is currently the reservoir for their drin
king water (Figure 25) where it is their intention
to
blast a shelf into the Northern side of the mountai
n, right next to the Lake side.
Though it also could have been interesting to addre
ss the consequences from growing pollution in
the Lake; part of the challenge of this pre-thesis
instead address the quantity demanded to construct
a road from an alternative route. The direction whe
re chosen to economize this quantity as much as
possible, based on depth profiles of ground penetra
ting radar (GPR) investigation shot at an earlier
time. The other part of the pre-thesis relates to t
he theory behind the use of a GPR along with a brie
f
introduction to the processing of these profiles.

fields.title: Scheme for Installation of Wind Turbines in Small Isolated Power Systems
fields.abstract:
With rising fossil fuel prices and the thre
at of global warming already upon us, more
and more individuals and organizations are
turning to alternative sources for their
energy needs. Wind power has become an important renewable energy source in recent
years. Large wind turbines are the fastest expanding sector of the energy business in the
industrialized world. But about small wind turbines, though they are more expensive in
terms of each unit of energy that they can produce, they still have an important role for
electrification of remote areas.
The thesis is going to discus opportunity fo
r using 6 kW wind turbine with existing
diesel generators in Sarfannguaq, discussion about viability of using hybrid wind-diesel
power system in a small-isolated grid. The report includes information about wind
energy, local electrical load profile and
the economical aspects of installing wind
turbine to supply parts of demand together with existing diesel generators.
The early stage studies showed that the scale of wind power production can be small
due to amount of wind available in Sarfannguaq. Also the existing power system is so
small and there is not any electricity market system in Sarfannguaq which may create
interests toward market value of wind power
system. Arctic centre DTU showed interest
in this project because this could be a very unique experience in arctic environment
though the plan could be seeking for a financer for this project from a private sector.
The approach in this work is to calculate the annual wind power production and
estimate the amount of fuel saving due to entering the wind energy inside existing
power system. Of course the scale should be small due to resource limitation and this
directly means that fuel saving can not be so large to create interest for private parties.

fields.title: Anvendelse og sortering af forbrændningsslagger i Sisimiut
Geophysical Investigations of Permafrost Related Structural Failures on Roads in Thule, Greenland
fields.abstract:
Presentreportpresentsthefindingsandresultsof
experimentalgeophysicalworkonroadssuffering
fromsubsidenceduetodegradationofpermafrostla
yersunderneaththeroadsonThuleAirBase.
The work is carried out using ground penetrating ra
dar (GPR) with three different antenna
frequencies; 900 MHz, 400 MHz, and 82.5 MHz. The sp
an in center frequencies is used to
illuminatedepthpenetrationofthethreeantennas.
Initialfieldstudyplansincludedcomplimentary
induced electromagnetic (EM) measurements using a G
EM2 broadband instrument and the
establishmentofaboreholewithinstallationofth
ermo9sensorsinordertomonitorannualsubsoil
temperaturevariations.TheEMmeasurementsweredi
scardedduetocommunicationproblems
betweentheGEM2instrumentandthePDAuserinterf
aceandthedrillingcouldnotbecarriedout
duetosevereweatherconditionsduringwinterwith
theresourcesavailable.
TheGPRworkwascarriedoutontheasphaltpavedp
erimetertaxiwaysouthoftherunwayon
ThuleAirBaseandondirt/gravelroadsoutsidethe
mainbaseareabetweentheDET93andC9
Launchfacilities.Thedatafromtheperimetertaxi
wayprovedvaluableindeterminingdepthsto
internallayerboundariesintheroadembankmentby
theuseofhighfrequencyantennasandthe
mediumtolowfrequencyantennasclearlyindicated
depthstoafewoftheunderlyingnaturalsoil
layers.Dataindicatedacollapseintheuppernatu
rallayerbeneaththenon9frostsusceptible(NFS)
embankmentoftheroad.ThedepthoftheNFSfilli
s1.8metersandtemperaturemeasurements
fromthe50’iescarriedoutonsimilartypeofemba
nkmentandsurfaceontherunwayshowedthaw
penetrationof2.192.4meters.Thiscorrelatedwith
thehighicecontentofthenaturalsoilsinthe
areawithvolumetricthawstrainsof30945%corresp
ondswellwiththeactualcollapseoftheupper
naturallayerandsubsidenceoftheroadsurface.
Measurementsfromthedirt/gravel roadwere harder
tointerpret asdatadidnotproducevery
distinctreflectorsduetolowcontrastsinpermitt
ivitybetweenthelayersandattenuationofsignals
.
However,datadoesindicatedepthsofthe NFSroad
embankmentof approx.293meters.The
differencesinNFSthicknessiscausedbythenatur
alslopeofthearea.Threedepressionswere
causedbythepresenceofculvertsthroughtheroad
embankment,whileafewoftheprofiles
indicatedthinnerlayersunderneaththedepressions
contributingtosubsidenceoftheroad.Allinall
itwasderivedthatcollapseofthesoilsleadingt
osubsidencehastakenplaceinareaswherethaw
haspenetratedintotheuppernaturalsoillayers
withhighicecontents.
Themethodhasshowngreatpotentialindetectingc
ollapsedlayersleadingtosubsidenceofthe
surfaceandthepresenceoficebodiesinthesubso
ilarethoughttobeindicatedbystrongsporadic
reflectorsinparticularlytheperimetertaxiwaypr
ofiles.Furtherinvestigationsincludingcorrelatio
n
withEM,MEPandgravimetricmeasurementshavebeen
recommendedduringlatesummer

fields.title: Svømmehal I fjeld, Akia - Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
Fra problemformulering:
Projektets fokus ligger i udformningen af et skitseforslag
til en svømmehal i fjeldet, hvilket er et ønske fra Sisimiut
kommune i Grønland. Placering af byggeri i fjeld er en ny
måde at bygge på i Grønland. Dette projekt er derfor et forsøg
på at vise, at det en mulig løsning på stedet, Akia.
Kommunen har stillet krav om, at funktionerne
i svømmehallen henvender sig til en bred gruppe af
befolkningen, som omfatter både gamle og unge. Derudover
skal det skabe et fælles socialt samlingssted, som kan
anvendes hele året.
Ønsket om et socialt samlingssted stiller særlige krav, til
indretningen af svømmehallen, i forhold til opholdssteder og
de enkelte bassiner i hallen.
De tekniske installationer behandles gennem
litteraturstudie, og beskrives i korthed. Konstruktionerne
er baseret ud fra beskrivelser og rådgivning fra erfarende
norske ingeniører. Det samme gør sig gældende i forhold til
de geotekniske undersøgelser af klippen.

fields.title: Jollehavn i Paaraasuk
Referenceår for Sisimiut (???)
fields.abstract:
This paper describes the construction of a test reference year for the town Sisimut Greenland, for a period over 1992 -2005. The reference year is compared with earlier constructed reference year for the period 1992-2002, to see if the climatic changes have a considerable influence on the definition of the earlier reference year.
The reference year is constructed using measurements of four climatic parameters delivered by Asiaq Nuuk, Greenland. 
The construction fulfils the described conditions in the standard EN-ISO 15927-4 /1/.

fields.title: Farvede betonsten
fields.abstract:
Formålet med det I denne afhandling behandlede mate
riale er at undersøge en
betonrecept på farvede betonsten, udarbejdet under
forløbet laboratoriepraktik 11761.
Betonen er testet i laboratoriet for styrkeegenskab
er og frostsikkerhed, samt egenskaber
med hensyn til kapillarsugningsevne, porøsitet og d
ensitet. Ved at tage disse resultater
med ud af laboratoriet vil betonen blive testet i v
irkeligheden i Sisimiut, Grønland, hvor
fremstillingen af betonsten, samt brolægning med di
sse skulle skabe et billede af hvordan
betonen arter sig i praktisk brug. Efterfølgende vi
l problemer undervejs i forløbet blive
betragtet og taget til efterretning, og eventuelle
ændringer foretaget ved betonen vil blive
overvåget. Betonen vil efter endt praktisk arbejde
blive undersøgt i laboratoriet, for at
skabe et gennemført billede af de mest interessante
egenskaber, Her nævnes
frostsikkerhed, porøsitet, densitet, kapillarsugnin
gsevne og absorptionsevne som nogen af
de vigtigste. Ligeledes vil det til betonen anvendt
e farvestof (nedknust rød teglsten) blive
undersøgt for dets egenskaber, især med hensyn til
absorption, men også med hensyn til
kornstørrelse og farveevne.

fields.title: Stabilisering af Grønlandsk silt med brændt kalk
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
Vejbygning i Grønland er erfaringsmæssigt kendt for at være problematisk, både ved opbygningen og vedligeholdelse. Det er især i områder med siltede eller lerede aflejringer med meget vand fra nedbør og permafrost problemerne opstår. Ved vejbygningens opstartsfase kan materialet være så flydende, at maskinerne ikke kan komme til på byggepladsen. Efter vejkassens opbygning slår asfalten hvert år i udsatte områder, store revner pga. sætninger i underlagsmaterialet, pga. permafrosten.
Dette problem er særligt kendt i byen Sisimiut, som igennem Institut for Arktisk Teknologi på DTU har efterspurgt en løsning på problemet, som dette projekt vil forsøge at komme nærmere. I Danmark har man haft stor succes med at kalkstabilisere flydende lerarter, derfor ønskes det undersøgt fra instituttets side om det ligeledes er muligt på grønlandske lerarter.
Dette projekt omhandler kalkstabilisering af grønlandsk silt fra Sisimiut, som er optaget fra et igangværende vejbygningsprojekt i Ulkebugten, med højt vandtryk fra omliggende skrænt, som derfor gør vejbygningen problematisk, se figur 1 for placering af Sisimiut og Ulkebugten.

fields.title: Svømmehal i et fjeld
fields.abstract:
At bygge inde i et fjeld er ikke et nyt fænomen. Norge har bl.a. en lang tradition for disse anlæg, og
det er disse erfaringer der føres videre når der projekteres på en ny svømmehal i Sisimiut. Sisimiut,
der er Grønlands næststørste by med 5400 indbyggere, har længe ønsket en overdækket svømmehal.
Og det er besluttet at se på muligheden for at ligge anlægget inde i et af byens omgivende fjelde. Ved
 placering inde i fjeldet opnår visse fordele, som mindsket varmetab, konstant indeklima og mindre
 vedligeholdelse. Desuden undgås det hårde arktiske klima, der ofte giver udforinger til ingeniørerne.
Erfaringer fra Grønlands nyeste svømmehal i Nuuk, viser at besøgsraten er langt højere end iforhold
til danske svømmehaller, og der ligger således et solidt grundlag for en svømmehal, hvilket hænger
sammen med klimaet og den isolerede beliggenhed, der gælder for alle grønlands byer og bygder.
Et svømmehalsanlæg projekteres til en daglig gennemsnitlig belastning på 150 badende.
Bassinprogrammet indeholder varmtvands-, spring-, svømme og sportsbassin, der kan tilgodese de
fleste behov for leg og aktiv udfoldelse.
lndeklimaet i bassinhallen afhænger af fordampningen fra bassin og brugere, og øvrige
udskilningsstoffer, herunder CO2. For at opretholde det termiske indeklima, skal ske et luftskift.
Ventilationen sker ved recirkulering af den fugtige luft fra bassinhallen, der affugtes, genvarmes og
indføres i hallen igen. Der skal dog også ske et friskluftindtag.
Det arktiske klima, bevirker at Ventilationsanlæg vil tilfryse, når varm indeluft møder kold udeluft i
varmevekslere. For at undgå dette benyttes forskellige metoder, hvor der anlæggets dele skiftevis
tilføres ude- og indeluft. Der forelægger forskellige rapporter på forbedringer og videreudvikling af metoderne til at mindske/undgå isdannelser, når den varme luft konderlsere ved mødet med
udeluften.
Med en fordampning på 270 kg/n og 2,2 kg/h fra hhv. bassin og personer i bassinhallen, skal der
foretages en luftskifte på 1-2,6 h-1, og med en strømning på mellem 14.500 og 36.000 m3 efter
- aktivitet og besøgstal,kan sikres et godt indeklima. Mængden af kuldioxid er relativ lille, omkring de
E 3,6- 14 m3 pr. time, og giver et luﬁskifte på mellem 0,00025 og 0,00097 h-1. Selv om det fugten der
 er de umiddelbare største problem, skal der alligevel indtages friskluft til ventilering af luftens C02-
 indhold.
 Varmetabet fra bassinhallen ligger på mellem omkring i 10 kW om sommeren og 18-19 kW om
vinteren. Generelt gælder at fjeldanlæg har mindre varmetab, hvilket vil kunne ses ved
sammenligning af en traditionel bygning.
Et fjeldanlæg således både er billigere i vedligeholdelse og drift, hvis det projekteres rigtigt. Man
 undgår desuden at skæmme den omkringliggende natur og kan anlægges
Fjeldanlæg er en optimal løsning til Grønland og det arktiske klima. 85% af Grønland er dækket af
indlandsisen og det isfrie areal består af skærgårdskyst og blotiagte fjelde. Fjeidene kan med fordel
1 anvendes til svømmehalsanlæg - og andre formål.

fields.title: Blå biomasse – alger til bioenergi - VÆKSTFORSØG MED ULVARIA FUSCA
fields.abstract:
For at kunne benytte den marine makroalge Mørk fjordsalat,  Ulvaria fusca, til 
energiformål,  såsom  i  biogasanlæg,  i  det  arktiske  klima  er  algens  tilvækst  i 
biomasse blevet undersøgt, og samtidig blev algens tilvækst i areal undersøgt 
for at kunne sammenligne med andre vækststudier. 
Forsøget blev udført over en syv dags periode i august 2008 i Sisimiut, Grønland. Algerne blev udstanset til mindre stykker og derefter kultiveret til fire forskellige forsøgs behandlinger. Væksten blev undersøgt i: 
- Havvand  
- Havvand beriget med en syntetisk blanding af næringssaltene N og P. 
- Havvand beriget med rejeaffald 
- Havvand beriget med N, P og CO2. 
Lystilgængeligheden blev ændret i forhold til algens naturlige habitat i det der i 
forsøget ikke forekom tidevandsforskel og den deraf ændrede lystilførsel. Vandets gennemsnitstemperatur i forsøget var på 8 °C. 
Efterfølgende viste tilvæksten sig til at være højst ved behandlingerne tilført den 
syntetiske blanding af N og P. Her var fordoblingstiden for biomassen 3,8 dage 
og  4,7  dage  for  arealet.  Dette  svarer  til  fordoblingstiden  af  tilsvarende  alger 
under  danske  forhold.  Uden  tilsætning  af  næringsstoffer,  dvs.  i  havvand  var 
fordoblingstiden 7,4 dage og 7,7 dage. For at vurdere muligheden for at benytte 
affaldet  fra  Royal  Greenlands  rejefabrik  som  gødning  til  algerne  blev  denne 
form for gødning tilsat. Her blev fordoblingtiden fundet til hendholdsvis 5,7 dage 
og 6,1 dage. 
Resultaterne giver et billede af væksthastigheden underaktiske klima- og næringsfohold, men forsøget skal være mere omfangsrigt forat man kan vurdere 
potentialet for at benytte Ulvaria fuscatil biogasproduktion.

fields.title: Forureningsundersøgelse af GTO pladsen i Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
Der er tidligere blevet udført to undersøgelser på
GTO pladsen. Først af Carl Bro 1995 og siden af
nogle ARTEK studerende i 2002. Det blev fundet, at
der forekom olieforurening i såkaldte ”hot
spots” rundt om på pladsen. ARTEK finder at koncentrationerne i jorden er næsten halveret i 2002 i
forhold til 1995. Der blev derfor igen i 2008 lavet
en serie målinger for, at få information om
grundens nuværende forureningstilstand.
Der er i 2008 fundet koncentrationer af lette kulbrinter fra en halv meter under terræn og ned efter.
I
det nord-vestlige hjørne kan der tillige have været
et nyere spild, hvor forureningen findes, at være
helt overfladenær. Fra Miljøstyrelsen er det besluttet, at der ikke må bygges på en grund hvis der er
forurening i de øverste 50cm af jorden. Ud fra analyser foretaget både i 1995, 2002 og 2008 er det
fundet at forureningen generelt er koncentreret i fire hot-spots og at den geografiske udbredelse er
lille. Der er i 2008 foretaget gravning og prøvetagning i de fire hot spots.
Forureningskoncentrationerne blev målt til at ligge
mellem 170 og 42000 mg/kg fordelt i dybder ned til 2 meter under terræn. Dette ligger generelt
lavere end hvad ARTEK fandt i 2002 selvom
lokale forskelle giver et lidt uklart billede. Forureningen som blev fundet i gravning 1 blev
afgrænset nedadtil i 2 meters dybde, mens der i gravning 3 og 4 kan være forurening dybere end de
1,5 hhv. 1,6 meter der blev gravet til. Brønden på
pladsen, som var tidligere drikkevandsforsyning,
blev ligeledes testet for indhold af olie og her blev der ikke fundet noget. Der er altså intet som
tyder på, at olien transporteres med grundvandet. Der er ligeledes ikke fundet indikationer på
væsentlig stoftransport i jorden.
Umiddelbart er forureningen ikke til fare for mennesker, så længe afdækningslaget forbliver indtakt.
Dog er der fundet helt overfladenær forurening ved
grundens nord-vestlige hjørne, som kan stamme
fra et nyere spild. Her er yderligere afdækning eller opgravning påkrævet.
Vandet i grøfterne omkring grunden blev testet for
olie og tungmetaller. Koncentrationerne af
metaller overskred grænseværdier for 4 ud af 7 test
ede tungmetaller.
Det er fundet, at et samlet jordvolumen på 200m3 ud
gør den væsentligste del af forureningen. Hvis
formålet med en oprensning ikke er at fjerne al for
ureningen, men bare at gøre grunden brugbar for
almindeligt byggeri kan der derfor nøjes med at fjerne et væsentligt mindre jordvolumen end det af
Carl Bro udregnede i 1995. Det nuværende afdækningslag bør dog bibeholdes på resten af pladsen,
samt reetableres efter afgravning således, at der ikke findes forurenet jord i de øverste 50cm.
GTO/Nunatek har ifølge litteraturstudiet 12 grunde
som den omtalte GTO grund i Sisimiut spredt
rundt i Grønland. Det bør derfor også undersøges hvordan disse grunde er håndteret før der tages
endeligt stilling til hvad der skal foretages på GTO pladsen i Sisimiut. Eventuelt kunne der laves et
samlet løsningsforslag for alle 12 grunde.

fields.title: Forudsætninger for vejbyggeri i Grønland
fields.abstract:
Fra introduction:
Denne rapport har til hensigt at kortlægge de vejgeometriske udfordringer der ligger i at bygge vej i
Grønland. Rapporten har sit udgangspunkt i tidligere arbejde med vejstrækningen Sisimiut-
Kangerlussuaq, og linieføringsforslaget præsenteret
i rapporten ”Roadex III, Road construction in
Greenland – the Greenlandic case, 2007” er brugt som udgangspunkt for projektet. Der er udvalgt
en vejstrækning i området omkring Uttoqqaat til vejgeometrisk dimensionering, her passerer vejen
blandt andet flere vandløb og ikke mindst en stejlhøjderyg hvilke giver store udfordringer mht.
dimensioneringen. Der er ikke taget hensyn til geologiske eller geotekniske aspekter.

fields.title: Udarbejdelse af referenceår, 1992-2005, Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
This paper describes the construction of a test reference year for the town Sisimut Greenland, for a period over 1992 -2005. The reference year is compared with earlier constructed reference year for the period 1992-2002, to see if the climatic changes have a considerable influence on the definition of the earlier reference year. 
The reference year is constructed using measurements of four climatic parameters delivered by Asiaq Nuuk, Greenland. 
The construction fulfils the described conditions in the standard EN-ISO 15927-4 /1/.

fields.title: Affaldshåndtering i Grønland – status på affaldshåndtering i 11 Grønlandske kommuner
fields.abstract:
Et af de miljøproblemer som Grønland står overfor, er behandling af affald. I 1980’erne var der ingen 
systemer til affaldshåndtering i Grønland og samtidig havde livsformen ændret sig fra en fangerkultur med et 
minimum af affald til en moderne forbrugskultur. Det største problem var hvordan dagrenovationen skulle 
bortskaffes. I årtier blev affaldet brændt af på en åben losseplads, typisk beliggende i udkanten af byen, og 
denne praksis gør sig stadig gældende i mange byer og bygder i Grønland. Den slags håndtering af affald 
medfører spredning af affald med vind og desuden indeholder røgen fra forbrændingen en række miljø- og 
sundhedsskadelige stoffer. Derudover kan den aktuelle affaldshåndtering medføre sundhedsmæssige 
problemer, især i forbindelse med organisk affald, såsom døde dyr, og ligeledes ved håndtering af klinisk 
risikoaffald og farligt affald. [Basse og Olsen, 2004] Der er dog sket store forandringer i affaldssektoren i 
Grønland siden begyndelsen af 90´erne med bl.a. etablering af affaldsforbrændingsanlæg, hvilket har 
medført at langt størstedelen af affaldet i dag bliver brændt inden det deponeres. Ifølge [Basse og Olsen, 
2004] er 60-70 % af befolkningen omfattet af en affaldsordning hvor affaldet forbrændes. 
De åbne lossepladser findes stadig i både byer og bygder i Grønland. Det er almindeligt forekommende at 
affaldet ikke bliver sorteret inden det smides på lossepladsen og afbrænding på den åbne losseplads finder 
stadig sted. I nogle byer er affaldshåndteringen af en tilfredsstillende karakter, mens det modsatte kan siges 
om andre byer og om bygderne generelt. [Basse og Olsen, 2004] 
 
Ved moderne affaldshåndtering anvendes ofte et affaldshierarki. Her bliver affaldsminimering prioritet højest 
og dernæst genanvendelse. Forbrænding med energiudnyttelse er næste mulighed mens deponering har 
den laveste prioritet [Christensen, 1998]. Deponeringen kan enten være ved forbrænding uden 
energiudnyttelse eller deponering på losseplads. Deponering og forbrænding af farlige og giftige 
affaldsstoffer på havet prioriteres lige så lavt som deponering på land [Basse og Olsen, 2004] 
I de seneste år er der, som nævnt tidligere, blevet etableret forbrændingsanlæg i Grønland hvilket har 
mindsket åben forbrænding på lossepladserne væsentligt. I 2004 fandtes der kommunale 
forbrændingsanlæg i de følgende byer: Qaqortoq, Nuuk, Sisimiut, Aasiaat, Maniitsoq og Ilulissat, mens 
simple forbrændingsanlæg fandtes i 45 bygder. Det blev dog skønnet af Direktoratet for Miljø og Natur, at 
kun ca. halvdelen af bygdeanlæggene virkede tilfredsstillende. [Basse og Olsen, 2004] Affaldshåndtering i 
de to bygder, Sarfanguaq og Itteleq, blev i 2005 undersøgt af tre studerende ved Center for Arktisk 
Teknologi, DTU. Her blev det f.eks. konstateret at temperaturen ved forbrænding i de to bygder var lavere 
end den optimale forbrændingstemperatur. Desuden finder der ingen røggasrensning sted i bygderne, 
hvilket kan udgøre et miljø- og sundhedsmæssigt problem for befolkningen. [Andersen et al, 2005] Disse 
problemer må også forventes at kunne opstå i andre bygder med lignende små anlæg. 
Igennem de seneste år er der kommet mere fokus på genanvendelse af affald, hvor der er tale om 
velegnede sekundære råstoffer. Dette kunne netop være meget relevant i Grønland hvor 
transportomkostninger er store og de fleste varer importeres. Fiskeri er Grønlands hovederhverv hvor rejer 
og hellefisk udgør i alt ca. 85 % af den grønlandske eksport [Basse og Olsen, 2004]. Affald fra 
fiskeindustrien udgør et væsentligt problem i Grønland men der er blevet gjort en del tiltag til at udvikle 
genanvendelsesmuligheder for dele af fiskeaffaldet, hvilket også er lykkedes i et vist omfang. Dog er der 
kun en fabrik som udnytter fiskeaffald (lokaliseret i Ilulissat), ellers bliver en stor del af fiskeaffaldet dumpet i 
havet. [Basse og Olsen, 2004] 
 
[Jørgensen, 2007] har undersøgt mulighederne for nyttiggørelse af affald fra fiskeri og fangst i Uummannaq 
Kommune hvor det blev vurderet at den mest hensigtsmæssige løsning til bygderne i kommunen ville være 
at fokusere på produktion af biogas, da der herved opnås en helhedsløsning for alt fiskeri og fangstaffald. 
Det beregnede energipotentiale for de to bygder viste, at 90% af bygden Illorsuits elforbrug kunne dækkes 
ved bioforgasning af affaldet og 27% af Saattutts elforbrug [Jørgensen, 2007]. Netop den slags løsninger 
kunne være interessante at undersøge for andre kommuner i Grønland. 
Hvad angår genanvendelse af andre affaldsfraktioner, så er det almindeligt forekommende i Grønland at 
affaldet ikke bliver sorteret inden det smides på lossepladsen. Transport til og fra Grønland er økonomisk 
dyrt og det samme gælder for den interne transport. Det betyder at alle genanvendelsesordninger som ikke 
baseres på en lokal oparbejdning bliver økonomisk dyre, hvilket resulterer i at der kun finder meget lidt 
genanvendelse sted. I bygderne kan det antages at der ikke produceres så store mængder af de fleste 
affaldstyper, at der kan etableres genanvendelsesstationer lokalt. Fraktionerne kunne dog sorteres i 
bygderne og herefter transporteres til nærmeste by, hvorfra de kunne sejles videre til Danmark. Tidligere var 
der afgift på fragt af alt gods, men allerede fra januar 2001 blev transporten af affald fra de grønlandske 
kommuner til I/S MOKANA, eller en anden godkendt modtagefacilitet, imidlertid fritaget for ensfragtafgiften. 
Senere blev det besluttet at ensfragtafgiften skulle afskaffes helt pr. 1. maj 2003 [Basse og Olsen, 2004]. 12 
 
Hvad angår håndtering af det miljøfarlige affald, så har de grønlandske kommuner indgået en 
samarbejdsaftale med I/S MOKANA om behandling af det [MOKANA, 2007]. Der er etableret 
modtagestationer i Qaqortoq, Sisimiut og Aasiaat. Derudover var Ilulissat og Maniitsoq i 2004 ved at etablere 
en modtagestation. [Basse og Olsen, 2004] 
 
I det følgende kapitel bliver status på affaldshåndtering i de grønlandske kommuner behandlet, hvorefter 
forslag til forbedringer bliver gennemgået.

fields.title: Screening for Ulkebugt bacteria capable of inhibiting bacterial pathogens
fields.abstract:
The antibiotic resistance of bacteria is rapidly in
creasing, due to antibiotics unavoidably selects for resistant
microbes. This has enhanced the need for research into novel antibiotics. The world ocean is the largest
ecosystem on earth, and is believed to have a great
unexploited potential of marine bacteria producing
bioactive metabolites. This project aims to isolate marine bacteria inhibiting human and fish pathogen
icbacteria.
Of 50 water, swab and seaweed samples collected, 12 samples contained inhibitory colonies
and a total of 33 strains were isolated. However, only ten of them were still bioactivity at the lab in DTU.
The ten bioactive strains were analyzed for their ability to produce an antibacterial compounds in solid and
liquid medium. The target microorganisms used in this study were
Vibrio anguillarum
and
Staphylococcus
aureus.
In general the strains inhibited
V. anguillarum
stronger than S. aureus
when grown on a solid
medium. None of the strains were able to inhibit the target microorganisms when cultured in liquid
medium. Phenotypic tests performed showed that the
isolated strains were likely to belong to the family
Enterobacteriaceae,
which members are a normal part of the gut flora in humans. This is likely explained by
the fact that the majority of bioactive strains originated from water samples collected near a hospital outlet
in Ulkebugt. The six most potent inhibitors 25AR1,
25AR2, 25C 30B, 30C and 32, which almost were as
efficient inhibiting the target microorganisms as the control organism
Phaeobacter
27-4, all originated near
the hospital outlet.
The strains were identified first by API 20E, which gave a good identification of four strains
25C 30B, 30C and 32 all human pathogens within the
Enterobacteriaceae
family. The six most inhibiting
strains were all attempted identified by 16s rDNA gene sequencing. The identification succeeded for four
strains, and for three strains the 16s rDNA gene sequencing was used in correlation with API 20E to make a
reliable identification within the
Enterobacteriaceae
family. From a biotechnological perspective, also
the
Enterobacteriaceae
strains isolated may be of interest, and many members of the family
Enterobacteriaceae
are known to produce antibacterial compounds. The
last strain 25AR1 identified with
16s rDNA gene sequencing only had a 16s sequence similarity of 93% in a BLAST search with the closest
microorganism Neisseria
meningitidis.
This indicates that 25AR1 is a novel bacterium, though the origin of
the strain is questionable due to the fact that, the strain was isolated at the hospital outlet. Further
investigation of the strains collected in this project is necessary to determine their potential and novelty.

fields.title: Forundersøgelsen af bygden Assaqutaq
fields.abstract:
Formålet med projektet er at præsentere kommunens planer og visioner for bygden. Dette er sammenholdt med en registrering af de faktiske forhold i bygden og der er udført basale forundersøgelser, for etablering af kommende studenterprojekter.
Assaqutaq er anvendt af en stor del af befolkningen i Sisimiut. Hvert år besøger knap 1000 personer øen i kortere eller længere tid. Mange har familie der tidligere har boet på stedet og bygden er en del af historien i Sisimiut. Den fungerer som et åndehul for mange, specielt byens skolebørn. Assaqutaq har således en vigtig rolle i befolkningens bevidshed.

fields.title: Geofysiske undersøgelser af de marine leraflejringer i den indre del af Skovfjorden, Sydgrønland
fields.abstract:
The presence and distribution of marine clay is a
major concern in engineering related problems in
arctic and sub arctic environments. The interstitial
ice content of clay constitutes a risk of loss of
strength and settling upon ice degradation. This
report describes the application of geophysical
techniques to clay investigations in South Gree
nland and consists of geophysical surveys conducted
near the town of Qassiarsuk. The areas close to Qassiarsuk have been surveyed with a broad range
of geophysical techniques comprising DC resistivit
y methods including Schlumberger soundings and
multi-electrode profiling and ground penetrating r
adar methods which we hoped would be powerful in
determining the lateral distribution of clay sediments
and the depth to the clay. Indications of clay are
low resistivity and a loss of signal cr
eated by the georadar. A small town
Sillisit south of Qassiarsuk is
found to contain one large low resistive body and in
Qingua north of Qassiarsuk we found clay in the
near surface separated by glacial deposits. Although
many aspects of the 2D and 3D clay distribution
could be clarified using multi-electrode resistivity
the areas of low resistivit
y clay contents are not
uniquely identified, and other methods are therefor
e needed to improve reliability. The clay in
Greenland is not showing the same low resistivity
as in Denmark which is supposedly mainly caused
by a difference in mineralogy. This aspect makes
it harder to separate the clay from other low
resistivity sediments and the georadar method suffered
from a loss of signal before the depth of the
clay was reached.

fields.title: Ingeniørgeologiske undersøgelser for vejanlæg i Qassiarsuk-området, Sydgrønland
fields.abstract:
With a focus on road construction, the underground and the landscape of certain parts of
Greenland is studied with help from the history of geology combined with field work where
geophysical methods have been used.
Even though the area is situated in a granite zone, the geology is very complex - a result of
different phenomena. Approximately 1350 million years ago the Earth’s crust was stretched in
creation of a scratch zone, in which the later sandstone and basalt were deposited. Two
hundred million years later, the area was affected by magmatic and tectonic activity, which
resulted in the formation of different intrusions and rare rocks. Geological investigations of
gravel samples near the ground surface have shown a presence of sandstone, basalt,
amphibole, carbonatite, mikrosyenite and granite.
The later quaternary glacial processes - including up to several glacier advancements - have
affected the subsoil. In the area west of Qassiarsuk one or more glacier advancements have
left dead ice, which has resulted in big holes in the landscape, that today are filled with water.
Other sites, especially along the fjords, reveal deposits of moraine of different material
composition. Moraine is characterized by the difficulty of or lack of classification in relation
to grain size and material composition.
The area has been examined using twelve Schlumberger configurations, and all results show
that the top soil consists of sand/mould situated above a layer of moraine, where the ground
water level often is. The material compositions of the moraine vary from clay-sandy moraine
with low resistivity, to moraine gravel or washed out moraine stone with high resistivity. The
moraine is typically deposited on a solid bedrock of sandstone or granite. Ten MEP
(multielektrodeprofiles) have also been made in the area, and the results of these
investigations show almost the same tendency as the analysis of the Schlumberger
configurations. Some profiles are performed with a part of it crossing a gravel road and
evaluating show, that some roads hold a risk of frost damage because of the high content of
silt. The investigations also show that permafrost does not occur in the underground along the
fjord, but in the heights or in the shadow it is expected that permafrost occurs sporadically.
Following the period of glacial processes a relative land uplift compared to the surface of the
sea has occurred, which the marine limits in levels up to 50 meters above the ocean surface
testify to.
The roads in the area around Skovfjorden are primitively constructed with materials from the
close surroundings. The road beds in the area consist of different grain sizes and are
constructed in one layer. The thickness of the road beds is investigated with Ground
Penetrating Radar and judged to be around 30 cm. However, generally it has been difficult to
see the road bed on the radargram, which is a result of no measured differences in the
dielectric constants between the road bed and the datum line. The result of using one layer in
a road bed can be a fine road, but since the material is not very well graded it is difficult to
pack it. Therefore it is better to construct a road with different layers or with well-graded
materials. The Ground Penetrating Radar investigations show that in the southern part of
Qassiarsuk a part of the road bed is layered. The road here is build with a layer of gravel with
a thickness of between 24 and 36 cm situated above a layer of stone with a thickness of
between 15 and 45 cm, and the experience with this part of road is good.
Some years ago the last part of the road between Qassiarsuk and Narsarsuaq was constructed.
A total of 73.2 km roads have been measured, with a driving velocity during the
measurements between 5 km/h and 45 km/h on the gravel roads. Only on the asphalt roads in
Narsarsuaq a higher velocity has been used. The condition checking is on a scale from 1 to 3
is about 3 or under this, which means that a lot of places the road is unacceptable.
A big problem with road surfaces is potholes that occur because of various circumstances.
The road material is not well graded, which means it is difficult to compress, and therefore the
road will deform with time and cause new potholes. Another way to reduce potholes is to
ensure that the cross section of the road has a gradient of 5 percent to allow the water to easily
run off the road. This is not the case of the roads in the area, and therefore the water will
soften the road surface and the restraint between the particles will disappear – facilitating the
occurrence of potholes when driving. To solve the surface problems the road must have a
gravel wearing layer on the top, with a maximal grain size of 22.4 mm and filler content
between 10-16 %, which will increase the restraint in the material.
In Qassiarsuk there are problems with dust as a result of driving, which also can be solved
with a better restraint in the material. Determination of the wearability in the aggregates with
Mikro-Deval tests has shown that it also is very important to use the right material in the road
bed. The sandstone, which is used in Qassiarsuk, loose about 36 % of weight in wearability
tests, which is significantly more in comparison to the same test on granite, where the loss is
only about 3 % of the weight. However the granite from gravel 2 and 3 must not be used,
since the loss is over 82 % of the weight in the same tests.
Aside from the wearability tests the gravel grave samples are tested for organic content, frost
resistant, completely rounded stone material and grain size spreading. With background in
these investigations and with relation to how much material that can be expected to be found
in the different gravel graves, some of the gravel grave samples are evaluated to be the most
optimal for a production of road construction materials. The chosen gravel graves are number
4, 6, 16 and 17. In these graves a big part of the material is rounded, which can be adjusted by
using a stone crusher. It is because the part of totally rounded materials must not be higher
than 50 % in base course aggregates. A big part of the aggregates have approximately the
correct stone size ratio, why it is more important to screen the material than to crush it. But to
get below 50 % of rounded materials, stone sizes from 32 mm to 100 mm can be crushed and
mixed with the rest of the material. To assist with this it is possible to buy a used stone
crushing machine and a used screening machine for the price of kr. 275000 and kr. 680000
respectively.
The road bed can be built in two different ways depending on the material used to construct
the sub base of the road. The first suggested solution; on top 50 mm of wear gravel, under this
180 mm of base course aggregates and at the bottom 330 mm of sub base gravel. The second
suggested solution; on top 50 mm of wear gravel, under this 100 mm of leveling course of
stone material, under this 150 mm of base course aggregates and at the bottom 160 mm of
crushed stone. If the road bed is placed on a material that is liable to frost damage, it must be
constructed with a total road thickness of 190 mm - this can be done by increasing the
thickness of the sub base material. If crushed stone is used as the sub base material, a filter
layer or a fiber cloth must be placed between the layer and the datum line.
The roads in the area should be constructed to match a driving velocity of 50 km/h. In the
main part of the area, the road should consist of a one-lane road with a wheel track of four m
with hard shoulders with a width of one m. In Qassiarsuk the road must consist of two lanes
with wheel tracks of 2.5 m and hard shoulders with a width of one m. One-lane roads should
maintain “meet visibility”, but it has been evaluated that it is possible for two vehicles to
drive past each other, why only “stop visibility” should be maintained. The horizontal curves
must have a minimum radius of 126 m, and the concave and convex curves shall maintain a
minimum radius of 750 m. The gradient of the road must not exceed 12 %.
The section between Qassiarsuk and Nunataaq is in a very bad condition. It is suggested that
the road should be blasted into the mountain and secured by crash barrier along the road or
place the alignment from Nunataaq to Tasiusaq. Along this road there is a distance of 500 m
where it also is necessary to blast the road into the mountain.
There are general problems where the rivers from the mountains cross the roads. The water in
the rivers comes from snow melting, glacial melting and precipitation of rain. The most
critical situation is when it is raining simultaneous with snow melting, and by the Qingua
river also with glacial melting. To calculate the maximal rain intensity, a dimensioning
scenario of one time per 20 year is chosen. Multiplied with the snow melting it gives example
a precipitation intensity calculated over one hour of 26.1 mm/h in the area of Qassiarsuk. A
minimum scenario is also calculated, from the maximal rain intensity in a summer month,
where it is assumed that it is raining over the whole area. It gives example a rain intensity of
7.5 mm/h calculated over one hour.
26.5 % of the yearly precipitation disappears because of absorption and evaporation.
The water flow in the rivers is calculated in relation to measured river cross section and from
the precipitation. In comparison of the two methods, the dimensioning water flows of the
different rivers are chosen.
The road construction near Qimarnuffik is often washed away, which happens because the
two pipes under the road are too small to handle the critical water flow of 8 m3/s. A pipe with
a diameter of 1.45 m should be installed instead - combined with canal walls, so the water can
be lead into the pipe.
The river near Annanguit has resulted in a big alluvial fan near the fjord, and in relation to
road passing, the river must be controlled by strong points and crossbars. The road must be
placed on these crossbars and between strong points on the middle of the cone two bridges
should be constructed with a strong point between as support. This is calculated on basis of
the biggest meridian stone size D50=75 cm, which it is possible to find in the area seen in
relation to the amount of materials needed to build up the strong points. The crossbars are
built of the materials from the alluvial fan, which can be pushed up. These crossbars are
secured by small strong points along the side of the crossbar, so the water can be lead to the
opening. The maximal water flow in the river is 44 m3/s and by calculations result in bridges
with a length of 23 m. The height of the strong points and crossbars must be 1.5 m with a
gradient to the sides of 1:3. To secure the strong points against undermining, a trench is
constructed near the toe of the crossbar with these sizes; depth of 195 cm, bottom width of
153 cm and top width of 218 cm.
The river near Qorlortoq is controlled by crossbars along the river. The meridian stone size
that has been used is not big enough. The crossbars must be protected by an amour layer with
a thickness of 1.57 m and a meridian stone size of D50= 92 cm.
There has also been made attempts to control the Qingua river by crossbars, but it is not
finished yet. When it is finish the water flow can be expected to increase to 176 m3/s, which
means that the size of the stones around one of the supported areas of the bridge is not big
enough. It should be protected by an armour layer with a meridian stone size of D50 = 48 cm
in a thickness of 1.22 m to secure against erosion.

fields.title: Forsøg med mursten af grønlandsk ler
Geofysiske undersøgelser mhp. Vejprojektering i området mellem Sisimiut og Kangerlussuaq, Vestgrønland
fields.abstract:
The geophysical investigations described in th
is rapport were carried out in August 2006. The
measurements were made in connection with inve
stigations regarding a planned new gravel road
between the two towns Sisimiut and Kangerlussu
aq in western Greenland. Measurements were
carried out in two different areas: by the la
ke Amitsorsuaq, located between Sisimiut and
Kangerlussuaq, and in the outsk
irts of Sisimiut. There has not been made any previous
investigations by Amitsorsuaq, but by Sisimiut there has been drillings and made geoelectrical
measurements.
With our investigations we wished to find out what
kind of sediments there were in these areas and
if it was possible to map the depth to the perman
ently frozen ground. The sediments are interesting
for determining the best way to place the gravel
road, but the sediments can also be usefull 
construction material for the road. If the permafrost
level changes, the road
can be damaged. In this
rapport however, the focus has maily been on analyzing the geophysical data.
The measurements carried out were simple ge
oelectrical measurements and Multi Electrode
Profiling. Along the investigated ba
nk of Amitsorsuaq, the bed rock
was very near the surface.
Because of this, there were almost no sediments, a
nd we were not able to locate the permafrost level
from our data. It was possible to
estimate the resistivity
of the bed rock. The
found resistivities were
between 22.000 and 95.000
Ω
m. In the area close to Sisimiut,
both frozen and nonfrozen sediments
were found and it was possible to map areas with
permafrost and the depth to the bed rock.

fields.title: Vandforsyning i Ikamiut, Grønland
fields.abstract:
Ikamiut is a village in the municipality of
Qasigiannguit, which co
nsists of the town
Qasigiannguit and Ikamiut, where there are 80 inha
bitants. Ikamiuts drinki
ng water resource is
a river which is located about 3 km outside
the village. The river runs from the lake
Naajannguit Tasiat and runs through a swamp. The
lake Naajannguit Tasiat
is also connected to
a smaller lake, Qulleq. There is a watertank
in the village, with a
volume of approx.930 m
3
,
which is filled in the sommer. The water from the
tank is used in the winter. The river freezes
in September-October and thaws in May-June, and th
erefor, the period of tapping is short; only
3 months. Most of the inhabitants are connect
ed to the so called “summerwater” (Danish:
sommervand) but they wish to get a year-around-wat
er supply. There is also a fish plant in the
village which today has “summerwater”, but th
ey want to extend their production which
requires a bigger water usage. Nukissiorfiit (G
reenlands Energy Supply) has therefore wished
for it to be investigated, if the drinking water
intake can be moved from the river to the bigger
one of the two lakes; Naajanngui
t Tasiat, and if it has the capa
city to supply the village and
the fish plant the whole year. The possibility for
establishing a well in the surrounding parts of
the village will also be investigated.
During the field work in Ikamiut, June 24.-30. 2006, watersamples were taken from 13
different localities. Analysis showed that the water was very soft and pH was below 7 in all
cases. Ionconcentrations in the watersamples wh
ere very low, in fact the water was almost
distilled. Soilsamples were also taken from th
e chosen well-localities. Sieve analysis showed
that the soilsamples were either poorly sort
ed or not sorted. The localities where all
characterized by rocks and heather. Water flowed
into all of the drillings and the water quality
was good in all cases. Based on the basic analysis
on the soilsamples, the localities seem to be
equally good concering soil conditions. More precise analysis is though needed in order to
decide which one of them would be mos
t suitable for establishing a well.
Based on the log from the villages wate
rworks, an average unit-consumption
(L/(inhabitant·day)) was calculated. To get an id
ea of how big the consumption would be if the
village got a year-around-water supply, the consum
ption in the village was analysed. It showed
that the consumption is much bigger in th
e summer than in the winter because of the
production in the fish plant and the “summer wate
r”. It was presumed that if the village got a
year-around-water supply, the consumption in
the winter would be similar to the summer-
consumption. Then, an average unit-consumption
for the summers was calculated, and that
value was used to estimate the yearly water cons
umption in Ikamiut, in case of a year-around-
water supply.
A calculation of the capacity of Naajannguit Tasi
at showed that it has a big enough volume to
supply the village if it had a year-around-water su
pply. Still, it is not enough to calculate the
volume of the lake; the yearly inflow from the
catchment area has to be calculated too, since
the inflow has to be bigger than the average
consumption in the village. A calculation on the
yearly average inflow from Naajannguit Tasiat
s catchment area showed that it was about 8
times bigger than the estimated yearly consumption in Ikamiut in case of year-around-water
supply. Since the surface area of the two lakes
are more precise sizes than the cathment area,
the inflow to Naajannguit Tasiat based on the two lakes ́ surface area only, was also
calculated. The result was that this inflow was
almost 1,5 times as big
as the estimated yearly
consumption in Ikamiut in case of year-around-water supply. The conlclusion was therefore,
that Naajannguit Tasiat has the capacity
to supply Ikamiut the whole year through.

fields.title: Permafrost funderet bygdevej
fields.abstract:
This report contains the results of a combined field and literature study in the spring of 2007.
The purpose was to investigate the options for roadconstruction in the Greenlandic Village, Illorsuit
on the island “Ubekendt Ejland”. There are approximately 90 inhabitants living in 30 houses.
The bedrock in Illorsuit consists of tertiary olivine porphyric basalts and the deposits are mostly
sand and gravel.
The climate is arctic with low precipitation and long cold winters. The cold climate has made it
possible for permafrost to develop in the ground. With the global heating the active layer is getting
thicker and the melting of ice gives settlements to the top soil and to constructions on the surface.
Roads in the village are used for transportation from the harbour to the store and to the local power
plant. Further more a road goes from the central village to a small satellite village 400 meters north
of the village centre.
South of the village the local helicopter stop and waste dump are situated. In the summertime it is
not possible to drive the tractor up there and renovation and transportation are done with a 4-
wheeled scooter.
In the spring thaw situation and in the summertime the roads are muddy and water is accumulating
on the roads and tracks to inconvenience of the population.
Investigations with Ground probing radar shows that the road embankments have been dug down,
0,5 to 1 meter below the surface. The top layer of sediments doesn’t drain the precipitation and this
makes the surface wet and muddy. According to previous investigations this is due to high contents
of silt. The investigations by this project didn’t find soil with high contents of silt or fines.
To build a road in this area the field campaign have described the materials in the area and made a
geological model of the permafrost.
The laboratory work at home showed that the local materials had sufficient resistance against
mechanical wear and therefore could be used in a road construction.
There have been used Ground Probing Radar to investigate the existing roads and to try to estimate
the thickness of the active layer.
It was not possible to see deeper than 2- 2,5 meters with the GPR, cause of the high attenuation in
the sediments and rock material. The thickness of the road embankment was visible but there were
no sure signs of the boundary between the active and the permafrozen layers. Further investigations
with boreholes or GPR in the summertime can be used to calibrate the measurements from this
project.
Materials and machinery for road construction is sparse in the area and the low population makes it
an economical challenge to establish proper roads.
As a result of the field campaign and the literature study following suggestions for the
establishment of a road in Illorsuit have been made.
- 0,5 meters of road embankment.
- The embankment should be established on the surface with out disturbing the top
soil. To separate the road from the fines in top soil there should be used
geotextiles.
- The embankment should be reinforced using geonets. This will help the friction
material to obtain a higher rate of weight distribution.
- Ditches should be avoided because of the thawing effect on the permafrost. If
ditches are to be established they should be made 1 or 2 meters from the road
embankment.
- The road surface can be made more stable using fines, but this will make the
materials more plastic in the spring thaw situation and make the surface less
permeable.
There should be carried out further investigations to establish whether the entire top layer is drifting
downhill towards the sea. Further more establish the depth of the active layer and the thickness of
the permafrozen layer.

fields.title: Geometrisk vejprojektering på strækningen mellem Sisimiut og Kangerlussuaq
fields.abstract:
Since the 1960’s, the desire for building a road between Sisimiut and Kangerlussuaq (earlier American airbase)
has exist, the Americans needed the road. Reason for that is Kangerlussuaq is placed in the end of a long fjord,
which freezes during the winters. That makes it difficult to supply the base in the winters. This problem would be
solved, if the road between Sisimiut and Kangerlussuaq has been build. Danish Arctic Contractors made a road
project in mid 1960’s, which the Danish ministry of Greenland rejected.
Sisimiut town is placed in about the same latitude as Kangerlussuaq, about 50 km from northern Arctic Circle.
Sisimiut town is the northernmost place in Greenland, with no sea ice, year round. The ground here has
permafrost, which needs to be taken care of during the road construction.
Nowadays, more than 40 years later the first road project is the municipality of Sisimiut that wants the road.
Municipal government in Sisimiut think, the road will bring many products and activities in the municipality of
Sisimiut. The following products has been appeared; tourism, mining, international fish transportation from
Kangerlussuaq.
The purpose here is to project a geometric road construction, in the stretch between Sisimiut and Kangerlussuaq.
The road is two lane dirt roads, with a required speed limit 60 km/h, and design speed is 80 km/h. As the part of
the project has the Norwegian and Danish standards geometric dimensions for road constructions been examined.
The reason for this is, standard for road construction in open land in Greenland does not exist.
On the examination has the standards been compared, here has the following standards been examined; the
steepest allowable gradients, minimum horizontal and vertical allowable cambers. The results shows, that
Norwegian allow steepest gradients, gradients up to 9 ‰. In the description of the Danish road standards is
mentioned the minimum horizontal and vertical allowable cambers, according to ride comfort.
The road between Sisimiut and Kangerlussuaq will have a total length of 170 km, which 153 km of them will be
new plant. A two lane dirt road, with a total stretch of 26.5 km, has been designed in this project. The road starts in
Sisimiut and goes toward east heading Kangerlussuaq. Sisimiut area have hilly terrain with snow during the
winters, that makes it road construction challenging. Kangerlussuaq area has more flat terrain.
The road here has been projected, in the field of Norwegian maximum allowed gradients, and the Danish
minimum horizontal and vertical allowed radius according to ride comfort. The projected road contains three
serpentine roads. On these stretches is the allowed maximum gradient and minimum allowed horizontal camber
exceeded. Where the maximum gradient is 92 ‰ over 350 meters and the minimum camber have a radius of 50 m.
On these cambers will the speed limit reduced to 40 km/h, to obtain ride comfort.
After every camber on serpentine roads, is the gradients reduced dramatically, to give, up going heavy vehicles,
chance to catch up the speed.
On fillings, is the Norwegian standards used. The height difference between the existing ground and road level has
to be minimum two meters in fillings on flat terrain. The edges on the top have to be rounded, with a radius of two
times the height of filling. This is to avoid turbulence on roads.
The rock cuttings have a 10:1 slope. A drainage ditch, with various widths and depths, is placed between the rock
cut and road. The width and depths of drainage is determined by the height of the rock cut. The Norwegian
standards are used here.
Because of the permafrost, the Culverts are used for every water course. Reason for that is to obtain the natural
water course. Several water courses collected to one big culvert might sink the grate line. This can result
settlement in roads.
The result of materials balance is extreme, with a 344.200 m3 surplus. The cause of that is huge amount of rocks
have been cut on third serpentine road, on steep hill. The hill has been cut, to give room for half of 50 m turning
radius, where the other half is made of steep filling. To minimize the material surplus, it is possible to raise the
level of the roads. In this project, is less than one fifth of the total road length is projected. So it is difficult to
decide now if the level of the road should be raised, because we do not know what the materials balance will be
the next 126.5 km.

fields.title: Deponerings muligheder for MSWI flyveaske på Grønland
fields.abstract:
Man har på Grønland løst et stort aaldshåndteringsproblem ved at bygge forbrænd-
ingsanlæg. I forbindelse med anlæggelsen af disse er der imidlertid opstået et nyt
problem, som b estår i håndteringen af restpro dukter fra aaldsforbrændingen, deri-
blandt yveaske.
Den nuværende praksis omkring håndteringen af yveaske på Grønland er, at asken
eksp orteres til I/S Mokana i Danmark, hvorfra den sendes videre til dep onering på
sep cialdep ot i Norge. Dette er uhensigtsmæssigt, fordi det strider mo d lovgivning
og etik på området.
Det blev undersøgt, om anlæggelsen af et dep ot vil være et go dt alternativ til ek-
sp ortløsningen. To dep onerings løsninger som syntes egnede blev præsenteret. Der
blev i udvælgelsen af løsninger fokuseret på at opnå en reduktion i forurenings p o-
tentialet, samt at løsningen skulle give minimal chance for miljøpåvirkning. Målet
med dette var, at dep otet skulle kunne overgå til den passive fase efter en årrække.
Derved vil akkumulering af aald i systemet kunne undgås. De to muligheder, der
blev p eget på, var total indkapsling i miner og kontrolleret udvaskning af fra et de-
p ot med efterfølgende rensning af p erkolatet.
Det kunne konkluderes, at løsningen med total indkapsling i miner formo dentligt
vil være den billigste og at den også vil kunne give færrest miljøpåvirkninger. Bly
og zink minen i Maarmorilik er den mest egnede lokation til indkapsling af asken.
Den næst billigste løsning var den nuværende håndtering. Miljøpåvirkningen fra
denne vil som for mineløsningen være minimal. Dog vil den noget længere transp ort
forbundet med eksp orten udlede mere kuldioxid.
Udvasknings dep otet var den dyreste og mest b esværlige løsning, samtidig var det
også den løsning, som vil give den største miljøpåvirkning. Tiden, hvor dep otet
kunne overgå til den passive fase, blev estimeret til mellem 300 og 23000 år, hvilket
langt overskrider levetiden for de este membraner. Dette b esværliggør anlæggelsen
af dep otet. Desuden vil anlæggelsen af et udvasknings dep ot, blive påvirket af so-
cio økonomiske faktorer, som er sp ecikke for de grønlandske forhold, nemlig den lille
arb ejdsstyrke og store oentlige sektor.

fields.title: Udnyttelse af fiskeri- og fangstaffald til energiforsyning i Sisimiut, Grønland
fields.abstract:
In Sisimiut, the second largest town of Greenlan
d, the primary occupation
is fishery and hunting.
Especially, large amounts of shrimp are caught, due to the Royal Greenland’s shrimp and crab plant
located in the town. This entails
that large amounts of waste from
the fishery and hunting sector are
generated simultaneously, of which much of it
has no current use and is
thus discarded. In
particular, large amounts of shrimp waste is di
scharged to the ocean from Royal Greenland’s
factory, which may have a negative impact on the
marine environment in the area. At the same
time, significant amounts of fossil fuels are used
as energy supply for the town. Thus, it has been
examined whether the by-products, which are in ex
cess from the fishery a
nd hunting sector, can be
utilized as an energy supply for the town, thereby replacing fossil fuels.
By means of laboratory analysis of the compositi
on of chosen waste types, it has been found that
there are high potentials of energy
utilization from the waste. For
the shrimp waste, utilization of
the energy is optimally done by bio gasification, as th
is is a very wet waste type, containing almost
80% water. As the shrimp waste is by far the
dominant waste type from the fishery and hunting
sector, and at the same time is generated continuous
ly during the year, utilization of the waste as a
base for biogas production will provide the highest energy yield. The biogas potential of shrimp
waste is approximately 170 Nm
3
CH
4
/ton, when no contribution from the chitin fraction of the
shrimp waste is assumed, and the generation of shrimp waste is in the order of 11-13.000 tonnes on
a yearly basis. This means an annual actual bi
ogas potential of 20 GWh for the shrimp waste.
Compared to this biogas potential
the contribution of th
e other waste fractions, such as crab-picking
wastes and seal blubber, (if availa
ble), are not significant, as they are generated in much smaller
amounts.
The degree of utilization for the biogas, however, w
ill depend on the type of the incineration plant,
but with a degree of utilization of 60%, there will be 13 GWh available per year by biogas
production from the fishery and hunt
ing waste in Sisimiut. This co
rresponds to approximately one
fourth of the energy amount, which is at presen
t supplied to the town by the energy supplier,
Nukissiorfiit. However, the utilization of the bi
ogas potential of
shrimp waste requires a reduction
in the ammonium content of the biomass in the
biogas reactor, for instan
ce by ammonia stripping.
However, it is doubtful whether there will be a su
fficient interest in utilizing the great energy
potentials of the waste at present, partly as ther
e is currently no fee on di
scharging the waste, and
partly as it is planned to s
upply Sisimiut with energy from wa
ter power from year 2009, which is
also an environmentally sound solution.

fields.title: Electroremediation of oil polluted artic soil
fields.abstract:
The purpose of this study was to examine if electrokinetic and electrodialytic treatment, used for removing heavy metal contaminants, influences the concentrations of heavy oil components in polluted Arctic soil. If a remediation was observed, it was sought deter-mined if the removal was due to transport processes or biodegradation. The effect of stimulating the biodegradation by nutrient addition is determined. Two soils were used for the experiments; both were Arctic soils from Sisimiut, Greenland. The soils were analyzed for parameters affecting electroremediation and/or biodegradation results for both heavy metals and heavy oils. For this reason an analysis for clay minerals present in the soil was done.
The soil analyses showed minerals that could be interpreted as illite and kaolinite, but also as biotite and chlorite. The last mentioned are believed to be the most plausible be-cause of the limited weathering in the Arctic. The carbonate content was found to be 1.8 and 1.3 % for soil 1 and 2 respectively. The organic content including the oil pollutants of the soil was found to be around 4 and 7.5 % for soil 1 and 2 respectively, but when the concentration of oil in the soils, found in Gas chromatographic analyses, was withdrawn the content was seen to be 1.5 and 3.5 %. The oil content in the soils was found to be almost similar for both the original (unsorted) soils and the fine fractions of the soils. The total oil concentration in the fine fraction was found to be 24,228 (444) and 40,757 (3910) mg/kg dw. for soil 1 and soil 2 respectively, with standard deviations shown in brackets. The maximum concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons, PAHs, in the fine fraction of the two soil were found to be 598 (5.4) and 925 (115.1) mg/kg dw. respectively. Both soils were found to be class 4 soils in Danish standards. The concen-tration of the heavy oils was seen to be almost the same, whereas the concentration of lighter diesel oils was seen to be much higher in soil 2. The experiments with electroki-netic soil remediation were done with both alternating and direct current. Both showed a general low removal of 2000-5000 mg/kg dw. but the standard deviations were too high to conclude for sure whether or not the removal had actually occurred. There was not seen any difference in removal between the experiment with direct and alternating cur-rent, so the removal was concluded to be due to biodegradation. The experiments with electrodialytic soil remediation of soil slurry of soil fine fraction < 0.5 mm, were all exe-cuted with and without an electric field applied. A basis experiment was set up with only the electric field, a secondary experiment was set up adding nutrients every second day and a sterilized soil experiment was set up. In soil 1 no removal was observed in any of the experiments. No transportation to membranes and electrolyte fluids had occurred. The removals could be traced to the filters used to separate soil and soil fluid after exper-iments. The oil concentration in soil 2 in all experiments was seen to decrease with around 2000-4000 mg/kg dw, but the standard deviation was too high to draw clear con-clusions. The sterilized experiments showed surprising results with high removal in both experiments with and without current applied, but as no biodegradation could occur, it was believed to be due to errors in the execution of the experiments or heterogeneity in the soil. The reason for the limited remediation was found not to be due to the electricity inhibiting the microorganisms. That the high degree of contamination should be the rea-son was also rejected, as remediation had occurred in soil 2 during a 15 month deposition period. The reason for the limited removal could be too short duration time for the experiments, resulting in too low removal rates to be detected with the equipment available. The analyses of oil content made on the gas chromatograph showed results with high uncertainties, but the extraction method with acetone and pentane worked correctly. It was concluded, that electroremediation of highly oil contaminated soil is unsuited, as the removal rates turned out to be very low.

fields.title: Affald fra fiskeri og fangst i Arktis - en undersøgelse af nyttiggørelsesmulighederne i Uummannaq Kommune
fields.abstract:
In Greenland there are no tradition for cleaning wastewater,
this is primarily due to the fact that there are no laws gover
-
ning this area. This leads to that all wastewater are led into
the ocean as this is considered the best and cheapest option.
This is also the case for Uummannaq County whose primary
occupation is greenland halibut fishing. This project targets
the waste from greenland halibut fishing as well as other
waste-material due to fishing as it is sought to find other areas
of use for this waste. With this focus, different areas of use
were investigated in order to identify alternatives to direct
emission into the ocean. The project has identified numerous
alternatives, which were weighed against the specific conditi
-
ons that apply in Uummannaq County. The greenland shark,
amounts for 50 percent of the total waste, which was crucial
to the choice of recommended use for the waste-material. This
is due to the fact that the meat from the greenland Shark is
poisonous and therefore it is not recommended to use as food.
Because of that, combined with the urge to find a financi
-
ally plausible, the choice fell on utilizing the fat from the fish
waste to produce bio-oil as well as bio-gas production, which
is deemed, being the best solutions. In order to evaluate if the
waste is suitable for this, all the different types of waste was
analyzed in relation to; dry matter, ash, lipid, nitrogen, phos
-
phorous, sulphur, carbon, pH as well as the content of heavy
metals. The analysis of the lipid showed that the liver of the
greenland halibut, The greenland shark and the roundnose
grenadier as well as seal blubber has a large fatty content and
are therefore suited for production of bio-oil. The potential
energy from the two areas of utilization was evaluated ac
-
cording to the amount and the type of waste in Uummannaq
County and from that it could be concluded that the amount
of energy were greatest when utilized for bio-oil production.
Despite of this fact it was decided that it was most beneficial
to reconmmend biogas production for the villages in Uum
-
mannaq County as they will then benefit from a total solution
to their problems with fish waste. In Uummannaq it can be
expected that there are enough resources for the implemen
-
tation of both bio-oil and biogas, which therefore are re
-
commended.
Solutions were suggested for Uummannaq city as well as the
two villages Illorsuit and Saattut. The reason for selecting
these two villages is that they represent one of the largest and
one of the smallest villages in Uummannaq County.
The contents of available biomass in Uummannaq city as well
as Illorsuit and Saattut was analyzed in relation to the con
-
tents of micronutrients as well as parameters that can poten
-
tially inhibit a production of biogas or obstruct that the degas
-
sed biomass can be used for agricultural purposes. In all cases
the contents of the biomass met the requirements for use. In
the villages a possibility to, furthermore, mix biomass with
wastewater was identified. For Illorsuit the biomass content
could handle a 100 percent mix with wastewater, where as Sa
-
attut could accommodate up to 40 percent of the regional wa
-
stewater. In Uummannaq city there are a potential to produce
240 MWh per year, which accounts for roughly 3 percent of
the total use. In Illorsuit the number was 90 percent and in
Sattutt 27 percent of the towns power use could be covered.

fields.title: Georadar målinger Vandsø 5 Sisimiut
Arktisk teknologi - vejmaterialer ved Itinneq
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
Diskussionerne om ”vejen” har været mange og lange på Grønland igennem de senere år. For
når der tales om ”vejen”, så er der ikke tvivl om, at der tales om den storstilede vejforbindelse
imellem Sisimiut og Kangerlussuaq. Hvis vejen kommer, så vil det radikalt ændre den Grønlandske
infrastruktur, og det vil have betydning for både lokalområderne og hele Grønlands udvikling. Da
Grønlands meget specielle terræn gør vejbygning til en meget kompliceret affære, er det derfor
nødvendigt at data-materialet, der skal ligge til grund for anbefaling af tracé, vejkasse, udførelse
etc., er så udførligt som muligt. Ud fra det overordnede tracé er der derfor foretaget en udpegning af
de kritiske områder, hvor ekstra grundige forundersøgelser er nødvendige (typisk hvor vejen skal
føres fra én fjeldryg til en anden). Overføringen over dalen Itinneq er et af disse områder, som
derfor er blevet grundigt undersøgt i flere etaper af flere forskellige hold, og som således også
behandles mere indgående i denne rapport, hvor der lægges fokus på lokalisering og undersøgelse
af materialer til indbygning i vejkassen.

fields.title: Mineralogi af ler fra Søndre Strømfjord
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
På baggrund af et eksamensprojekt om ”Fremstilling af letklinker ud fra grønlandsk
ler” fra 2004/2005 fra DTU ønskes sammensætningen af leret på bunden af Søndre
Strømfjord undersøgt.
Søndre Strømfjord er ca. 180 km lang og går fra byen Kangerlussuaq til Baffinbugten.
De lerprøver, som behandles i denne rapport, er hentet fra bunden af fjorden på
forskellige lokationer i de øverste 80 km af fjorden.1
I det omtalte eksamensprojekt blev det fundet, at produktion af letklinker fra
grønlandsk ler kun er mulig, såfremt der tilsættes forskellige stoffer. Man ender dog
med at konkludere, at et bedre produkt kan opnås ved at opsamle ler fra andre
grønlandske lokationer, hvor lermineralsammensætningen er anderledes end den
anvendte.2
På denne baggrund undersøges for de tagne lerprøver vandindhold, glødetab,
kornstørrelsesdistribution og mineralogi. Desuden beskrives teorien og udførslen af
diverse undersøgelser.

fields.title: En undersøgelse af forbrændingsslagger fra affaldsforbrændingsanlægget i Sisimiut - Grønland
Mikrovandkraft
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
Energiforsyningen i de grønlandske bygder er styret
af fossile brændstoffer såsom olie, diesel og gas.
Løsningerne med de fossile brændstoffer er på længere
sigt uholdbar pga. det stigende energiforbrug
globalt. Herudover er prisen på den anvendte kWh meg
et høj.
For at sikre forsyningen i fremtiden er der flere ste
der i grønland foreslået projekter med den hensigt.
Projekterne har til formål at skabe sikkerhed men ogs
å uafhængighed af fossile brandstoffer.
Projekterne er rettet mod vedvarende energikilder så
som vindenergi, bølgeenergi, solenergi og
vandkraft.
De grønlandske kommuner har, i samarbejder med DTU, f
remlagt ideer til fremtidige projekter, som kan
dele af energiproblematikken i grønland – heribland
t vandkraft i bygden Ukkusissat.
Ukkusissat er afhængig af det lokale elværk der produ
cere elektricitet ved afbrænding af diesel.
Elværket forsyner de 180 personer der bor i bygden m
ed elektricitet, samt forskellige erhverv. Bygden er
placeret ca. 50 km fra hovedbygden Umanak, hvor kom
munen ligger.
Man har fra kommunens side fremlagt ideen om at lade
Ukkusissat undersøge, for muligheden for
vandkraft i Ukkusissat. To kilometer syd for Ukkusissat
er der et nedløb fra gletcher – det er denne
flods energipotentiale kommunen ønsker undersøgt.

fields.title: An analysis of the potential of using seawater in the fish factory, Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
The report analyses the potential for using
seawater in the second largest town in
Greenland, Sisimiut. The main part consist of three chapters, each ending with a short
recapitulation section which sums up the most
important points, findings or results and
suggestions for future research.
Chapter 1: A short and intensiv
e review of fresh water supply in Greenland and Sisimiut.
Chapter 2: a presentation of
results of field work execute
d during the 3 week long stay
together with a short presentation of methods..
Chapter 3: This part of the report is devoted
to three interviews given by three of the
water stakeholders in Sisimiut.
In the conclusion, three main reasons for not
using seawater in Sisi
miut are mentioned:
Firstly, Sisimiut has the largest reservoir of fresh water in Greenland. Secondly, the
surrounding marine environment is heavily po
lluted and potentially contaminated with
faecal bacteria. Thirdly, there seems to be
a huge potential for conserving water in
Sisimiut instead of increasing supply.
