fields.title: Grønlandsk ler i beton
Forundersøgelser for vandkraft i Sarfannguaq
fields.abstract:
This rep ort describ es a preliminary study of the hydrop ower p otential in
Sarfanngauq's lake. In this rep ort available data for the area is studied and
plans for further data gathering and calculations are planned.
The basis for this rep ort is the so called "fyrtårnspro jekt"which was set
in motion in the summer of 2006. The fyrårnspro jekt has the goal of creating
optimal conditions for energy, water supply and waste management.
Sarfannguaq is a small town with around 120 inhabitants and an aver-
age electricity and water usage of resp ectively 51,08 kW and 0,14 l/s. From
mo dels made in Mapinfo, Matlab and Novop oint the catchment area for the
lake was found to b e 14,68
km
2
and the lake volume to b e 25.879.411
m
3
.
The lake has an area of 2,002
km
2
with the maximum depth of 31 m. The
elevation of the lake surface is 55 m over sea level. Pressure loggers have
b een installed, for measuring and logging the surface variations of the lake.
In the lakes outow, a V-notched weir has b een built. In a p o ol upstream
from the weir, a pressure sensor has b een installed for measuring and logging
the water level for determining the outow from the lake.
With weather data from station 464 in Sisimiut, dierent scenarios have
b een calculated. The results only reect some tendencies of the system b e-
cause the calculations are not based on the actual weather conditions in
Sarfannguaq. The outow of the lake could b e estimated to 114 l/s which
results in an energy pro duction of around 40 kW with a Banki turbine from
the turbine pro ducer Irem.
Over the summertime the energy loss is mainly in the turbine unit. The
total eciency for the whole system would b e ab out the same for all scenarios,
ab out 65 %. Over the wintertime the conditions are slightly dierent b ecause
of the energy consumption for the frost protection. In this case the total
eciency of the whole system will vary b etween 33 - 58 %, dep ending on
which scenario is chosen. The 58 % are obtained by digging the p ensto ck in
the ground and placing the water pip eline under the fjord.
Our general assessment is that there is basis for continuing work on plan-
ning the utilization of the Sarfannguaq lake for hydrop ower.

fields.title: Energiforsyning i grønlandske bygder og implementering af mikrokraftvarme
fields.abstract:
Energy supply in Greenland’s settlements is today served by electricity pro-
duction on a few diesel generator sets and individual heating of the houses
with oil burners. Due to the lack of district heating system the excess heat
at the power stations cannot be utilized, which gives a potential for ener-
gy efficiency improvement. Here, micro combined heat and power production
(CHP) gives a possibility for decentralized power production while exploiting
the excess heat. In this context it is the aim of this project to investigate the
energy supply’s basic characteristics and its possibilities for implementation
of micro CHP in the settlement Sarfannguaq in Greenland. So far especially
the variations of the electricity and power demand are not investigated in
detail, and the project gives closer information on this by electricity and
heat demand patterns. Hereby a data basis for further projects concerning
Sarfannguaqs energy supply is achieved.
The key data and characteristics of the power supply in Sarfannguaq are
investigated on basis of data for the yearly and monthly electricity production
supplied by the Greenlandic energy supply company Nukissiorfiit together
with measurements carried out during af field research in the settlement in
August 2006.
The heating system of Sarfannguaq is investigated on basis of different
information, which enables the calculation of a realistic estimate of the heat
demand pattern in a house, which is used for shower and cloth washing by the
inhabitants of the settlement. The estimates are calculated from information
about the oil sale, the use of the oil and climate data. The use of the house
results in a comprehensive heat and electricity demand, which means good
possibilities for the implementation of micro CHP. On basis of the yearly heat
demand of 38.237 kWh the CHP unit’s production is calculated to serve 88 %
of the heat demand. This means a yearly save of DKK 20.137 at a lifetime
of 80.000 operating hours, while assuming today’s energy prices and simple
rules for the pricing of the electricity production.
Further calculations, based on the estimated operating conditions for the
power system, show that simulations of the CHP-unit’s operation and its
interaction with the power station are needed to ensure a net amount of oil
saving, which is a necessary condition for the energy efficiency improvement.
However, preliminary calculations show that a positive evaluation of the
possibilities of micro CHP can be expected. A massive implementation of
micro CHP in all the settlement’s houses will still not be possible under the
given system conditions.
Finally, it has been a part of the project to present micro CHP’s possibi-
lities in Greenland’s settlements in the Greenland Innovation Centre. This is
carried out by installing a micro CHP, SenerTec Dachs HKA, in the Centre.
This is exactly the unit which implementation possibilities in Sarfannguaq
have been investigated.

fields.title: Indoor climate and building characteristics in association with asthma and allergy in Sisimiut, Greenland
fields.abstract:
This project was made to investigate the indoor climate and building characteristics in
association with asthma and allergy among Greenlandic children.
The
project
was
based on the two first phases
of the Swedish
study “
D
ampness in
B
uildings
and
H
ealth
”
[Hägerhed
-
Engman].
The first phase was an epidemiological cross
-
sectional questionnaire study
including 229
children in schools and institutions in Sisimiut
. T
he response rate was 24%.
This phase was
carried out in May and June 2006
.
The second p
hase was a nested case
-
control study, where
51
homes were inspected
.
This
phase was carried out in August 2006. The children in the case
-
control study were selected
based on their respond of the questionnaire.
It was
found that the prevalence of doctor
di
ag
nosed asthma in Sismiut
was 15%. N
o
significant
association between ventilation rate and symptoms
of asthma an
d allergy
is
found. T
he case
-
group had a lower average CO
2
conce
ntr
ation than the control group.
Reported observation of visible mould was in mo
st cases interconnected with observation of
visible damp stains.
The risk of condensation on windows in the kitchen
is
increased in
homes built before 1971. A
significant
dose
-
response association between con
densation and
dry air
is
found
.
When dry air
is
perceived, condensation
is
also found.
No significant
association between condensation
on the windows
and asthmatic and allergic symptoms
is
found

fields.title: Miljøvurdering af havmiljøet i ulkebygten, Sisimiut – ud fra analyser af næringssalte, kobber og cadmium samt økotoksikologiske forsøg
fields.abstract:
Most of the wastewater from the city of Sisimiut in Greenland is  led to the sea untreated. This can 
cause unwanted effects in the costal marine envi ronment. Therefore this project focuses on the 
consequences of the discharge of untreated wastew ater to Ulkebugten inside the threshold below the 
hospital and outside the threshold  from the Royal Greenland factory.  
A thorough analysis of the potential for pollution di spersion in Ulkebugten is  carried out. Effects on 
the marine environment in Ulkebugten are descri bed by ecotoxicological experiments and tolerance 
experiments with the heavy metals c obber and cadmium on the brown algae  fucus vesiculosus  and 
amphipods in Greenland. In addition ecotoxicologi cal experiments with  cobber and cadmium on f. 
vesiculosus  and the crustacean  corophium volutator in Denmark are performed to compare and 
evaluate sensitivity between the Danish and Greenlandic species. 
 
Study of the sediment in Ulkebugten show a local pollution with organic matter, nutients as well as 
cadmium and cobber at the wastewater discharge inside the threshold below the hospital as well as 
at the discharge from the Royal Greenland factory  outside the threshold. This indicates that the 
water exchange in Ulkebugten happens at a pace th at causes nutrients and heavy metals to deposit. 
Current patterns in Ulkebugten are also not sufficiently strong to  cause sediment resuspension. The 
analysis of dispersion shows that  nutrients as well as heavy metals in wastewater from the Royal 
Greenland factory outside the threshold spread toward the bottom of Ulkebugten. Inside the 
threshold is therefore burdened by both wastew ater outlets. It can be concluded that the 
environment in Ulkebugten inside  the threshold deteriorates. 
 
The ecotoxicological experiments performed with  f. vesiculosus  do not give a clear  picture of the 
effects of the heavy metals on the organisms – ne ither in Greenland nor in  Denmark. Therefore it is 
not possible to evaluate the effect of cobber and cadmium on the environment from these 
experiments. 
From the effect of cadmium on amphipods in Greenland it is assessed that cadmium is very toxic 
for the marine environment even at low concentrations. At the concentrations observed in the 
analysis of dispersion effects of cadmium on the  costal marine environment are already severe. The 
risk assessment of cobber in the arctic environment shows that the compound can have damaging 
effects on the costal marine environment in Greenl and. As concentrations f ound in the analysis of 
dispersion in many places are highe r than the concentration at which cobber causes 20% mortality 
in the ecotoxicological experiments, adverse effects on the environment are to be expected. 
From comparison of the sensitivity of f. vesiculosus  and  amphipods in Denmark and Greenland 
toward cobber and cadmium it is postulated that th e costal marine environment is more vulnerable 
in Greenland than in Denmark. 
 
Based on the ecotoxicological experiments with  amphipods the EAC-values for cadmium are to 
high to be usable in Greenla nd. For cobber effects on amphipods are seen below the EAC-values, 
however not to the same extent as for cadmium. Hi gh mortality (40%) is first seen at concentration 
double the critical EAC-value. 
Greenland or perhaps the arctic countries as a whole should therefore have their own quality 
criteria, so that pollutions in future easier and qu icker can be assessed. These quality criteria could 
be developed on the basis of the European Commission’s framework for Environmental Quality 
Standards. Determination of quality criteria does however require comprehensive analysis and study 
of the Greenlandic environment and organisms.

fields.title: Olie- og tungmetalforurening i Arktis – en undersøgelse fra Tasiusaq en bygd i Nordvestgrønland
fields.abstract:
In Greenland most of the towns and villages have
tank installations with
oil products as petrol,
paraffin oil and gas oil used for transport and elec
tricity production. Tank in
stallations represent a
risk of oil spill caused by common use or leakages. An oil spill will have serious consequences for
the surrounding environment. In Greenland, which is
a part of the Arctic, the low temperatures,
light intensity and nutrient content means that oil
will remain in the ground for a longer period than
in a tempered climate. Since tank installations
are often situated near the sea, the marine
environment is also exposed to pollution from
the tank installations in
case of oil spill.
The main purpose of this study was to examine if
three tank installations (A, B and NY) in the
northwest Greenlandic village Tasiusaq have caused
oil pollution, and if there
is an increased lead
concentrations as a result of the form
er use of leaded petrol. Soil, seaweed,
Myoxocephalus scorpius
and sea sediments are analyzed for lead, cadmi
um and the total content of hydrocarbons.
The investigations have shown th
at the ground in tank installation A
is polluted with weathered gas
oil. Also high concentrations of heavy metals
are seen in most of the samples. The lead
contamination is presumed to be a result of the ea
rlier use of leaded gas o
il. Tank installation B is
polluted with hydrocarbons, lead and cadmium. It is
questionable if leaded
gas oil alone has caused
the lead contamination since this tank installati
on only contains paraffin. Th
e lead contamination is
presumed to be a result of the waste incineration or local sources in the area of the tank installation.
Tank installation NY is not as
highly polluted as the two other tank
installations, in spite of the fact
that especially the concentrati
ons of hydrocarbons compared to th
e baseline level are increased. The
investigations of the ocean have shown that the
marine areas are not affe
cted by the pollution from
the tank installations. An increase
d level of heavy metals are f
ound compared to other sites in
Greenland, it is presumed caused by other source
s as for instant waste incineration or other
activities connected to humans.
At last some additional studies on waste water
and residual products from the incineration are
carried out to examine if these
areas could be a source to lead
and cadmium contamination. Nothing
notable was found compared with
other places in Greenland.
In consideration of the specific conditions that
characterizes the field location, namely the High
Arctic climate, hard bedrock and close to the shor
e it is presumed that the experiences from this
study are usable in other parts of North and No
rthwest Greenland. It is expected that similar
conditions will be seen if the tank
installations that will be examined contain petrol, paraffin oil and
gas oil, and the size of the oil spills is limited.

fields.title: Georadar i arktiske områder – overfladenær geologi og vejbyggeri
fields.abstract:
Georadarmetoden, også kaldet Gr
ound Penetrating Radar (GPR), giver en mulighed for at
kigge ned gennem forskellige lag i den øverste del af jorden. Herved kan man følge
reflektorer i undergrunden. Hvis man endvide
re kender hastigheden i lagene, kan man
også beregne dybden til de fo
rskellige reflektorer.
Rapporten giver et indblik i diverse problemstillinger omkring opsamling og processering
af data herudover behandles også problemstillin
ger indenfor den overfladenære geologi og
vejbyggeri i arktiske områder.
GPR er en effektiv metode til at dække et
stort undersøgelsesområde. En ulempe ved GPR
er, at man ikke fysisk kan se hvad der er
i undergrunden. Hvis man med 100 % sikkerhed
vil vide hvad, der ligger, hvor dybt, ville en bor
ing selvfølgelig være bedst. En effektiv
metode ville være at kombinere disse to metoder.
fields.comment:
Appendix files found
GPS-coordinates for a complete line.

fields.title: Feasibility studie af lokale vedvarende hydrologiske energikilder i området omkring Sisimiut, Grønland
fields.abstract:
Greenland consists of relative few small towns scattered throughout a huge area, only separated by water and deserted nature. Hence it is interesting to examine whether it is possible to make use of the potential of the hydrological renewable energy sources, both environmentally speaking, but also in an economical context. At the moment, diesel run power plants are being used to supply Sisimiut.
3 weeks of fieldwork have been carried out, to examine the potential of building a tidal power plant just north of Sisimiut, Greenland and a hydropower plant from a elevated lake near Sarfannguaq, Greenland.
Plant engineering blueprints with cost of construction have been elaborated. Moreover, the profitableness has been analyzed.
The tidal power plant near Sisimiut is profitable after 4-9 years. However, the location is obstructed by a local marina and a sewer outlet.
The hydropower plant near Sarfannguaq is profitable after 10-25 years. There are no infrastructural or environmental obstacles for the location
The long-term profitableness of the plants depends on the price of diesel, and whether or not the price is subsidized. Two scenarios regarding the price of diesel are being used in this report, a subsidized and an unsubsidized.

fields.title: Risikoanalyse af turismen i Sisimiut Kommune
fields.abstract:
The risk associated with travelling in Greenland is analysed in this report. The purpose of the
analysis is carried out in order to identify the danger for the individual tourist while travelling in
Greenland. The risk analysis results in a number of recommendations for improving the safety when
travelling in Greenland.
To identify the most significant factors for the individual tourist a Bayesian Network was
constructed. On the basis of this analysis it was found that the safety of tourists can be improved
significantly by putting up general warning signs. These precautions can be carried out by relatively
low-cost investments.
The result of this risk analysis is considered a success, since it is concluded that the safety of the
tourists in Greenland is improved significantly without any large investments.

fields.title: Environmental research in Ikamiut, Greenland
Ekstraktion af astaxanthin - efter isolering af carotenoprotein fra rejeaffald
Anvendelse af delvis oprensede rejeskaller til isolering
fields.abstract:
Denne opgave omhandler udnyttelse af rejeaffald, hvor der lægges vægt på brugen af rejeskaller. Man ønsker at anvende rejeskaller til isoleringsmateriale og derfor undersøges det om de har en isolerende effekt.
Der foretages forskellige analyser/undersøgelser på rejeskallerne, såsom mekanisk stabilitet, isoleringsevne, densitet, tørstofstofanalyse og luftighedsforsøg. Dette er for at bestemme deres egenskaber og egnethed som isolering. Resultaterne for isoleringsforsøget sammenlignes med de teoretiske værdier for rockwool.
Forsøgene udføres på rejeskaller med forskellig forbehandling. Forbehandlingen indbefatter afvaskning og deproteinisering og for nogle skaller også decalifisering.
Det sammenlignes om forbehandlingen af rejeskallerne har nogen betydning for isoleringsevnen.
Vores analyser har vist at forbehandlingen ingen indflydelse har på isoleringsevnen.
Ingen af vores resultater viser markante forskelle på de forskellige typer af rejeskaller.
Tørstofanalyserne har vist at vandindholdet i rejeskallerne efter tørring er lavt, ca. 5%.
Luftfugtigshedsforsøget har vist at rejeskallerne optager mere vand jo højere vandaktivitet.
Isoleringsforsøget viser at rejeskallerne er omtrent lige så isolerende som rockwool, og selvom rejeskallerne bliver udsat for en mekanisk belasting, bevarer de deres isoleringsevne.
Samlet ser det ud til at rejeskaller har potentiale som isoleringsmateriale.

fields.title: Grønlandske byggematerialer
Jordbundsforhold og vejbygning ved Kangerlussuaq
Drikkevandsforsyningen i Tasiusaq
fields.abstract:
Indledningsvist er rapporten beskrevet i form af en beskrivelse af bygden Tasiusaq. Hernæst er en
generel beskrivelse af vandforsyningen i de grønlandske byer og bygder. Desuden beskrives de
gældende regler og love for drikkevandsforsyningen i Grønland.
På baggrund Nanna Stuhr Jørgensens besøg i Tasiusaq, er bygdens drikkevandsressourcen,
herunder eksisterende forhold, indvinding, forbrug samt drikkevandskvalitet beskrevet.
Tasiusaq har en indvindingstilladelse fra en drikkevandssø på 7.300 m3. Det vurderes at anlægget til
drikkevandsforsyningen i Tasiusaq fungerer udmærket. Dog er drikkevandsforsyningen
utilstrækkelig, da fabrikken i bygden forbruger mere end de har tilladelse til. Drikkevandskvaliteten
er generel god, dog er der målt lave pH-værdier og bly-indhold i prøver udtaget af vandet.
Herefter er der lavet en analyse af de forhold der bør forbedres således at en bedre
drikkevandsforsyningen i Tasiusaq kan opnås. Herunder er udviklingsperspektivet for Upernavik
kommune samt Tasiusaq undersøgt og beskrevet.
I analysen er problemstillinger som utilstrækkelig drikkevandsforsyning, drikkevandskvalitet,
opmagasinering af drikkevand, affaldshåndtering, ringe beskyttelse af indvindingsopland og sø samt
begrænsende rensning af råvandet opstillet.
Udviklingsperspektivet for Upernavik kommune og Tasiusaq er i de kommende år lovende. Man
forventer en lille stigning i befolkningstallet. Erhvervsmæssigt er fangst og fiskeri det
altdominerende erhverv i kommunen. Fiskeriet går godt i den del af kommunen hvor Tasiusaq er
beliggende, og man må forvente at produktionen på fabrikken i Tasiusaq vil stige de kommende år.
Det er beregnet at der i 2020 er 269 personer i Tasiusaq, og vandforbruget er bestemt til ca. 16.375
m3.
Slutteligt indeholder rapporten en række forslag til forbedringer af de ovenstående opstillet
problemstillinger, som udgør et problem for drikkevandsressourcen og drikkevandforsyningen i
Tasiusaq.

fields.title: Analyse af den grønlandske lerressource og dens muligheder
Afdækning af energiforbrug på bygdeplan i Grønland. For Sarfannguaq og Itilleq
fields.abstract:
Inledning: Grønlands landsting har gennem de seneste år vist en stadig stigende interesse for at få 
vedvarende energi implementeret i deres energiproduktion. Denne rapport vil afdække 
energiforbruget på bygdeplan i Grønland, med henblik på senere beregninger og analyser 
for muligheden af etablering af vedvarende energikilder. Dette vil blive gjort i en 
kommende rapport, som vil blive udført af Claus Nikolaj Hansen. Den kommende 
rapport vil endvidere indeholde tiltag til energiudjævning, så det vil ikke blive behandlet 
nærmere i denne rapport. Følgende bygder vil blive behandlet, Sarfannguaq og Itilleq 
beliggende i Sisimiut kommune. 
For at afdække energiforbruget, vil rapporten behandle data over bygdernes årsforbrug, 
månedsforbrug og der vil være et eksempel på en time profil. Fiskefangstens indvirkning 
på energiforbruget vil blive behandlet på både måneds plan og års plan.

fields.title: Vej mellem Sisimiut og Kangerlussuaq
fields.abstract:
Denne rapport er tænkt som en lille forundersøgelse af en jordtype ved Kangerlussuaq. Det kan ikke 
definitivt konkluderes om jordtypen, nær og der hvor  vejen skal etableres, er frostfarlig. Det kan 
give os et indblik og lille præg om jordtypen og dens frostfølsomhed. 
Jordprøverne er behandlet i samarbejde  med Center for Arktisk Teknologi.  
Der er behandlet to  typer af jordprøver. 
Den endelige afgørelse og konklusion foretages førs t efter feltarbejde ved Kangerlussuaq, hvor der 
udtages prøver der hvor vejen skal etableres.

fields.title: Minivandkraftsanlæg på Grønland
Concrete production in Greenland
fields.abstract:
The  concrete  company  Betoncentralen  in  Greenland  wishes  to  get  a  status  on  the 
concrete production and materials used in concrete. 
They also wish to make cheaper concrete that is as durable as the one made today and 
to know why the mixing machines wear and tear so fast compared to mixing machines 
in other companies.  
 
The project aims to investigate if it is possible to produce a cheaper concrete mixture 
by using less cement, as that is the most expensive product used in the production. 
The aggregates used are pumped from the sea, for fine aggregates, and crushed gneiss 
from a mine, as coarse aggregates. 
The  requirements  in  Greenland  define  four  types  of  concrete  and  do  not  give  the 
possibility to use less cement. 
It is possible to make a trial mix with less cement from packing calculations and test it 
to  see  if  it  fulfils  the  requirements  in  Greenland,  except  for  the  reduced  cement 
amount.  
To make status of the aggregates, experiments are made from standards and compared 
to requirements in Greenland. The description of aggregates should give an idea of 
why the machines wear and tear so fast.  
Finally a clay material is tested with the existing aggregates, as it could be possible to 
make a totally new concrete mix that might be cheaper than the one used today, where 
the clay could perhaps replace some of the cement used. This is done with packing 
calculations.  
 
All in all, the aggregates and the most common concrete used at Betoncentralen live 
up to standards and requirements in Greenland. The quartz rich mineral composition 
and texture of aggregates is the main reason for the wearing and tearing of mixing 
machines.  
The trial mix tested in the project had less cement amount and double the compressive 
strength than required, but did not live up to the requirements in other ways.  
Adding the clay material gives higher packing than just for two aggregates. But the 
clay’s influence on fresh and hardened concrete was not tested in this project.

fields.title: Grønlandske vejes og landingsbaners bæreevne
fields.abstract:
In Greenland and other arctic regions there  often seem to be problems with stability 
after construction of roads and airfields. The problems arise when roads and airfields are 
exposed to exterior forces like extreme  weather condition, changes in climate or 
extension of permafrost. These conditions lead s to formations of cracks, bumps and sags 
in the surface. 
 
This master thesis describes the use of different soils and pavements (chapter 2) and 
how to design a road construction in correla tion with permafrost (chapter 3 and 4). The 
methods used for determining the condition in pavements are also described (chapter 5).  
 
The project looks at the weather and climate changes in West Greenland (chapter 7) and 
how these changes affect the extension of permafrost. 
 
In 1941 the U.S. Air Force established an airb ase in Kangerlussuaq and over the last 60 
years it have been repaired and enlarged a number of times. In 1992 the airport was 
given to the Home Rule of Greenland and  today Kangerlussuaq Ai rport is junction to 
almost all air traffic in Greenland. The pave ment conditions in Kangerlussuaq Airport 
have been investigated by NIRAS Greenland A/S and the Danish Road Institute 
(Vejdirektoratet) over last couple of years (chapter 8). 
 
In correlation to this master thesis a numb er of surveys was conducted in Kangerlussuaq 
Airport in April 2005 (chapter 9). Th e surveys were conducted by using Ground 
Penetrating Radar (GPR) on the runway. Th e purpose was to get knowledge about the 
condition in and under the runw ay construction. The surveys  showed the presence of 
several reflection points. These reflection poin ts are properly monito red by the presence 
of big stones or ice lenses.

fields.title: Georadar og seismik
fields.abstract:
This exam project is a study of the two non destructive geophysical methods; GPR 
(impulse) and Seismology (vibration, P- and S-waves), which are used to 
investigate the geology of the sub-surface. 
The two methods are described theoretically and then tested at specific locations in 
Nr. Lyngby in the Northern Jutland. Three main things are tested: 
-   The combination of seismology and  GPR to map the entire geological 
sequence.  
-   S-wave versus P-wave seismic; the range of penetration and resolution.  
-   If it is possible to detect the Nr . Lyngby Basin with the use of GPR. 
 
It is found that it could be possible to map the geology of the sub-surface with the 
use of both GPR and P- and S-wave seismology. In one profile (Strand (beach)) it 
was found that S-wave seismology cover depths of 10-50 m and that P-wave 
seismology cover depths of 20-300 m. In an  another profile (Profile 4) the P-wave 
range was found to be 57-460 m and the GP R coverage was found to be 5-6 m. In 
this profile there were no results from the S-wave seismology unfortunately, but 
looking at the coverage from the beach pr ofile, it could have been possible to 
obtain a total coverage of the near  surface stratigraphy in profile 4.  
 
The seismic results from the beach profile  show an overlap in reflector depths 
between the two methods, but the S-wave s shows a higher resolution than the P-waves within the same depth range. These results reveal the potential in using S-wave seismic in shallow land investigations, and give means to further studies in 
the use of S-waves. 
 
It was also found that the GPR detected the southern part of the Nr. Lyngby Basin 
perfectly. Its southern border  could be followed more than 60 m’s inland going in a 
southeastern direction. While using the GPR it was found that the signal had 
difficulties in penetrating asphalt, if the su rface were covered with a thick layer of 
asphalt. In this case the intensity of the GPR should have been higher

fields.title: Klinker af ler fra Kangerlussuaq
fields.abstract:
I Kangerlussuaq blev alle lerprøverne fremskaffet til videre undersøgelse. Hvorefter de blev 
undersøgt for vandindhold, glødetab og saltindhold. Endvidere blev disse prøvers kornkurve også 
bestemt ved hjælp af sigtanalyse og slemmeanalyse. 
Med kendskab til de ovennævnte data og en sammenligning med ler fra Tommerup teglværk er de 
prøver der har størst sandsynlighed for at opfylde krav for formbarhed, porøsitet og krybning 
fundet. 
Der er brændt to klinker, den ene er bestående af rent ler af prøve 1514 og den anden er af et 
blandingsprodukt af prøve 1501 og 1506. Klinkerne viste sig at være formbare, have en god fast 
overflade samt krybning indenfor de oplyste erfaringstal. 
Der skal før en egentlig produktion startes undersøges hvor meget ler der er i det område hvor prøve 
1514 er fundet.

fields.title: Vandkraft i Tasersuaq
fields.abstract:
In this report one of the most likely hydropower projects in is Greenland analyzed, Tasersuaq a lake 
27 km northeast of Sisimiut. 
Preliminary investigations for a hydropower with a runoff to Kangerluarsuk ungalleq have been 
conducted since the seventies, and they show good geological conditions for a tunnel through a 
mountain side, except for the last part towards the fjord. It is reasonable to think future construction 
will use this potential. 
With that, I have worked out a ten point geological analysis of the project from an engineering point 
of view. To supply the existing data I have made my own preliminary investigations at the intake 
area, using a ground penetrating radar, furthermore was a sample from the bottom lake retrieved 
and GPS measurement was made to determent the level of the ice.  
The major conclusions in report are that with planned lowering of the water level, further analysis 
of the consequences are missing, since it can be expected that transportation of sediments to lake 
will be increased, with a result of potential wear and tear of the turbine. Furthermore it can be 
expected that the lake will be filled with sediments, with a potential of creating a threshold that 
minimizes the size of the reservoir.  
Further work with the use of an echo sounder on the lake is advisable, since it will make it possible 
to determining existence of thresholds, and the situation in the intake area.

fields.title: Recente Foraminiferer i Ulkebugten
Overfladenær geologi i Sisimiut kortlagt med Ground Penetrationg Radar
fields.abstract:
I have used Ground Penetrating Radar to profile the depth to groundwater and permafrost 
in the town of Sisimiut, Central West Greenland. The top of the crystalline base is situated 
at very shallow depths causing the groundwater level to be found no deeper than a meter 
into the ground and the permafrost no deeper than two metres, yet everywhere below the 
groundwater surface.  
Data were recorded in the summer of 2005 using an antenna with a radar frequency of 
340 MHz. Combined with six wells drilled in 1967, this remains the basis for the 
interpretation. The purpose of this paper was to map the near surface geology of Sisimiut, 
but massive amounts of noise on the GPR-prof iles have made it impossible to discern 
reflectors deeper than a few meters.

fields.title: Spildevandshåndtering og effekter på havmiljøet omkring Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
Wastewater in Greenland is for the most part released into the aquatic environment without 
treatment. This can have unwanted effects on the aquatic life and is especially problematic around 
the bigger cities. In this project the focus is therefore on the consequences of releasing untreated 
wastewater to the sea around Sisimiut. The influence of the release around Sisimiut is compared to 
investigations done in Søndre Strømfjord to give an indication of the extent of pollution in the 
aquatic environment. An evaluation and optimisation of the three pilot projects for wastewater 
treatment established in Sisimiut has also been  done. Likewise a strategy for handling of wastewater 
in Sisimiut has been created.  
 
Investigations of the sea around Sisimiut have shown a local pollution source from the wastewater 
outlet in Ulkebugten below the hospital. This is indicated by the slow water change in Ulkebugten, 
which allows for the sedimentation of nutrients and heavy metals. Also are the currents in 
Ulkebugten not strong enough to suspend the sediment and hereby a magnification of the 
components in the sediment is possible 
Comparisons with Søndre Strømfjord, which is not  subjected to any major pollutions, show that the 
aquatic environment around Sisimiut is clearly cont aminated with the heavy metals cobber and lead. 
This is seen by the difference in measured con centrations as well as the fact that a natural 
occurrence of heavy metals is not present near Sisimiut. Pollution has also been observed at the 
bottom of Søndre Strømfjord which indicates a release of wastewater from Kangerlussuaq at KL18. 
It is however necessary to conduct more investiga tions before the extent of this pollution can be 
determined. 
The basis on which the assessment of the pilot projects for wastewater treatment has been 
conducted is very slim, as the start-up period for th e systems is not yet terminated. It can therefore 
not be evaluated whether one system is preferable compared to the others, however as the Kongsted 
treatment system is very expensive the 2 others ar e preferable. To be able to properly evaluate the 
running systems and especially effects due to s eason variations the systems should be monitored 
over a 3 year period. 
After evaluating the central point sources around Sisimiut it has been found that a strategy for the 
handling of wastewater in Sisimiut should be pr epared centralised on the implementation of peat 
and bioblok treatment systems for handling of  household wastewater. Likewise the industrial 
wastewater from the Royal Greenland factory should be treated before released into the bay, as this 
is a big contribution to the contamination of  the aquatic environment. Initiatives towards 
heightening the environmental awareness in Sisimiut by knowledge sharing and increased public 
debate should also be planned.

fields.title: Forundersøgelser af fugtforhold i arktiske boliger
Implementering af vedvarende energikilder på bygdeplan i Grønland
fields.abstract:
This rapport is a continuation of the rapport  “Afdækning af energiforbrug på bygdeplan i 
Grønland” which aim was to register the energy consumption in Itelleq and Sarfannguaq.  
The rapport investigates the possibilities of implementing alternative power sources for 
small communities and the following sources  have been investigated: solar power for a 
hot water boiler, wind power, water power a nd heat pump. This work has been done with 
the help of present rapports and a system usi ng heat pumps have been looked into more 
superficially. 
 
The preparation of this rapport was done in 2005, with mapping of the  project structure in 
January 2005 and gathering of data and info rmation in spring 2005, as a preparation for 
the 3 weeks fieldwork in Greenland summer 2005. The 2 small communities Sarfannguaq 
and Itelleq were visited at  the end of July and start august. The rapport “Afdækning af 
energiforbrug på Grønland” was afterwards completed by  Christian Wolf and Claus 
Hansen. This rapport was commenced autumn 2005 by Claus Hansen. 
 
It has become known that heat pumps and solar power is less suitable for the small 
communities in Greenland, but it turns out that  wind power is cost effective if the right 
circumstances is present and water power might have a potential use for those 
communities that is located good in regard to a lake  with a good elevation.  
There is eventually in the end of this rapport a summary of recommendations for further 
surveys that should be carried out before a fi nal decision about whether or not to implant 
alternative energy sources is made.

fields.title: Vejprojektering i Arktiske områder- Et skitseprojekt for Stikvej til Sarfannguaq
Optimeringsforsøg vedrørende udvinding af chitin fra rejeaffald
fields.abstract:
The shrimp industry in Greenland discharges great amounts of waste from the shrimp-peeling processes. This waste is made up of lipids, proteins and the structure-forming 
polysaccharide chitin. 
As it is today, the waste is dumped straight into the “Ulkebugten” near Sisimiut. Instead 
of just dumping it into the bay the objective of this study is to clarify whether or not it is 
possible to extract the chitin. Chitin has found use in areas as diverse as wastewater 
cleaning, packing and as antiseptic band aids 
During the project, two different kinds of experiments were set up. They were both 
supposed to help the process along by pre-treating the shrimp waste. One experiment 
used lactic acid bacteria, and the other used enzymes. 
During the experiments, it became clear that the enzyme experiment had some effect on 
the waste, whereas the fermentation experiment did not show any significant effect, but 
this might be due to the kind of bacteria used, or that the pH-values did not drop to a 
low enough value. 
The conclusion must be that this is not the kind of experiment to start a production of in 
Greenland. In this fragile environment, it is much more plausible to focus on a simple 
chemical extraction, where the focus is on the amount of chemicals used and the 
concentration.

fields.title: Udnyttelse af rejeaffald fra Royal Greenland, Sisimiut, Grønland
Udnyttelse af rejeaffald
fields.abstract:
The majority of Greenland’s export revenue today comes from prawns. A by-product of the 
production of peeled, frozen prawns, is large amounts of shrimpshell waste. This waste could 
potentially be processed into other valuable products. Chitin is such a product, and is extracted 
from the shrimpshells by acid demineralization followed by alkaline deprotienization. Using 
shrimpshell waste from a factory in Sisimiut, we have attempted to determine if we by preprocessing the shells by fermentation and enzyme-treatment, could reduce the amount of 
chemicals needed in the processing, and additionally extract protein and the pigment astaxanthin, 
which also have a high market value. For the experiment with fermentation we used samples 
with varying amounts of lactic acid bacteria and sugar, and in the in the enzyme experiment we 
used three different types of enzymes. In both experiments we varied the incubation period. We 
found that fermentation is more effective for deproteinization of the shrimpshells than enzymetreatment, but that both methods can be considered very effective. We also found that none of 
the experiments gave a profitable yield of protein and astaxanthin.

fields.title: Vejundersøgelser i Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
The purpose of this paper is to illustrate different methods on how to investigate a roads condition 
and construction. Furthermore to introduce new tools for road maintenance. The report is based on a 
datacollection made on a study trip to Greenland in July/August 2005, and concerns the roads in 
Sisimiut, with focus on 5 main areas. 
 
First there will be a presentation of the possibilities of the Pavement Management System RoSy, 
which contains tools for handling both data collection and calculations for maintenance, budgets 
and costs - all regarding road constructions. 
 
Following the used methods, trafficcounts along with the use of the ground penetrating radar and 
the hand held falling weight deflectometer, will be described. Additionally the results will be 
analysed as well as used as input in a database in RoSy. 
 
As a supplement to the above mentioned investigations, test regarding density, sieve analysis, 
gravel density, water content, penetration, bitumen analysis and bitumen percentage, has been made 
on asphalt cores from the five reference areas. Also a Los Angeles Test on the gravel aggregate for 
the asphalt production has been made to verify the wearability. Finally drainage of water from the 
road structure will be mentioned briefly. 
 
At the end an evaluation of the obtained results will be made.

fields.title: Marine fedtsyre og allergi. En kostanalyse i Vestgrønland
Optimering af grønlandsk letklinkefremstilling
fields.abstract:
Samples have been taken from respectively the buttom, the coast and on the clayplain in Kangerlussuaq bay in the summer 2005. The main meaning of taken the samples is to understand the geology in the area and to find a better clay to production of light expanded clay aggregate, compared to the test there have been maid of the clay from the fossilplain.

The sedimentary start with a process where weathering and erode materials caused the ice cap are erodeded by the iceriver to Kangerlussuaq. A lot of the sand, silt and clay are settled after the iceriver meets the bay of Kangerlussuaq. Some of the small particles can not be settled by gravitational effect, but when the saltwater and fresh water of suspension of clay meet eachother the clay will flocculate because of the power of electrochemical cohesion between the particles. 
Water content, loss on ignition, grain size classification and chloride content are tested for all samples and to that some of the samples have been tested of mineralogy.
The average of water content of the buttom samples is 32,8 %, along the coast 17,1 % and in clayplain 11,1 %. The average of loss on ignition is for sand 0,14 weight%, silt 0,81 weight%, clay 1,1 weight% and clayplain 1,6 weigth%. Calcit is observed in the in sediment from the clayplain, but the quantity is minimal. 
The salt content in the clayplains vary from 2 to 36 weigth%. In the samples from the buttom of the bay where the saltwater have been in contact, the salt content is between 0,2 to 2 weight% and in the opposite way where the saltwater have not been involved the salt content is under 0,2 weight%.  
The average grain size falls from sand, the half of the the way between Kangerlussuaq city and the habour, to silt and clay near the habour.The mineralogy vary a lot between the factions, specially the quartz content is lower in the clay faction, compared to silt and sand, but not lower than the quartz content in the clayplain. The average hardness is lower in the clay faction compared to silt and sand faction, which obviously means that it is earsier for the ice cap to erode minerals with a lower of hardness to small particles and opposite. Seismic of the bay, indicate very thick sediments.
 
A new oven have been made specially to produce light expanded clay of aggregate. The nodules is moved through a long pipe of 25 cm to the burning zone. The temperature is maximum 20 cm from the opening, where the temperature is about one third of the maximum temperature.

In south Greenland near the village Igaliko, two sedimenttest have been taken in the area of mountains of syenite. The samples consist of sand and gravel, and therefore it have been crushed to clay. With X-rays fluorescence analysis of syenite from DTU, the theoretical melting point is found with help from phasediagrams to 1400°C, but with a temperature plunge in the area with about 1063°C.
There have been made tests of expantion of light expanded clay of aggregate of syenite from DTU and from Igaliko. Both tests have succeded, but the densities are not satisfactory. On the other hand the structure of the nodulus, produced from the syenite from DTU, have very small pores which bring a higher strength of the product, which is to prefer.   

To compare the burning process to a Leca oven, test have been made, where the nodulus is heated up, to dry it, before it is moved to the burning zone. The tests have been made with both oil from blubber and coal dust, and the tests shows that the quantity of oil from blubber nearly disappear under the heating up, which is the opposite for the coal dust. Loss on ignition tests of coal dust shows that the most of it will be burned between the temperature of 500°C to 900°C, with a burning time of 15 minutes, which document the test mentioned before.
There have been maked burning test with a temperature of 1200°C of the clay from the fossilplain, but the result is not better than the tests maked with the temperature of 1100°C. Tests with syenit from Igaliko, with the same temperature, gives better results. The mineralogy is decisive of the burning temperature.
Burning test of clay from the buttom of Kangerlussuaq bay with the temperature of 1100°C, result in flat pancakes, if the same procedure as tests with clay from the fossilplain is used. That indicate a higher procent of melted materials compared to the clay from the fossilplain.

To dimensioning a road construction in arctic territory with light expanded clay of aggregate the method of Odemark has been used. With af yeardaytrafik of 5000 vehicles the road must be maked of 60 mm asphalt, 210 mm gravel and 322 mm light expanded clay of aggregate. To frostdimensioning of the road the computer program HEAT2 have been used. With temperatures reply to a average year in Sisimiut, it is possible to preserve the permafrost in the subsoil under the road nearly the hole near, in only 14 days the temperature will be over the freezing point. Because of years with a higher temperature the lay of light expanded clay of aggregates must be thicker, about 400 mm

fields.title: Oprensning af olieforurenet jord i Grønland
fields.abstract:
Oil spill is a sizeable problem in towns and villag es in Greenland, where oil is used for heating and 
transport.  Oil possesses toxic properties and serious  environmental damages can be seen in decades 
after an oil spill. In an Arctic  environment, as in Greenland, oil will remain in the ground for a 
longer period than in a tempered climate. Thus  there is a large need for cleaning oil polluted 
grounds and make the cleaning method more effi cient. Oil undergoes naturally microbial 
degradation, where the parameters: oxygen, nutrients, temperature, water cont ent and pH will affect 
the degradation rate. Therefore th e degradation rate can be optimi zed by adjusting these parameters. 
Since cleaning of an oil spill via degradation is a low-tech an d economical feasible it is a good 
alternative to other re mediation technologies.  
The purpose with this study was therefore to optimize the nutrient content for cleaning an oil 
polluted soil excavated from a landfill in Sisimiut. The experiment was carried out by adding 
different amounts of nutrient to 12 test units, in creasing the temperature with about 10 °C and 
installing a simple oxidizing system. Due to the  high background concentrations and small amounts 
of added N, P and K it was not possible to conclude  which nutrient level that is the most optimal.  
The oil concentration in the polluted soil was very high with an average amount of 30,861 mg/kg or 
14 % free phase. The oil is heavy  and weathered consisting of primarily aromatics and long chained 
n-alkanes. In spite of this between 19 % and  34 % was degraded during th e 81 day long experiment 
period. The experiment is still running and indica tions show that the degradation continues. GC-chromatograms showed that it was microbial degrad ation and not evaporation that took place during 
the experiment. This indicates the  possibility of degrading oil at a C:N: P:K ra te of approximately 
48:1:2:4. 
Aside from the mentioned investigations two oxidizing experiments was carried out to examine the 
significance of aeration for oil reduc tion in the soil. The oil concentrations in the soil for theses 
experiments was 3.4 times higher than for the degradat ions experiments despite the fact that the soil 
for the two experiments was collected in the sa me area. The oxidizing experiments showed that 
enhanced aeration increases the evaporation of the light compounds. The aeration extent was 
increased by oxidizing the oil in a  constantly operating cement mixer.  
In overall terms the experiments shows that there is a great potential for remediation of even large 
oil pollutions with heavy and weathered oils  in the Greenlandic na ture through microbial 
degradation, with a low-tech  and economic aeration system and temperatures about 10 degrees 
Celsius.

fields.title: Undersøgelse af det sedimenterede materiale i Kangerlussuaq fjord til brug som cementfortrængende tilsætning
fields.abstract:
The purpose with the existing project is to pick out samples of the deposited material in 
Kangerlussuaq fiord (Søndre Strømfjord) with the purpose to estimate its use as a mineral 
admixture for cement and thereby as an admixture to force out cement. 
 
The consumption of cement in Greenland is quite large. Cement is not produced in Greenland but it 
is imported from Denmark, and the  aggregates are added in Greenland to make concrete. Due to the 
large costs caused by the import of cement, it coul d be advantageous to force out a part of the 
cement by replacing it with another material,  which Greenland can deliver. Thus it would be 
possible to reduce the amount of cement imported in Greenland. To force out some of the cement in 
concrete, very fine aggregates can be added.

fields.title: Fundering i permafrost - Geotekniske undersøgelser i Kangerlussuaq
fields.abstract:
The presence of permafrost is a major consideration for foundation in the excep-tional problems that are at hand in arctic environments, both concerning the foun-dation of existing constructions and when new constructions are planned. The aim
of this study was to perform preliminary geotechnical investigations in two planed
expansions areas of the Greenland town of Kangerlussuaq. By doing so, evalua-tions of the possibility to raise buildings in an area termed A1, and of constructing
a cemetery in another area (C4) can be addressed.
A borehole drilling was performed in area A1. This yielded particular data on
deposits and their properties. To obtain overall impression of the geology and
permafrost table of both areas (A1 and C4), geoelectrical investigations were per-formed. The measurements were compared with the results from previously per-formed georadar investigations.
Area A1 consists of displaced silt and clay, but also of sand and gravel. There
has been rather resent landslides, which still constitute a risk, together with creep.
Trenches can be seen in whole of Kangerlussuaq, indicating that there is at present
waterflow in the area. Such a flow is a factor that contributes to the wash-out of
the marine sediment, in turn influencing the salinity of the soil which decreases
the freezing temperature. Furthermore, the flow of water has impacts on the per-mafrost, which hereby is degraded. The samples from the drilling show compara-tively large water contents that can be due to icelenses in the clay. In thawperiods,
the melting of the ice could give large subsidence problems. With regard to the
foundation, pilefoundation is preferable.
Area C4 consists of sand and gravel, free of frost to the depth of 2m. The per-mafrost table is expected in a depth of 2,8m. The sand deposits allows opportu-nities for drainage.
These measurements evidence that it is possible to raise buildings in area A1, but
it should be with regard to the increasing temperature of the soil and the melting
of the frozen sediments. It must be taken under seriously considered, because of
the high contents of ice, a large subsidence is to expect.
Due to the clastic, free of frost, sediments to the depth of 2m, and the possibility
of drain, there should be no problems for constructin a cemetery in C4

fields.title: Affaldshåndtering i grønlandske bygder
fields.abstract:
This report is the result of a three weeks field study in Sisimiut, Greenland during the 
summer, 2005. The main aim of the report is to assess the waste handling system in 
Sisimiut and the smaller settlements Itteleq and Sarfanguaq.  
 
The waste fractions and quantities have been analysed by sorting the household waste. 
The quantities of this faction have been found to be 429 kg/pers/yr for Itteleq and 366 
kg/pers/yr for Sarfanguaq. The sorting furt her shows that the smaller settlements 
generate larger quantities of organic waste than in Denmark.  
 
The analysis of the waste handling indicate s that most of the waste is incinerated 
without considerations of the type of waste.  This means that the residual product from 
the incineration process – bottom ash, has a  reasonable large concentration of heavy 
metals. This fraction is deposited without considerations of leaching  to the environment.  
 
The concentrations of bottom ash for the smaller settlements and fly ash and bottom ash 
from Sisimiut are analysed for lead, zinc,  cadmium and copper. The main concentration 
of cadmium is found in the range of 3 to 10 mg/kg though with  a max value of 230 
mg/kg. Copper is found in the range of 1500 to 2500 mg/kg with max value of 9600 
mg/kg. Lead is found in the range of 200 to 700 mg/kg (max value of 9000 mg/kg) and 
zinc is found in the range of 1500 to 4500 mg/kg.  
 
In the literature data is found on tests for determining leaching from bottom ash, which 
show a potential leaching of metal concentrations to the marine recipient which exceeds 
the discharge limits. This constitutes a potential environmental problem for the marine 
environment near the open landfill and to further evaluate if the heavy metals are 
accumulated in the marine environment a run-off model for the leachate should be 
generated. Further could water and sediment be  analysed together with analysis of the 
fatty tissue in fish and seals for heavy metals be initiated to assess the extent of the 
problem.   
 
The incineration plants in the smaller settle ments have no emission control of the flue 
gas and therefore the emissions have been assessed to determine potentials risks to the 
environment and inhabitants. The incineration temperatures are found between 720 to 
925 degrees Celsius, which is lower than the optimal temperature where the 
environmental harmful emissions are decreased.  
 
Further more data is found for emissions of Sisimiut, Sarfanguaq and Itteleq which 
presents that especially the settlements incineration plants exceed the limit remarkable 
for parameters like hydrochloric acid, partic les and dioxins. It has not been possible to 
assess, which consequences the emissions have on the health of the inhabitants or the 
  - iv -  
Affaldshåndtering i grønlandske bygder 
 
environment but it is evaluated that the emissions have a potential affect on the local 
environment.  
 
Based on the analysis the waste handling system can be improved. It is suggested that a 
simple flue gas emission control is installe d such as particle filter in the smaller 
settlements. Further more a receiving facility could be implemented in Sisimiut where 
all non-combustible fractions are separated  before incineration and deposited together 
with the bottom ash in cells with minor control of the leachate by drainable layers. In 
the smaller settlements the waste should also be separated and  the non-combustible 
fractions together with the bottom ash be shi pped to the centralised deposit in Sisimiut.

fields.title: MEP-undersøgelse af Fossilsletten ved Kangerlussuaq, Vestgrønland
Recente foraminiferer og CTD-målinger i Søndre Strømfjord, Grønland
fields.abstract:
I denne rapport vil recente faunaer fra 12 sedimentprøver taget i Søndre Strømfjord, Grønland 
(figur 1), blive gennemgået og tolket sammen  med CTD-data målt samtidig med prøvetagningen. 
Fjorden er ca. 200 km lang og er afgrænset mod havet af en lang tærskel, som udgør næsten 
halvdelen af fjorden. Vanddybden på tærsklen overstig er ikke 50 m. Den indre  halvdel af fjorden er 
kendetegnet ved vanddybder mellem 200 og 300 m. Formål et er at beskrive foraminiferernes 
forekomst i relation til de nutidige miljømæssige ka rakteristika for fjorden og derved bidrage til 
forståelsen af arktiske faunasammensætninger. Der  er ikke tidligere lavet  tilsvarende undersøgelser 
i Søndre Strømfjord, men resultaterne vil blive  sammenlignet med studier  fra Svalbard og Disko 
Bugten.

fields.title: Seismisk dataindsamling, Søndre Strømfjord, Vestgrønland
fields.abstract:
Indledning :
Formålet med denne rapport er at beskrive 
omstændighederne omkring feltarbejdet, der skulle 
undersøge sand- og grusforekomsterne i Søndre 
Strømfjord, Vestgrønland. Råstofferne vil 
være rentable at udvinde, hvis de findes på vanddybder 
under ca. 50 m.

fields.title: Fremstilling af letklinker ud fra grønlandsk ler
fields.abstract:
The clay from Kangerlussauq has been examined for usability in the production of expanded 
clay with admixture of crab refuse or blubber.  The examinations of the clay show that it does 
not contain clay minerals why it cannot be called  clay. Besides quartz and feldspar most of the 
material consists of 4,9 % calcite. The ma terial has an average grain size of 2  µ m and 48 % of 
the clay is in the clay fraction. Compared to pl astic clay the material appears less suitable for 
the production of expanded clay.  
 
A fuse formation is important  to the production of expanded clay, because it f acilitates an 
expansion of the material. The melting point for  the clay is read in phase diagrams and is 
found using DT-analysis. It is only possible to  perform a sinter by heating the clay to 1150 
°C. Because of this 9,5 % Na
2 CO3
 is added to the clay, which has resulted in a 40 % fuse 
formation in the material. The melt has a high viscosity which is important to keep the shape 
of the expanded clay. Sporadic  low viscosity melts are present due to among other things 
chalk which is an advantage to the expansion of the material. The expanded clay has been 
examined by microscopy and electron microscopy and some unmelted quartz and kalifeldspar 
is still present. This is thought to decrease the strength and the watertightness of the material. 
The expansion takes place by development of  gasses from among other things chalk and 
carbon. The important thing is to encircle the gasses with a melt so there is a possibility of an 
expansion of the material.  
As there are not large quantities of gas emitting substances in the clay, it is examined with 
admixture of respectively crab refuse and blubber. The blubber is pyrolised by burning and is 
thus not suitable as admixture in the clay  by a larger production, because it will burn off 
during heating. Crab refuse is on the other hand  thought to be more suitable and it contains 
besides chalk and carbon also phosphate which reduces the melting point. For the crab refuse, 
is there still some unclarified  “area” why further examinati ons should be made before a 
conclusion is made. 
The formation of a shell on the expanded clay is important for a production so the expanded 
clay doest not get stuck together. Therefore it  is necessary to have a shell which contains 
minerals there have a melting point that is higher than the burning temperature which in this 
project is maximum 1150 °C. This is possible with oxidation of iron on the surface. It is the 
oxidation/reduction ratio that is cr ucial in the expansion moment and this is indicated by the f-value. The falling O2
 pressure towards the inner of the pellet changes the iron from  hematite 
to Fe-cordietite which also reduced the melting point.  
A number of formulas are used to calculate how much iron, chalk and carbon that has to be 
added.  
 8   
Even though the iron content is high and ochre has been added it has not been possible to 
make a sufficient shell on the expanded clay why the oxidation/reduction ratio did not work 
sufficient.  
To circumvent this problem, powdering of th e surface with talcum powder has been tried. 
This helps in achieving a short heating period which is important because it prevents the 
pellets from exploding and ensures that th e carbon in the expanded  clay does not burn off 
before a fuse formation is reached. 
 
It has been possible to produce expanded clay  with a grain density as low as 0,3 g/cm
3
 which 
is almost as good as Leca.

fields.title: Analysis of measures data for estimating the wind ressource in Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
The measurement campaign in Dumpen started in  August 2004; Dumpen is a hill-top position in the 
neighbourhood of Sisimiut. The study of this data  has revealed a huge winter wind resource (514 W/m
2
) and a 
low summer resource (136 W/m
2
) at 10m a.g.l. However, the year-to- year comparison of the wind resource at 
the Sisimiut Climate Station has shown that the last  winter was extremely windy and has led to implement 
year-to-year adjustments which decrease the wind  resource substantially. Moreover comparing wind 
directions at Dumpen and at the Climate Station has  shown the high probability of offset evaluated at 45°. 
After both corrections, the wind resource has dropped to 300-350 W/m
2
 (winter) and 125 W/m
2
 (summer).  
Different methods have been used to year-to-year corrections. 
These calculations were done through WAsP by ta king into account seasonal variations of roughnesses 
between summer and winter. They show that wind resource mainly moved by temperature gradients between 
the sea and lands is 3 times bigger during winter. 
Dumpen position benefits from hill-top position which ma kes this location the best for wind projects in 
Sisimiut area. Locations close to the city, like the Low Energy House, suffers too much from obstacle 
presence.  
Due to high electricity production costs in Greenland, producing electricity from wind energy in Dumpen is 
close to be cost competitive, it re mains however expensive due to poor wind resource (~10 c€/kWh). The 
Low Energy House vicinity is a bad location for wind  projects: production costs would be higher than current 
customer electricity prices. 
The conclusion is to continue measuring one year more  in Dumpen in order to carry out calculations without 
the error risks generated by the offset. Other tasks lik e icing investigations and measurement at different 
heights above Dumpen could be implemented in the  future. Since no previous wind energy experience has 
existed in Greenland, refining cost calculations is also required.

fields.title: Complex resistivity logging for permafrost mapping
Randon and other indoor environment aspects in Greenlandic dwellings
Fugtmåling i lavenergihuset, Sisimiut
Geoelektrisk kortlægning
Vejbygning i arktiske områder og geologiske beskrivelser
