The setup where the oil reduction was highest was also where both nutrients and heat had been supplied. It was followed by the setup with nutrients, the setup with heat and at last the control setup. It is hereby found that heat or nutrients alone cannot create optimum conditions for removal of hydrocarbons in contaminated soils. An addition of both is needed.
Overall the study has proven that by adjusting the temperature and the soil nutrient content and at the same time securing oxygen availability, a low-cost and low-tech solution for optimal remediation of oil-contaminated soils in the Arctic is possible through natural biodegradation processes.

fields.title: Byggeprocesstyring i Grønland
fields.abstract:
Det er et kaleidoskopisk billede i en samfundsmæssig kontekst tegnet ved hjælp af en interviewundersøgelse
af aktører med en mangeårig erfaring og indblik i grønlandske forhold. Der er tale om
en kvalitativ undersøgelse af det komplekse og interaktive forløb, en byggeproces er. De citerede
holdninger og betragtninger er subjektive og ikke blevet underkastet kritisk journalistik. De fungerer
ikke desto mindre som markante indikationer af problematikker og dilemmaer, det kunne
være interessant at belyse nærmere. Der hersker uden tvivl en udpræget frustration i store dele af
branchen, som peger på forbedringsværdige forhold.

fields.title: Vejforhold i Ilulissat
fields.abstract:
På nogle af vejene i den grønlandske by Ilulissat, er der sætninger som følge af en
sænkning af permafrostspejlet. Der er blevet udført feltarbejde i to områder i byen:
Et i nærheden af kirkegården og et ved et område der hedder Illumiut. Der er blevet
brugt to forskellige geofysiske metoder: Multi elektrode proﬁlering (MEP) og georadar.
MEP målingerne er lavet i åbne områder i nærheden af de undersøgte veje, hvorimod
georadar undersøgelserne er lavet direkte på den eksisterende vej. Derudover er der taget
jordprøver fra området ved kirkegården og boret en enkelt kerne ved Illumiut.
Generelt er sedimenterne i området relativt ﬁnkornede og dermed frostfarlige, hvilket
giver anledning til dannelse af islinser. Sådanne islinser er fundet i området ved Illumiut
under feltarbejdet.
I området ved Illumiut er der ﬂere årsager til sætningerne. Et sted er der et rør der leder
vand gennem vejkassen og medvirker til at opvarme denne. Derudover er der stillestående
vand i de grøfter, der ligger tæt op ad vejen, som opvarmer den fra siden.
For at undgå yderligere sætninger af vejene, foreslås det at opbygge dem med et tykt lag af sprængsten. I området ved Illumiut foreslås det yderligere at bruge ﬂere mindre
rørføringer gennem vejkassen samt at ﬂytte grøfterne længere væk fra vejen.

fields.title: Fysiske materialeegenskaber ved Jernoxidstabiliseret jord
fields.abstract:
Projektet Fysiske materialeegenskaber ved jernoxidstabillisering af jord, er startet
på baggrund af Ph.d. studerende Sanne Skov Nielsens projekt omkring forureningen
på Collstrupgrunden lidt uden for Hillerød. For at sikre at forureningen ikke
siver længere ned i jorden og videre til Esrum Sø, har man forsøgt at tilsætte okkerslam
til jorden, idet okkerslam kan binde forurenende salte til jorden, således at
nedsivningen stoppes.
For at vurdere om, og i hvor stort omfang, det er muligt at anvende den forurenede
jord fra Collstrupgrunden i Hillerød til andre formål, er der behov for at undersøge
hvorvidt okkerslam har en negativ eller positiv indvirkning på strukturen i jorden.
Senere vil man kunne anvende undersøgelsen til også at gælde andre forurenede
grunde af samme type.
I dette projekt ønskes viden om hvorvidt okkerslammet har nogen indvirkning på
jordens struktur og bærevne. Dette er undersøgt ved udførelse af en bestemmelse af
jorden samt proktor og CBR forsøg.
På baggrund af forsøgene vurderes optimalt vandindhold, komprimering og bæreevne
i form af CBR – værdier, i forhold til den oprindelige bæreevne for det forurenede
jord.
Resultaterne har vist at tilsætning af okkerslam til jorden på Collstrupgrunden ikke
har nogen negativ effekt, men en mindre forbedring på 29% af bæreenven, så længe
det sker ved 3% stabilisering. Det har dog vist sig at øges stabiliseringen til 5%
sker der en mindre forringelse af bæreevnen, i forhold til den oprindelige bæreevne.
Det vides dog ikke hvor toppunktet for forbedringen ligger, men som resultaterne
viser falder styrken fra 3 til 5 procent, det betyder at toppunktet kan ligge på begge sider af de 3% tilsætning af okker. Det ville være oplagt at undersøge dette nærmere.
Resultatet af denne rapport giver en mulighed for at kunne anvende okkerslam i jord uden at der ses tegn på en dårligere bæreevne, det betyder at fremtidige vejkasser kunne anvende forurenet jord med okkerslam

fields.title: Fate and Environmental Impacts of Contaminated Soil at Thule Air Base
fields.abstract:
An old runway is used to deposit oil contaminated soil from oil spills at Thule Air Base, TAB. This study investigates impacts of the oil contamination
at TAB with the main focus on the fate and toxicity of the contamination. A map is created showing the spreading of contamination within the active permafrost layer towards the ocean, where restrictions of emissions apply. Additionally, the impact of the contamination on terrestrial and bacterial organisms is analyzed by performing a biotox
test with Vibrio fischeri,a marine bacterium, on the extracted water samples and an acute toxicity test with springtails,Folsomia candida on collected soil samples. Greenland Contractors will use the findings of this baseline study to suggest a suitab
le contaminant transport barrier. Results from Gas Chromatographic analysis (GC) of soil samples indic ate that the contamination is stabilized and no oil
is leaching into the ocean. Evaporation from contaminated soil piles is therefore estimated as a sufficient decontamination strategy. It was found that Vibrio fischeri
are sensitive towards the present oil contamination in water bodies at TAB, where as test with Folsomia candida showed no significant response. For future projects, it is recommended to map and re-analyze water samples within the catchment area and to further determine the origin of oil contamination of the old part of the deposited soil. To complete the base line study, a geological profile including phosphate and nitrogen content of soil is recommended to be examined.

fields.title: Feasibility Study of Potential Composting Systems and Energy Production from Organic Waste in Sisimiut, Greenland
fields.abstract:
Initiated by Arctic Technology Center, DTU, this research-led project set out to explore the
potential for utilizing organic waste fractions for compost or energy production in Sisimiut.
The variety of aspects, which determine the waste and energy management such as
environmental and social needs as well as the economic scope, is multitudinousness. One
significant trigger for this analysis has been the urgent necessity for an improvement of the
waste management strategies in Sisimiut. A project in an Arctic environment requires the
need to adapt and owing to the unique conditions a composting system, a biogas plant and a
combined system has been suggested. The barriers and strength of the different
technological solutions advised in this feasibility study have also been analysed.

fields.title: Feasibility of Sewering the Unsewered Households in Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
The course 11427
- Arctic Technology consists of three parts: Preparation, a 3 - week field trip in Sisimiut and a final report. The whole process was carried out through two semesters and three weeks during
the summer holiday. The course covers 15 ECT points. Getting the whole Sisimiut sewered before year 2020 is a part of the “Qeqqata Sustainability Project 2020”. Nowadays, 50% of Sisimiut is still unsewered. The locals living in these unsewered areas are still discharging the grey water out of their houses, and collecting the black water by either plastic bags or tanks in the meantime. These conventional methods had already brought some practical issues e.g. traffic problems caused by ice formation in frost time and pathogen diffusion in the atmosphere that brings diarrhea and hepatitis. Therefore, the purpose of this project is to look into the feasibility of connecting the focus area
which is recommended by Niels Mønsted from Sisimiut Local Municipality to the existing sewer system
with different options.
Interviews with some of the locals in the focus area were done during the field trip in Sisimiut.
According to the interview results, all the locals are willing to replace the current system to a modern sewer system and also, they would like to pay certain amount of money for the installation.
The sewer system installation fee is quite high in Greenland hence the payment is supposed to be an obstacle in facilitating the project. To establish a fair system for all the citizens, making a long-
term legislation stating the prices of different items clearly in a sewer system project to the public is essential. In the meantime, the project can be started up as quickly as possible if the locals are allowed to pay part of the installation fee by applying loans provided by Greenland Bank and meanwhile,
the municipality affords the main pipe installation and the pipe sections which are more than 20m further away from the main pipeline.
As two wastewater treatment plants are planned to be established in the future, two different options are considered in this project: either connecting the new built sewer system northward or southward
which can cover the planned facilities at the edge of Spejder Lake.
According to the price calculation, the municipality should pay a total price of 5.2mio.dkk and 6.2mio.dkk for option 1 and 2, respectively. Simultaneously, the night soil users are supposed to pay 138.600dkk at least while the tank users should pay 73.200dkk, respectively, for replacing the current system. By comparing the 2 options, some key parameters as main pipe length, price and pros and cons
have been discussed and listed in the report.
Option 1 is relatively cheap and flexible while option 2 is more sustainable and covers the new facilities as well. It is difficult to state which option is better. The final decision depends on the political decisions(emphasis)as treatment plant location(s), sustainability considerations, installation fee distribution etc. If neither of the options is acceptable due to practical reasons e.g. expense, construction period, a tank solution is strongly recommended to the locals, namely collecting the complete sewage by tanks.

fields.title: Swimmingpool in the mountain in Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
The Qeqqata municipality plans develop the area around the Spejder Lake with focus on free time
and leisure activities. One of the projects used to materialize this vision is the construction of a
swimming pool in the mountain across the culture house. The swimming pool is to service the
general population of the area, so it has to include swimming areas for both adults and children
along with spa related areas.

fields.title: At forstå og udføre byggeri i Grønland som en del af processen i den konstruktionsmæssige udviking
fields.abstract:
For at få en bedre forståelse af, hvilke udfordringer der ligger i, at skulle udføre større
byggeprojekter, eller konstruktions arbejde i det hele taget, på Grønland, lægges ud med at oplyse
om dets geografi, klimaforhold og demografi.
Grønland er verdens største ø beliggende i det nordatlantiske havområde, der tydeligt bærer præg af
golfstrømmens cyklus. Det ses ved, at der er stor forskel på, hvordan indbyggerne gennem tiden har
valgt at bosætte sig. Den østlige del af Grønland har et meget koldere klima end den vestlige del,
dette skyldes den kolde havstrøm der løber ned langs den østlige del af øen, og derfor er der
forholdsvis få indbyggere i dette område. Det modsatte er umiddelbart tilfældet for den vestlige del
af Grønland, hvor befolkningsområder såsom Nuuk, Sisimiut og Ilulissat eksisterer. Med en geografisk størrelse der strækker sig ca. 2.670 km fra nord til syd og ca. 1050 km fra øst til vest, er
området enormt sammenlignet med størrelsen af de danske øer, se figur 1. Temperaturvariationen er
af den årsag betragtelig hen over øen, og det ses igen ved, at klimaet i syd er relativt mildt
sammenlignet med det nordlige klima. 
Der eksisterer barske levevilkår i de nordlige regioner som for eksempel Thule, og det ses ved, at
der ikke er særlig mange indbyggere og bygder her. Det sydligste punkt på Grønland, Kap Farvel,
ligger i omtrent de samme breddegradder som Oslo i Norge, og derfor er det sydlige Grønland bosat
i et rimeligt omfang. Grønlands areal er groft antaget 50 gange Danmarks areal, og sammenlignet
med indbyggertallet, bor der mere end 100 gange så mange indbyggere i Danmark end tilfældet er
for Grønland. Ifølge Wikipedia [1] boede der 56.749 indbyggere på grønland pr. 1. Januar 2012.
Med en befolkningstæthed på 0,14 personer/km2 er Grønland et af de tyndest befolkede områder i
verden. Med befolkningsgrupper spredt ud over hele øen, hovedsagelig hen lang kysterne, eksisterer
der mange små bygder med få indbyggere og enkelte større bygder/byer med relativt mange
indbyggere. Dette besværliggør indbyrdes kommunikation og transport, da afstanden er stor,
klimaet koldt og varierende samt at infrastrukturen i et vist omfang er utilstrækkelig.
Klimaet er således, at indlandsisen dækker størstedelen af landet, men ude ved kysterne er der
generelt isfrit. Det anslås at ca. 15 % af Grønlands samlede areal er isfrit, hvoraf resten er
snedækket op til en højde på omrking 3000 m. Grønland er et arktisk område, da gennemsnitstemperaturen ikke overstiger 10 °C i den varmeste måned (juli måned). Der er ingen
skovvækst, korte kølige somre og lange strenge (mørke) vintre, en lille mængde regn der falder og
lav fordampning, hvilket resulterer i stor jordfugtighed.
De geologiske forhold er anderledes end dem kendt i Danmark, for med hensyn til byggeri,
funderes konstruktioner helst på klippegrund ellers på permafrost. Underlaget langs kysterne består
hovedsagelig af klippegrund, der er varierende i højde og beliggenhed, og har som udgangspunkt
formet bygdernes opbygning. Altså har byplanlægningen op gennem tiden båret præg af, at strukturen er bygget op omkring den faste grunds opbygning hellere end en decideret planlægning af et by-design. Permafrost er umiddelbart ved første indtryk også et solidt og stabilt fundament, men det har erfaringer vist ikke er tilfældet. Der ses mange konstruktioner, veje og andre skabelser, der har sat sig som følge af permafrostens flytning afhængig af de omsluttende temperaturforhold.
Dette er et fænomen, der gennem længere tid og stadigvæk undersøges af mange forskere, og der
arbejdes ihærdigt på, at kunne forstå og indordne sig efter permafrostens natur, for eksempel for at
kunne optimere anlæggelse af infrastruktur og byggeri. Permafrosten er en af de mest omfattende
udfordringer, da der tænkes på byggeri i arktiske områder. Eftersom rapporten hovedsagelig tager
udgangspunkt i Grønland, vil en anden omfattende udfordring være logistik, især fordi der er tale
om en isoleret ø i det Nordatlantiske hav.

fields.title: Design of a ventilation system for a renovated wooden house type in Greenland
fields.abstract:
Within the scope of a renovation project an energy efficient ventilation system for the Greenlandic wooden house type 18D is designed and analysed. The renovation includes extra thermal insulation and a vapour barrier to reduce heat losses and infiltration losses. In this way the energy consumption of the house shall be lowered. Besides the mechanical ventilation needs to be implemented to ensure a satisfying indoor climate. The influence of the renovation process on the energy demand is simulated by means of the ISEve software.
The simulations showed that realising just the thermal insulation without considering a ventilation system decreases the energy consumption up to 40 %. However, coincidently the indoor air quality deteriorates strongly and high CO2 concentrations occur. Applying afterwards a ventilation system to the simulation model, leads to rising energy consumption in turn. Hence, realising a renovation project, including also a ventilation system based on the Greenlandic Building Regulation, results in energy saving of up to 15 %. These saving can be enhanced easily by more than 10 % if ventilation rates from other Nordic building regulations (for example Sweden and Norway) are used. In this way it should be possible to achieve the Greenlandic energy target of 200 kWh/m²A (Zone 2).

fields.title: Fugt og skimmel i grønlandske bygninger
fields.abstract:
Denne rapport er udarbejdet i forbindelse med kursus 11427 Arktisk Teknologi. Det er
et valgfrit kursus som jeg tager i forbindelse med min uddannelse til Diplom
Bygningsingeniør på DTU. Kurset tæller samlet 15 ECTS og tages på 6. og 7. semester.
Rapporten er udarbejdet på baggrund af undersøgelser foretaget på feltturen til
Sisimiut, Grønland, i august 2012 samt ud fra litteratur.
Der synes at være et stigende problem med skimmelsvampe i Grønland. I dette projekt
undersøges, hvilke skimmelsvampearter, der volder problemer i de grønlandske
bygninger, samt hvilke årsager der ligger til grund for dette. Herudover ønskes at finde
brugbare løsninger til problemet.
Det forudsættes, at læseren har et vist kendskab til skimmelsvampe og
byggeteknologi.
Jeg takker Birgitte Andersen fra DTU Systembiologi for stor hjælp og fantastisk
vejledning gennem hele projektet. Jeg er meget glad for, at hun var med mig i
Grønland i opstartsfasen. Herudover takker jeg en af DTU ́s
Penicillium
/
Aspergillus
-
specialister, Jens Frisvad, for hjælp til identifikation af
Penicillium
spp.. Jeg takker
ligeledes Elias G. Larsen, bygningskonstruktør i Sisimiut for at give mig en indsigt i og
viden om de interne forhold. Desuden takker jeg Hans S. Lennert for bådtur til bygden
Sarfanguaq, hvor jeg også fik mulighed for at tage prøver.

fields.title: The Application of Geophysics to Characterize the Ice-rich Permafrost at the Area Close to the Airport in Ilulissat
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
This project’s purpose is to investigate the permafrost at the surrounding area of Ilulissat
airport in Greenland in order to determine the vertical and horizontal extent of permafrost,
identify the icerich permafrost and find the typical values of resistivity of materials present
on the site., hence there is some prior knowledge of the subsurface of the field and the material on the site (rocks, clays) may exhibit induced polarization effect[6]. Moreover, the area is away from
industrial noise that could affect the measurements. The airport is not considered an issue because the methods used are not influenced by radio waves from the control tower or the airplanes’ transmitters.
In order to monitor these changes, several methods have been applied[6], such as temperature profiles from boreholes, analyzing core samples and geophysical methods (resistivity surveys, ground penetrating radar, and refraction seismics).

fields.title: Wave rider buoy data analyses
fields.abstract:
Waverider buoy measurements and data collection for analyses, both in
time and frequency domains, by means of Matlab®.
A consequent set of extreme wave heights analyses.
Resulting in the breakwater design at Sisimiut-2 (near the airport), a protection work aimed to create a shelter for Sisimiut-1 (which is the planned new port development area according to the most recent Sisimiut-town master plan).

fields.title: A Study of Methods of Determining the Icing Potential of Cold Climates for Wind Energy
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
Cold climates present a particularly attractive environment for wind power installations,
especially when the expensive nature of oshore and ambitious government targets on
renewable are considered. The main reasons that more projects have not been established
in this challenging environment are a lack of local consumers, poor grid technologies and
challenges to turbine technology resulting from the eects of cold weather.
Of these challenges to the turbine technology, the most detrimental by far is that of
ice accretion. This can induce serious losses in annual energy production (as a result
of increased downtime and aerodynamic losses) as well as a decrease in turbine lifetime
(caused by increased loadings and fatigue).
If the annual icing potential of an area were able to be accurately predicted during
the planning and assessment phase of a wind power project, then measures could be
taken to counter the eects of ice accretion through the implementation of de-icing and
anti-icing techniques. These measures could then increase the overall pro tability of a
project depending on the nature of the project in question.
This report will attempt to calculate the icing potential of as many sites in Greenland
as possible by employing the most widely used techniques with data from those locations.
These locations will then be classi ed according to the IEA ice classi cation scheme for
wind energy.
In an attempt to limit the scope of this project, the work will focus solely on onshore
applications and eects and will only brie
y mention aspects of project development after
measurements such as infrastructure, maintenance, construction, operation or decommissioning.

fields.title: Effekt af genbrug og stabilisering af materialer i belægningsdimensionering
fields.abstract:
This report presents analysis of laboratory experiments of lime stabilized silted clay which come from an area close to Slagelse. In the first part of the laboratory studies, the type of the clay is identified. In the second part of the laboratory studies, the strength of the clay is determined. Moreover, the dimensioning calculations for all layers in the road of Helsingør Highway
are performed, assuming that the sub-grade consists of the analyzed clay. The road dimensions are calculated, both with and without the 400 mm lime stabilizer in the sub-grade.
After dimensioning for those subsections of the road which have the smallest and highest yearly traffic,distributed into days, it is concluded that it is too expensive to use lime for stabilizing below the road. This is due to the fact that the strength of the sub-grade is higher thanthe capping
in the road. This made the capping in the road, the one that defined the dimension.

fields.title: Laboratory Testing of a New Type of Heat Drain Material for Permafrost Protection at Infrastructure in Arctic Regions
fields.abstract:
The arctic regions have in the last decades experienced problems with melting
permafrost beneath infrastructure such as roads, railroads and airfields. The
permafrost is melting due to changes in the thermal regime caused by the construction of the infrastructure. In order to secure the infrastructure against damages occurring when the permafrost melts, there has in the recent years been
researched in methods to prevent the permafrost from melting under the infrastructure.
This thesis is about laboratory trials of a new material for the heat drain method.
The laboratory trials was made with a small-scale model of the shoulder construction of a road embankment. The small-scale construction has been carried
out in a freezer at University Laval, Québec, Canda.
The new material is a drain material made of drain tubes placed approximately 25 cm
apart in between two layers of geotextile. The material was tested with 3 tests, where it was tested with a different amount of drain tubes and compared with different reference sections. The tube heat drain material with 1 and 2 tubes per 25
cm. In the first test the tube heat drain was tested with 2 tubes per 25 cm
and compared with a reference section made entirely of soil. In the following two
tests the tube heat drain was tested with both 1 and 2 tubes per 25 cm
and compared with an old heat drain material. The tests was made by cooling the two sections down to approximately -20◦C, when the temperature was stable a heat source below the construction was turned on and at the same time 300 mm
of mineral wool was placed upon the soil. When the temperatures once again was stable the temperature of the construction was recorded.
The results have shown that the new drain material can be used as a heat drain.
In the first test the tube heat drain section showed between 1-4◦C difference, from the all soil reference section. The next two tests showed that the old heat drain
material is about 3 times more effective than the tube heat drain material. How-
ever, the old heat drain material have over 6 times larger air intake area than the
tube heat drain.

fields.title: The application of EM-methods to characterization of ice-rich permafrost in the area close to the airport in Ilulissat
fields.abstract:
In the beginning of the eighties, the airport in Ilulissat was constructed. In that connection, the area
surrounding the present airport was extensively investigated using
boreholes, geoelectrical studies and the
installation of the of a PT 100 temperature logger
to map the geological conditions
of the area. The site was
revisited in 2007
by Thomas Ingeman-Nielsen
to perform more investigations of the permafrost.
When a student group visited in 2010, several different geophysical investigation methods including Vertical Electrical sounding (VES), Induced Polarisation (IP), Electrical Resistive Tomography
(ERT)and
Frequency-domain Electromagnetic Method (EM)were used to map the permafrost. In terms of the EM measurements, then there was some doubt whether themeasurements could be considered reliable or
whether factors such as change of battery and weather could affect the measurements performed with the Geophex GEM-2.
When the site was revisited in 2012, then several tests had been performed previously to determine the
influence of the external factors
on the GEM-2
. Furthermore, the ERT was used to map profiles which were
later re
-
measured using the GEM
-
2 to determine whether the profiles corresponded
to ERT profiles
or if the
EM
measurements
were unreliable.

fields.title: Solar heating system at the Engineering Dormitory Apisseq
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
Although the Arctic Circle is not the first place that comes in mind when thinking
about solar energy, the truth is that the Nordic climates can provide a lot of
benefits. In fact, it has been noticed that measuring the solar radiation by
following the sun’s path, northern Sweden (above the Arctic Circle), receives
more solar radiation than Germany, the world’s largest market for solar energy.
Another point that has to be mentioned is that the solar collectors are more
efficient when operating in low temperatures. Therefore, considering the Arctic
summers with more than 20 hours of daylight and relatively low temperatures,
which means that the heating needs are still high, solar heating seems an
attractive solution. This applies even more for Greenland, bearing in mind its
high dependence on oil power plants and the increasing price of oil. However
despite of the high number of sun hours, high latitudes pose some challenges for
solar power. The nights in winter are long and very cold and the problems
caused by snow and icing, have to be solved.
This project focused on measurements of the solar heating system in order to be
analyzed and evaluate the system performance. The purpose is to point out
mistakes in the design and during the installation and suggest potential
improvements.

fields.title: Environmental Impact of Heavy Metals Released from the Landfill in Sisimiut (Greenland)
fields.abstract:
The impact of the land ll in Sisimiut on the heavy metal concentrations in the aquatic envi-
ronment was investigated. This was done by analyzing soil, sediment, water, seaweed and blue
mussel samples, as well as using passive samplers. Previous studies showed elevated heavy metal
concentration close to Greenlandic land lls.
The problematic in this case was that a stream is owing through the land ll, which was suspected
to wash out heavy metals more eciently. From the samples, the heavy metal concentrations were
obtained using ICP analysis following the corresponding laboratory methodology.
Concluding from the results it is clear that the land ll is the reason for elevated heavy metal
concentrations in the aquatic environment. Especially the stream is exposed to high concentra-
tions, which are washed into the ocean. In the ocean the heavy metals get quickly diluted, so
that only the cove at the land ll is in uenced, while after ca. 150 m oshore no signi cant el-
evations could be measured. The threshold value for foodstus was not exceeded in the mussel
samples. Also other pollution sources are close to the land ll and the existence of it is unavoidable.
Shielding the stream from the land ll could mitigate the impact on the environment.

fields.title: Noise Measurements on Sisimiut Harbour
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
 Noise is considered a major environmental pollutio
n factor across the world as it is
proven to affect human health both in short and lon
g term. However, the way the problem
is dealt with differs immensely from country to cou
ntry and is very much dependent on local
culture, economy and politics. In the arctic region
noise has not been considered problem so
far. With the advent of societies in these regions
noise levels inevitably arises as a
consequence of human activity. 
 The current project has been conducted in the city
of Sisimiut, which is the second
largest town in Greenland. It is located on the wes
t coast of Greenland and is approximately
40 km Northern from the Arctic circle; this is show
n in Figure 1 - Sisimiut location with
reference to Greenland and arctic circle. The city
is considered major marine port, because
this is the northernmost harbour which is not freez
ing during the whole winter. This is one
of the facts that make Sisimiut marine port is a ma
jor export production hub for all current
and future investors and industries. In order to at
tract investors in the area, building of a
new harbour bay has already begun.

fields.title: Characterization of Potential Sources in Greenland for Biogas Production
fields.abstract:
Shrimp and crab by-products from Royal Greenland in Sisimiut are currently dumped into the
water but constitute a possible resource for biogas production trough anaerobic digestion.
The biogas potential of shrimp wastes, the intern part of the crabs and all the crab wastes,
including the shell, was analyzed. Chemical oxygen demand was measured and the theoretical
biogas potential determined was 476 STP ml CH4/g VS, 576 STP ml CH4/g VS and 540 STP ml
CH4/g VS, respectively. The experimental biogas potential, measured by mesophilic anaerobic
digestion in batch test at lab scale was 430 STP ml CH4/g VS, 500 STP ml CH4/g VS and 410
STP ml CH4/g VS after 42 days. Biogas potential of shrimp wastes decreases 23% when the
ratio inoculum to substrate decreases from 4 to 0.5 which could be explained by ammonia
inhibition in the process due to the high protein content of shrimps. Biogas potential of the
intern part of the crabs decreases 12% when the ratio inoculum to substrate decreases from 4
to 0.5, which could be explained by an initial accumulation of long chain fatty acids that is
overcome and a slightly ammonia inhibition. Free ammonia levels at the end of the batch tests
with a ratio inoculum to substrate of 4 was 125 mg N/l for shrimps and 133 mg N/l for the
intern part of the crabs, which reinforces the idea of a possible ammonia inhibition when
working at high concentrations of substrate.
Due to the hot water needs of the shrimp plant, biogas can be burned to produce heat prior
desulphurization. Shrimp and crab wastes have a potential of substituting 1,062,600 l diesel
per year.
Shrimps and crab wastes could be an excellent resource for anaerobic digestion in order to
solve the environmental problem of dumping in an economically feasible way and at the same
time, producing renewable energy and reducing dependency in pollutant fossil fuels.

fields.title: Natural resource management of Greenland in the light of the new challenges in the Arctic region
fields.abstract:
This paper seeks to identify some of the main challenges that Greenland is facing due to its natural richness. For the purposes of this project
different stakeholders have been identified and approached. A literature research was conducted followed by a series of interviews.
Most of the interviews were conducted in person during the field work (August 2012) and some of them through telephone. The purpose of the
literature research was to better understand the different theoretical concepts (institutions, linkages, natural resource curse, economic development, learning and knowledge). Norway is used as a role model to
illustrate how these theoretical concepts apply in practice. The most relevant of these concepts and theories are shortly introduced in thi
s report. The material obtained by the interviews is examined and compared to the theory and the case of Norway in order to present a snapshot of the current situation in Greenland. Hopefully, this paper will set the
ground for further research that will provide more concrete and specific suggestions on natural resource management in Greenland.

fields.title: Wind Energy Feasibility Report, Qaqortoq, Greenland
fields.abstract:
From introduction:
The present feasibility report was conducted in the context of DTU's course 'Arctic Technology
11427' and its purpose is to assist the govenment of Greenland and Kujalleq Municipality in
southern Greenland in the assessment of wind energy as a potential option for integration to
the current energy system of Qaqortoq, and possible future replacement of diesel generated
electrical energy.

fields.title: The Nanortalik Energy System
fields.abstract:
In
this analysis the possibility of implementing wind power to the energy system in Nanortalik is investigated. This is done on the basis of received fuel consumption
-, diesel powered electricity production and wind data from the 1601 met mast located on the peninsula east of Nanortalik city.
The main goal of the project is to determine whether implementation of a 1 MW WinWind wind turbine is economically feasible or not.
The first part of the analysis includes a presentation of the current energy system in Nanortalik, where data regarding generator production and fuel consumption have been received through Nukissiorfiit. From the analysis of the present energy system,the peak electric
al production has been found to
be 819 kW, while the minimum production is equal to 243 kW. Over the studied period of 1 year the mean production was calculated to be 438 kW. In addition to the electric power production, a total of 1021 MWh was generated by utilizing heat generated from the power producing units. The analysis further contain a wind resource assessment, which describes the relevant meteorological equipment and further includes sections regarding data processing and validation, time series analysis and implementation of the obtained
wind data to WAsP. A mean wind speed of
5.81 m/s was found measured at 50 meter
height, during the period of 26.06.2007 to 25.06.2010.
In WAsP the data is further utilized to calculate an annual energy production at two turbine sites in the vicinity of Nanortalik, where one is located close to the dump site on the peninsula east of Nanortalik city. The second
turbine site is located on a hilltop approximately 3 km west of Nanortalik.
An annual energy production of 2.359 GWh
is found for Turbine site 1 while the AEP is estimated to be 2.984 GWh for Turbine site 2, where the mean wind speed is estimated to be 7.31 m/s. The analysis furthermore consist of sections describing the grid connection of the
wind turbine, as well as the construction partswhere a thoroughly description of the roadrouting is implemented. An environmental impact assessment is also conducted together with description of the relevant legislation
and regulations that must be followed in order to install a wind
turbine in Greenland. A model which calculates the excess power
production when operating a 1 MW wind turbine together with the three generators is developed and described. The calculations show that the total fuel cost savings for the respective turbine sites are equal to 3.04 million DKK and 3.68 million DKK yearly.
A socioeconomic analysis concludes the report where it is found that implementation of a wind turbine at Turbine site 1 results in a positive NPV of 112 700 DKK. The project is thus marginally profitable. The alternative
turbine site returns a negative NPV of 12.3 million DKK. This alternative is found unprofitable due to large expenses related to road construction. The conducted work shows that implementation of wind turbines in the
Nanortalik system is viable, but a risky investment.

fields.title: Vejprojektering i Qinngorput, Nuuk
Forekomst af antibiotikaresistens i Ulkebugten
fields.abstract:
Fra indlendning:
I hele verden stiger såvel antibiotikaforbrug som antibiotikaresistens (AR) stødt. AR er problematisk, fordi det reducerer mulighederne for at behandle infektioner med antibiotika. Når mennesker og dyr behandles
med antibiotika, udskilles 30 - 90 % af dosis uomdannet i urin(Constanzoet al.,2005).
Forekomst af antibiotika i spildevand øger risikoen for udvikling af AR i patogene og nonpatogene bakterier
(Constanzo, et al.,2005). I dette projekt er fokus på resistens i marine bakterier. Gener for AR kan ov
erføres fra marine til
patogene bakterier, og marine bakterier med AR kan potentielt introduceres til mennesker gennem fødekæden. Eksponering for antibiotika i marine miljøer menes desuden at kunne ændre struktur og funktion af marine bakteriesamfund. Bakterier udgør en vigtig base i marine økosystemer, som så kan påvirkes negativt. Forskere diskuterer også,om udvikling af AR i bakterier er en fordel eller ulempe for bakterier,og hvordan det sidenhen kommer til udtryk i hele bakteriesamfundsstruktur og funktion.
Sisimiut er et godt sted at undersøge effekter af antibiotika udslip og AR i havet, fordi:
1) Spildevandet indeholder højere koncentration af antibiotika end spildevand, der har været gennem et
biologisk filter inden udledning
2) AR fra udledningsstedet kan sammenlignes med forekomsten af AR på sammenlignelige ”rene” steder
3) Det vides, hvad der udleveres af antibiotika fra hospitalet
Formålet med denne rapport er at beskrive forekomsten af AR i sediment fra Ulkebugten (Kangerluarsunnguaq). AR
mod 8 forskellige antibiotika undersøges. Resultaterne udgør en del af et større projekt fra sommeren 2012, hvor forekomsten i Ulkebugten 
sammenlignedes med forekomsten i Amerdloq fjord. Projektet ledes af Maria Granberg, Göteborgs Universitet.

fields.title: Metoder til rensning og desinfektion af kloakeret spildevand i  arktiske omrader med få indbyggere
fields.abstract:
Various
technical
solutions for simple and cheap wastewater treatment are investigated and
described in this project. The project is based on the s
ituation in the Greenlandic town of
Sisimiut, where wastewater is now discharged untreated into the recipient. The primary f
o-
cus has been to reduce the current amount of pathogens discharged into the surrounding
marine environment.
A small UV
-
system was co
nstructed, which was used to conduct laboratory tests where raw
wastewater from Sisimiut and Lundtofte (Denmark) were treated. Furthermore, the
wastewater from Sisimiut was treated with peracetic acid in the laboratory. The experiments
show that both metho
ds are suitable for treating raw wastewater, and that it is possible to
achieve a 1
-
log reduction by using approximately 25 mJ/cm
2
UV
-
C light and an average 3
-
log reduction by using 25 mg/L peracetic acid after using a filter with a mean size of 60 μm.
Bot
h methods can be improved compared to the conducted ones by carrying out pretrea
t-
ment of the wastewater which will reduce the number and the size of particles in the
wastewater, and the UV
-
treatment can be improved by adding a higher dose of UV
-
light.
In t
he project two types of wastewater treatment, which can be used as pretreatment, are
evaluated. The first option is to install a sedimentation tank where the amount and size of
the particles can be reduced in a very simple and low tech manner. Another tech
nology
which can be used as pretreatment is a separation system which treats the wastewater m
e-
chanically and chemically.
Different solutions are estimated and compared using a multi
-
criteria analysis with the fo
l-
lowing parameters: economy, user
-
friendline
ss of maintenance, lifespan, cleansing efficie
n-
cy, improvement of immediate environment and size. This analysis is a tool for decision ma
k-
ing and not a final solution as comprehensive calculations need to be carried out first.
Through the multi
-
criteria an
alysis the most suitable solution is found to be a combination of
the separation system and UV
-
disinfection. The separation system with disinfection using
peracetic acid is second place with almost the same score, and finally the sedimentation tank
with UV
-
disinfection comes at third place. The mentioned combinations are all good sol
u-
tions, and further investigations must be carried out before a final solution is implemented.

fields.title: Biotechnological potential of bacteria isolated from Greenlandic marine sediments
fields.abstract:
The need to find novel substances with potential to treat cancer, multiresistant microbial
in
fections and inflammatory diseases is more urgent than ever, why the focus on isolating
Actinobacte
ria
, known for their ability to produce bioactive compounds,
is increasing.
Previously it
was generally accepted, that marine Actinobacteria did not exist, y
et in recent years
Actinobacteria have been discovered with confirmed marine adaptation. The m
arine
Actino
bacteria
have shown to
comprise a dive
rse group of slow growing, Gram
positive bacteria,
with many different morphologies, making it difficult to sele
ct for only them
during culture and
isolation
. In the present study isolation methods for recovering marine Actinobacteria were tested
as part of a field project in Sisimiut, Greenland. Marine sediment from Ulkebugten was sampled
and heat
-
treated prior to
inoculation and incubation. A total of 26 isolates were recovered, from 9
samples taken from 3 different locations in the bay. All isolates were
analyzed
for phenotypic
traits (Gram
-
test, microscopy) as well as production of bioactive compounds (degradati
on of chitin
and carrageenan, inhibition of
Vibrio anguillarum
and
Staphylococcus aureus
). Several isolates are
proposed to be Actinobacteria and
several
strains showed chitinol
ytic
-
, proteolytic
-
and/or
antibacterial
bio
activity
, implying that the tested
isolation methods
favored
growth of marine
Actinobacteria
and other bioactive bacteria
.

fields.title: Database description and user guide
fields.abstract: Description of the ARTEK database´s structure and an user guide to the database.

fields.title: Havnebefæstelser i Arktis
Optimering af varmeproduktion fra affaldsforbrænding i Sisimiut ved frasortering og genanvendelse af udvalgte fraktioner
fields.abstract:
I Qeqqata Kommunia i Grønland har man en vision om at skabe et bæredygtigt samfund, hvilket bl.a. indebærer affaldshåndteringen i byen. På nuværende tidspunkt bliver kun glas, metal og farligt affald frasorteret inden forbrænding, men da affaldsbunkerne fortsat vokser ønskes det, at undersøge hvorvidt alternative behandlingsmetoder kan tages i brug. 
I denne artikel er der fokus på optimering af forbrændingsanlægget ved frasortering af henholdsvis den organiske fraktion (madaffald) og pap- og papirfraktionen, samt øget frasortering af glas og metal. Udover at glas og metal er en direkte årsag til driftsstop, blev det undersøgt, at det er fordelagtigt, rent energimæssigt, at frasortere disse fraktioner med så høj en frasorteringsgrad som muligt. En forlængelse af perioden mellem driftsstop vil indebære økonomiske og miljømæssige fordele. Udnyttelse af overskudsvarmen i sommerperioden kan ske ved at gennemføre den planlagte sammenkobling af fjernvarmenettene, som ligeledes vil give økonomiske gevinster.
Beregninger viser, at der er et energimæssigt incitament til at frasortere den organiske fraktion alene og ifølge med pap- og papirfraktionen. Ved at fjerne disse fraktioner fuldstændigt, vil mængderne af affald til forbrænding mindskes med knap 56 %. En frasortering af hele denne mængde, kan vise sig at ske på bekostning af varmeproduktionen fra forbrændingsanlægget. Det vil være bekosteligt og logistisk udfordrende at supplere med affald fra andre byer og bygder.
Kompostering og biogasproduktion, viste sig at være de to genanvendelsesmuligheder med potentiale i Sisimiut. Biogas kræver dog en tilførsel fra andre organiske affaldskilder. I begge tilfælde skal håndtering af restproduktet overvejes. Det anbefales at udføre mere omfattende studier før der træffes en endelig beslutning for valg af frasortering og genanvendelse.

fields.title: Biogas production from organic wastes in Sisimiut: Methane potentials and co-digestion of Shrimp waste, Brown algae and Sludge
fields.abstract: In Greenland the lack of treatment of waste and wastewater makes the seeking of an optimal solution to the problem a necessary task. A good way of reducing the waste is biogas production, since it allows sustainable energy supply and at the same time it is a way to manage the waste. The objective of the current study is to determine the methane potential of shrimp waste from the Royal Greenland factory in co-digestion with sludge and the brown algae Saccharina latissima. The experimental procedure involves anaerobic digestion in 12 series of batch reactors with different concentrations of substrates. The samples were incubated in mesophilic conditions and the methane production was measured for a 32-day period by measurements on a gas chromatograph. Additional measurements of total Nitrogen and Phosphorous were conducted. The pH was measured after the end of the experimental period in order to identify possible process imbalance and it was found within the range of 7-7.38. The algae combined with the other substrates seems to contribute synergistic to the digestion, presenting the highest biogas potential, which corresponds to 320.4 ml CH4/g VS d for medium VS concentrations. Moreover, it seems that co-digestion of the three substrates is also a promising solution yielding 260.5 ml CH4/g VS. This indicates that the synergistic effect of blending different substrates gives better results of methane production. The determination of methane potential is challenging due to the substrate heterogeneity and as regards algae their content of complex carbohydrates may create difficulties in the biochemical conversion. Therefore, repeatability of the procedures and maybe pre-treatment of the algae are suggested

fields.title: Building envelope characterization on a low-energy house in the Arctic
fields.abstract: The purpose of this article is to study how climate phenomena in the Arctic challenge low-energy buildings. Approximately 85% of all energy consumption in Greenland is used for heating homes and institutions (ref 5), so it is reasonable to focus on the energy consumption of a low energy building in Arctic. The report describes a method for obtaining detailed information about the heat dynamics of a Low-Energy building using reading of the heat consumption. Suitable models are going to be formulated for the heat dynamics of a Low-Energy House in Sisimiut, Greenland. These models are going to be implemented in CTSM-R which is a tool for estimating embedded parameters in a continuous time stochastic state space model. The applied models in the present method are grey-box models, which consist of a set of continuous time stochastic differential equations and observation equations. The data which will be used for this method are coming from a set of experiments for building energy performance, which was carried out in the winter period of 2012-2013. Finally, a suitable model is going to be demonstrated, providing a detailed knowledge of the heat dynamics of the Low-Energy House in Sisimiut.

fields.title: Design of a micro-hydro-power plant in Sisimiut Greenland
fields.abstract: This investigation was done with the goal of obtaining the knowledge of how to design and build a micro-hydro-power plant. The report took place in Sisimiut, Greenland and gave an insight of the conditions of the area concerning the implementation of a sustainable energy technology such as Micro-Hydro Systems (MHS) to the Greenlandic environment and community. An MHS was built in that area after the search of suitable sites.  The river at the chosen area had an average flow rate of 4.479 L/s and a measured head of 8.16m. The system had total head losses of 2.339m a 28.66% loss of head. The measured power produced was 102.81 W with a theoretical expectation of 359.063W. Even though the equipment didn’t work as it was meant to and the losses of the system were big, the result was that an MHS is a feasible solution for the remote areas of Greenland, with the condition of finding ways to eliminate the different losses as in the big hydro power plants working in Greenland, but without eventually losing the mobility and versatility that differentiated MHS in the first place.

fields.title: Emissionsundersøgelser af en losseplads i Grønland
fields.abstract:
Dette projekt har til formål at undersøge emissioner fra lossepladsen i Sisimiut, Grønland og potentielle miljøpåvirkninger herfra. Da kontrolleret affaldsdeponering stadig udgør den primære metode mht. affaldshåndtering, anses de største miljøpåvirkninger at være relateret til
dannelse og transport af lossepladsgas og perkolat. Lossepladsgas indeslutter bl.a. metan, kuldioxid, svovlbrinte og flygtige organiske forbindelser (VOC), mens perkolat kan indeholde tungmetaller, salte og organiske forbindelser. Screening af perkolatet, opsamlet på lossepladsen langs elven, skal vise indholdet af forureningskomponenter. To metoder til gasmålinger er benyttet. Først screenes området for udslag af VOC med en PID, herefter nedrammes stålrør ved udslagslokaliteter hvorved der benyttes en IR-detektor, sidst udtages jordprøver til analyse for VOC’er. Sæsonvariationer kan spille ind på dannelsen og transporten af perkolat og lossepladsgas, illustreret ved konceptuelle modeller, med højest aktivitet om sommeren. Der er
konstateret koncentrationer af lossepladsgas på pladsen i Sisimiut, svarende til hvad der tidligere er detekteret på en grønlandsk losseplads. Dette tyder på en udledning, hvilket kan
medføre en risiko for brand, forurening og sundhedsmæssige skade for arbejdere o. lign. på lossepladsen. Indholdet af forureningskomponenter er generelt lavt i perkolatet fra Sisimiut losseplads. Dette kan skyldes opsamlingsmetoden. Det vurderes, at den reelle  perkolatsammensætning, udgør en lokal trussel for det marine miljø, da tungmetaller og en række organiske forbindelse kan ophobes. Yderligere undersøgelser kan understøtte og verificere de konceptuelle modeller samt indflydelsesgraden på miljøet.

fields.title: Implementation of Wind Energy Into the Current Energy System in Qeqertarsuatsiaat
fields.abstract: The arctic environment is especially vulnerable due to the cold and harsh climate, therefore it is important to minimize pollution in these areas. Wind energy has become an important renewable energy source in the recent years. This study discusses the possibility of implementing a wind turbine into the current energy system in Qeqertarsuatsiaat, in order to reduce the CO2 emissions and the use of diesel-fuel. In order to investigate the possibility of erecting a wind turbine in Qeqertarsuatsiaat, the wind resource and environmental aspects are assessed, and a wind turbine and a site is selected. Also the current energy production in Qeqertarsuatsiaat, and the annual energy production for the possible wind turbine are calculated. If the turbine is erected in Qeqertarsuatsiaat, based on calculations, the yearly amount of diesel-fuel and CO2 emissions will be reduced with 10%. There is a potential for wind energy in Qeqertarsuatsiaat, but the uncertainties connected with the wind measurements used in this study are too high. Since the calculations for annual energy production is based on wind measurements, more reliable wind measurements is needed to obtain good estimates. Hence a meteorological mast needs to be erected, preferably at the turbine site.

fields.title: Environmental impacts of a hydro power plant's fresh water discharge into a Greenlandic fjord ecosystem
fields.abstract: A hydropower plant installed in 2009 at Kangerluarsuk Ungalleq fjord, West  Greenland increased the freshwater  runoff 10 to 20 times compared to prior natural conditions (1 m³s ¹ in 2009). This study presents data from the 5th  consecutive year of an environmental monitoring programme recording changes in hydrographic properties and ecosystem responses in the fjord related to the increased freshwater discharge and subsequent  effects  on native marine biota.  CTD profiles  showed a strong stratification at the inner part of the fjord (with salinity below 20 in the top surface layer) which was of decreasing intensity with distance from the hydropower plant – a trend which confirms the reported conditions of previous years. Chlorophyll concentrations were higher at the inner part (max. 0.65 µg l⁻¹) and protozooplankton⁻  abundances peaked in the middle with 5.4·10⁴ cells l⁻¹.  Data from benthic scrape samples throughout the fjord suggest, that the benthic community is affected by the introduced  freshwater  discharge  towards  higher  abundances  and  lower  diversity. Recommendations for  methodological  improvements  regarding data collection and handling under varying authorship in a long term project is provided.

fields.title: Environmental impact to the sea due to run-off from the landfill in Sisimiut.
fields.abstract:
Contaminants released from landf ills can be a threat to the Arctic environment. Previous studies
have shown elevated concentrations of contaminants in the surrounding environment of Greenlandic
landfi lls. The land ll in Sisimiut, Greenland, is located close to the sea with a stream running through
the land ll directly into the sea. The aim of this study was to investigate the impact on the aquatic
environment close to the land ll in Sisimiut. Samples were collected in the stream and ocean where
heavy metal and polychlorinated biphenyl (PCB) concentrations were measured, with focus on cadmium
(Cd), copper (Cu), nickel (Ni), lead (Pb), zinc (Zn) and iron (Fe). The samples included water,
sediment and biota.
Elevated concentrations of heavy metals and PCBs were found in locations close to the land ll compared
to reference stations further away. This trend was more visible in the stream, complying with
the expectation that the concentration gets diluted in the ocean. The measured concentrations were
compared with the Ecotoxicological Assessment Criteria (EAC), set by Oslo-Paris Commission for the
protection of the marine environment of the North-East Atlantic (OSPAR). Most of the samples were
polluted compared to EAC. Many of the samples were assessed as being highly polluted with Cu and
Zn, and with no risk from Cd and PCB.
Based on the results it was concluded that the land ll has an impact on the local aquatic environment.
Further studies can provide a better understanding of to what extent the landfi ll affects the
surrounding environment.

fields.title: Kildesortering af glas- og metalaffald i Sisimiut
Investigation of clay in Greenland with a focus on its future use in the production of bricks
fields.abstract: This paper investigates clay samples taken at Kangerlussuaq and Sisimiut with the intention of future brick production. The raw material for construction usage is spares in Greenland, except clay, which is a bedrock residue, created by the scour of the glacier ice. The samples have been gathered from close proximity locations with respect to the relative cities, so that a production of the bricks could become a reality. The tests performed on the samples is categorized into three; Geotechnical Investigation, Chemical and mineralogy and Pellets. The geotechnical investigations combined with the chemical and mineralogy investigations indicates that the samples originate from the same bedrock material, with respective differences in grainsize distribution. The production of the pellets indicates that bricks can be produced from the clay found at the investigated sample locations. Though it should be mentioned that larger scale production and testing in accordance with standards should be performed in order to give a proper answer regarding if it is relevant to begin a production of bricks in Greenland.

fields.title: in-situ burning of oil spills in Greenland
fields.abstract: The aim of the in-situ burning project is to research in Greenland about the expertise of people on this technic, the possibility of its extended use and the available equipment of the country for cleaning up the oil spills. Meetings with the public services related to the subject, discussing and pointing in the map with the help of experts and locals, the potential places for oil accidents were an integral part of the project work in Greenland. The interviews in Greenland show not only the stress of people about the potential of a contamination of the arctic environment, but also the fact that there is a shortage in the oil cleaning equipment. The viscosity and the density changes during the burning for two different oil types were investigated by an indoor experimental research, and the results gave us interesting plots for their dependence on the burning time and their correlation to each other. A comparison between fresh-burned oil samples and samples that have been taken and frozen for a long period was also available, but due to the small number of frozen samples, conclusions are limited.

fields.title: Lime stabilization of fine-grained sediments in Ilulissat (Greenland)
fields.abstract: The area of Ilulissat is characterized by the thick deposits of clayey fine-grained sediments. The changes experienced by the active layer of the permafrost increase the stabilization problems that clayey fine grained soils already have. As these sediments can be found above sea level, they usually deteriorate infrastructure in Greenlandic urban areas. Clayey soils can be stabilized by the addition of a specific small percentage, in weight, of lime. This study has obtained a value for optimum CaO content in a soil-CaO mixture through the use of several laboratory methods, as consistency limits analysis, or maximum dry density compaction with Proctor. CBR tests of the lime treated soil have been conducted with the intention to demonstrate the effectiveness of this stabilization method for low temperatures. As the obtained results were highly different from the expected ones, a challenging analysis of the applied procedure was driven.

fields.title: Structural Response of Marine Arctic Microplankton to Crude Oil Contamination using a Passive Dosing Technique involving Silicone O-rings
fields.abstract: Oil exploration is expected to be intensifies in the near future in Western Greenland. At present, knowledge about effects of exposure to oil compounds on Arctic microplankton is scarce. This is the first investigation of the effects of crude oil via passive dosing applying silicone O-rings as the polymer on the microplankton community in the Arctic. The specific aim was to investigate the effects of crude oil on composition, diversity and growth of microplankton using equilibrium passive dosing in an experimental set-up and estimating effects using chlorophyll a analyses along with microscopic analyses during 12 days of exposure experiment. This paper has its focus on the initial part of the study; effects on phytoplankton growth. Significant differences were found between zero and low exposure, and all high concentrations, respectively. Higher concentrations seemed to have an inhibiting effect on chlorophyll a and growth rate for phytoplankton, whereas normal exponential growth was seen for the lowest concentration and no exposure. This present study on the effects of crude oil on phytoplankton shows significant trends, but effects per se cannot be fully evaluated. Additional analyses on samples associated with the experiment need to be investigated to shed light on such aspects and provide a better understanding of the effects.

fields.title: Design, installation and testing of a monitoring system with a focus on energy efficiency and indoor climate for a new building in Sisimiut, Greenland 2013
fields.abstract:
The contractor Rasmus Kruse-Nielsen has prioritized energy eciency and indoor air
quality for the newly built house. As most houses in Greenland, the house has po-
tential risk for poor thermal comfort, high energy consumption and is exposed to the
risk of damage from humidity. Therefore it has been important to set up a monitoring
system that is be able to provide information on the building's characteristics, such as
insulation, ventilation, energy consumption and indoor climate including temperature,
carbon dioxide concentration and relative humidity. The main idea behind the monitor-
ing system is to "trim" the house performance as much as possible, while making sure
to get the best possible indoor climate. In this particular house a ventilation system is
installed, which is one of the  rst for Greenlandic households. The data collected by
the monitoring system will be able to tell how a ventilation system works in such an
environment.
This paper will describe the design, implementation and usage of the monitoring system
and give an overview of some of the potential risks associated with building in the Arctic.
Due to the fact that the building was not fully constructed in the summer of 2013, the
monitoring system is not physically installed yet.
The monitoring system has been designed to be aordable and robust enough to oper-
ate under Arctic conditions without any breakdown or loss of data. Furthermore, all
available data is accessible online for both researchers and for the residents. All data is
being stored both on a web server and on a portable 
ash drive large enough to con-
tain at least one year of measurements. In addition the project will serve as a base for
further building research in the Arctic and for investigation of solar heating for private
households in the Arctic. The project is funded by the Technical University of Denmark
(DTU) and the Commission for Scienti c Investigations in Greenland (KVUG).

fields.title: The mechanical properties of a fine-grained saline permafrost soil (Ilulissat)
fields.abstract:
It is a fact that the global mean temperature is rising, which, among other things, causes a retraction of the Greenlandic ice sheet. The shrinking ice sheet creates new habitable grounds for humans, areas which previously were covered in ice.

There is an increasing interest in the raw materials Greenlands underground has to offer. This puts pressure on the practically non-existing infrastructure and facilities built on untouched lands. Buildings in Greenland have traditionally been founded on hard rock, since construction on icy soils tends to be unstable. Contractors will depend on knowledge of icy soils when or if hard rock is not available for construction. 

Starting with a saline permafrost clay from Ilulissat, the purpose of this exam project, is to classify and investigate how the mechanical properties of a fine-grained, saline permafrost soil are affected by temperature changes at -3C og -5C. Furthermore the saline content and its affect on the mechanical properties are studied. This is done by using standard classification-, frequent reflectometry domain (FDR)- and Oedometer trials. The trials are carried out on borehole cores taken in 2011 just above the permafrost layer, frozen until now, and borehole cores taken in the permafrost layer in 2013 from 2 to 3 meters depth.

Classification trials are carried out using methods usually applied to frozen soil. Furthermore, the excess ice content and salinity are investigated. Generally speaking, it is seen that the cores from 2013 are clearly distinguishable from the cores taken in 2011, by having a lower bulk density, dry density, grain volume and saturation, with higher gravimetric water content, pore number and porosity than the samples taken in 2011. FDR trials are done on a frozen part of the core, to find permittivity and conductivity at temperatures in the interval -15C to +22C. Permittivity and temperature progress is applied to determine the unfrozen water content, which in general is bigger in samples from 2013 than samples from 2011. The freezing point in the samples is found to be 0C and  -1.5-(-0.9)C from 2011 and 2013 respectively. These results are supported by the a higher measured salinity in samples from 2013, thereby lowering of the freezing point.

Oedometer trials have been conducted on four samples from 2011 and two samples from 2013 in various locations. The experiments show that the mechanical properties are not affected by temperature changes in the range of -3C to -5C but clearly influenced by temperature changes in the range where the samples have their freezing point. 

A clear correlation between measured permittivity and change in unfrozen watercontent, is seen as changes in mechanical properties. Comparing the results with similar previously performed trials, shows that the parameters calculated by the data obtained during oedometer testing follows the trend, as expected.

Potential sources of errors are observed during execution of the trials and ideas on how to eliminate the effect of these are presented.
fields.comment:
Corrections:
P. 39: Add permittivity of ice to Figure 7.3.

Add shear strength to report (which can be seen in Appendix 5)

fields.title: Sound insulation by facades and windows in standard Greenlandic houses
fields.abstract: The article gives an account of sound insulation by façades and windows in standard Greenlandic houses in Sisimiut. During the fieldwork in Sisimiut, a series of sound insulation measurements was carried out in both old and new build dwellings in order to evaluate the effectiveness of their existing sound insulation using appropriate concepts. The measurement method used was the global method, for measuring the sound insulation of the whole façade. From the measurements derived that the sound insulation in the measured dwellings is all in all better for new built houses than for older houses. In order to gather the necessary information for proposing solutions for improved sound insulation, software simulations of the measured walls were done following the schematics of the dwellings and then the results of measurements and simulations were matched. After this matching, it was possible to introduce through software simulations proposals for using improved sound and thermal insulating materials in the dwellings. These proposals suggest the use of sheep wool insulation within the walls and also multiple laminated glass featuring deep cavity. Finally, the comparison of the results of Greenlandic houses with similar traditional Swedish constructions shows that there are not significant differences between them.

fields.title: Evaluering af effekten af et mekanisk-kemisk rensningsanlæg i Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
This report is based on the problem of the inadequate wastewater management in Greenland. At
the request of Qeqqata Municipality this report evaluates the efficiency of Al-2 treatment plant of
untreated wastewater from Sisimiut.
Student projects have previously concluded that the discharge of untreated wastewater has implications
for the recipient through increased nutrient concentrations and organic matter in Ulkebugten.
Problems of hygienic and aesthetic character such as pathogens, odors and materials e.g. toilet paper,
cotton swabs and pads occur. Antibiotic-resistant bacteria are found in wastewater and heavy
metals are found in both water and in the sediment. As a consequence the municipality wishes to
find a solution.
To investigate the efficiency of such a plant, experimental work with Al-2 treatment plant of wastewater
in Sisimiut was carried out in August 2013. The process in the plant involves a coagulation
with precipitation agents, flocculation with polymer and filtration. The system was installed in a
container at the Chocolate Factory, and wastewater was pumped up and treated in the plant. 5
samples of raw and treated wastewater as well as sludge were collected during 4 days. The samples
were frozen and sent to Denmark for further analysis.
During the period September to November 2013 analysis of wastewater and sludge samples were
performed to study the concentrations of nutrients, organic matter, 10 heavy metals and toxicity.
Furthermore, based on lists of drugs sold in Sisimiut over the last three years an assessment was
made of the removed fraction of drugs through the implementation of a water treatment plant.
Relative to the expectations of Al- 2 separation plant is a success. The results show that the plant
effectively removes phosphorus. There is a slight removal of inorganic and total nitrogen but not
to levels that compares to the Danish treatment plants. There is a significant removal of suspended
and organic substances in the wastewater. The chemical and biological oxygen demand, COD
and BOD is reduced a lot, but does not meet the Danish discharge requirements. It has not been
possible to conclude anything definite about the toxicity. The results of the heavy metal analysis
shows a removal of aluminum, lead, chromium, copper, iron and zinc from the wastewater. Concentrations
of manganese, nickel and arsenic are inexplicably higher in the treated samples than in
the untreated, while the results for cadmium removals are ambiguous. Compared to Danish ratios
the values for cadmium and copper in wastewater are 10 times higher. Based on 5 medicines, it is
estimated that a treatment will partially remove drug residues. Analyses of sludge samples show
that heavy metal concentrations do not exceed Danish limits for use of agricultural land, and the
sludge can be used for composting. The sludge can also be used to produce biogas.
Based on the results, it is concluded that the implementation of an Al-2 treatment plant with
continuous discharge in Ulkebugten will not solve the current problems.

fields.title: Wind Power Integration in the Nuuk Energy System
fields.abstract: This paper examines the feasibility of the wind energy implementation in the area of Nuuk. In order to acquire the social perception of the wind energy, a public survey is conducted face-to-face in a sample of 220 citizens. The wind resource is assessed using 1-year wind data from a near-by meteorological mast. Moreover, based on the international standards, the extreme wind occurrence and the wind turbulence levels are estimated so as to choose the most suitable wind turbine of the market for the site of Nuuk. The V100-1.8MW wind turbine with Annual Energy Production (AEP) of 4.8527 GWh is chosen and analyzed economically for installation. The Simple Payback Time (SPT) and the Discounted Payback Time (DPT) with a discount rate of 6 % are estimated to 9.1 and 13.6 years, respectively. A sensitivity analysis was conducted on the electricity price and the capital of the investment indicating its profitability when the selling price of electricity is above the threshold of 0.04 €/kWh or the capital costs less than 3 million €. Finally, the contribution of only one wind turbine to the energy production of the Buksefjord hydroelectric power plant, which is currently the main power supplier of the city of Nuuk, lengthens its operation lifetime by 2 months.

fields.title: Wind energy in Sarfannguaq
fields.abstract: The motivation behind the project is to give a better solution of wind energy around Sarfannguaq, Greenland. DTU have installed a small wind turbine and tested it for utilization of renewable energy for some years at Sarfannguaq. In order to increase the consumption of renewable energy, the classification of wind turbine is investigated, it has to be a place with high energy potential, but not too far away from the town because of high costs of installing cables and the loss of energy. By calculating the wind data in WAsP, the wind resource and annual energy production are estimated. The report summarized the suitable solution of renewable energy for the local inhabitant in Sarfannguaq.

fields.title: Potentialer for udnyttelse af PV i Grønland
fields.abstract:
Greenland’s natural environment and great distances makes it hard to transport electri-cal energy. Therefore is decentralized energy production an essential part of the Green-landic infrastructure. Most of the Greenlandic energy is produced through fossil fuels. Greenland, like many other countries, would like this part of the production to be substi-tuted with sustainable energy sources. Hydro power is already being used in several of the larger cities. As an alternative to that photovoltaic cells could be interesting, since there efficiency increases as the temperature decreases. Besides that reflections from the snow and ice cap contribute to the irradiance absorbed by the PV cells.
DTU has therefore installed a PV system in the city of Sisimiut located 40 km north of the Arctic Circle. This system consists of a Danfoss TLX Pro+ (8kW) inverter with build-in measurement equipment.
This report will contribute to improve the understanding of PV cells functioning in an arctic environment by designing and implementing a data acquisition system capable of logging relevant data with high resolution.
There is a need for this system since the inverter only has a storage capacity that is able to store a half year data at a time, besides the resolution of this data is really poor.
The data acquisition system will increase the resolution of data, increase the accessibil-ity of data and log several different values.
The system is developed with requirements of a low price, low energy consumption and a user friendly design. It is based on a Raspberry Pi mini computer.
First the system retrieves the data from the inverter, then saves it on a hard drive and the uploads the data to a server located at DTU.
By analyzing half a year’s data stored in the inverter, an insight in daily production was gained. A comparison of the inverter data and the theoretical expectations of the system shows that the system has produced more energy than expected.

fields.title: No project title
No project title
Test report for user guide
Toxikologitest of slagge fra affaldsforbrænding i Sisimiut
fields.abstract:
I denne rapport er slaggen fra affaldsforbrændingsanlægget i Sisimiut blevet undersøgt. Slaggen
bliver deponeret på Sisimiuts dump, som ligger ubeskyttet for vind og vejr i en lille dal ned til kysten. En del af den deponerede slagge ligger på toppen af en lille skråning der fører direkte ned
til den elv der løber inde fra landet ud igennem dumpen for at ende ved samme kyststrækning som dumpen ligger ud til.
Slaggen er blevet undersøgt for mængden af tungmetaller og eventuelle toksikologiske effekter
overfor havorganismer.
Feltarbejdet i Sisimiut er udført i august måned 2012. Den anvendte slagge er derfor også fra affald forbrændt omkring denne periode.
Resultaterne viser at slaggen overholder den tilladte grænseværdi for farligt affald som Vestforbrændingen forholder sig til. Slaggen overholder ikke grænseværdierne for indholdet af
deponerede stoffer ved kystnære deponier idet kobberindholdet er 6 gange større end tilladt.
Dette betyder at der kan være skadelige effekter på havmiljøet ved kyststrækningen der grænser
op til dumpen.
Det er desuden vist at en del tungmetaller udvaskes fra slaggen hvis denne kommer i kontakt med
eksempelvis havvand, regnvand eller smeltevand og der er derfor stor risiko for udvaskning til den nærliggende kysstrækning.
Forsøgene med havorganismer har vist at slaggen, selv i meget små mængder, er giftig for havmiljø og vandlevende organismer. Desuden ses det fra resultaterne, at udvaskningsvæske, fra
blandinger med slagge og havvand, også er usund for havorganismer, selv på kort sigt. Der er ikke lavet undersøgelser for akkumulerede toksikologiske effekter på længere sigt.
Ud fra ovenstående resultater kan det konkluderes, at den nuværende løsning for slaggedeponering på Sisimiuts dump er uholdbar. Det er næsten helt sikkert at kyststrækningen nedenfor dumpen lider overlast og, at havmiljøet på strækningen lige uden for dumpen har taget skade. Man bør derfor meget kraftigt overveje en anden løsning på slaggedeponeringsproblemet end det man anvender på nuværende tidspunkt. For at finde en optimal løsning på
slaggedeponeringsproblemet er det muligt at man skal lave en del flere forsøg for at finde en ny måde at deponere eller anvende slaggen på. Alternativt kan man lave forsøg med membransikring af dumpen.

fields.title: Brugen af permafrostfundering i Grønland
fields.abstract:
This thesis concerns foundations in permafrost in Greenland. The aim is to examine the bond to permafrost foundations in Greenland, and if it’s based on facts or if it’s a dogma. The project is developed from a historical aspect to clarify the relationship to permafrost foundations in the past and its influence on the relationship to permafrost foundation today. Furthermore, this thesis will determine whether permafrost foundations are relevant compared to other options.
Many engineers in Greenland have reasonable knowledge of permafrost foundations. However, the population’s knowledge of permafrost is extremely limited. Many believe that there is permafrost in case of damage of any kind even though it is derived from the winter frost.
The construction of roads will not always be able to avoid having to pass through areas of permafrost in the Northern cities, and newer methods for building roads would be beneficial.
The development of laws, standards and guidelines within the permafrost area in Greenland does not live up to the standard of modern society. Today’s laws do not help the engineers in performing better, and many engineers choose not take on projects concerning permafrost. This is due to of the lack of legislation which means that any errors will fall back to the engineer, as there are no standards for how the foundation should be built.
It is debatable what methods can be used for permafrost foundations in Greenland. However, permafrost foundations will only be relevant in colder areas with continuous permafrost such as Qaanaaq, Thule and Kangerlussuaq and areas close to the ice cap in the case of a future mining industry.
